original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the Tathagatas have attained enlightenment.

original: sar gyur de ni bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: sar gyur de ni bcu gsum pa /
translated: That stage is the thirteenth.

original: zhes pa ni lhag par mos pa'i spyod pa'i sa ni tshogs kyi lam mo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lhag par mos pa'i spyod pa'i sa ni tshogs kyi lam mo //
translated: The stage of devoted interest is the path of accumulation.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The stage of the joyous is the path of seeing.

original: dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The stages of stainlessness, the radiant, the brilliant, the difficult to conquer, the realized, the gone afar, the unshakable, the excellent wisdom, and the cloud of Dharma are the path of meditation.

original: kun tu 'od kyis ni mi slob pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: kun tu 'od kyis ni mi slob pa'i lam mo //
translated: The stage of the universal light is the path of no more learning.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That is twofold:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / de'i rjes la skyes pa ste dag pa 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / de'i rjes la skyes pa ste dag pa 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: the supramundane and the mundane that arises after it, the pure mundane.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzugs las shes bya ma lus pa'i ye shes kyis nam mkha'i dkyil dang mtshungs par chos thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa'i gzugs las shes bya ma lus pa'i ye shes kyis nam mkha'i dkyil dang mtshungs par chos thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: In non-conceptuality, the yogin sees all phenomena as equal to the center of space through the gnosis of all objects of knowledge.

original: de'i rjes las skyes pas ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan dang / mtshungs par rnal 'byor pas mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i rjes las skyes pas ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan dang / mtshungs par rnal 'byor pas mthong ngo //
translated: After that, the yogin sees [phenomena] as equal to an illusion, a mirage, a city of gandharvas, an echo, a reflection, and so forth.

original: de'i phyir na sa bcu gsum pa ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sa bcu gsum pa ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'i 'o //
translated: Therefore, the thirteenth stage is that of Great Vajradhara.

original: btsun mo ni shes rab po //
analyzed: btsun mo ni shes rab po //
translated: The queen is wisdom.

original: @123a * // dam chos bha ga ni nang du song ba'i dngos po'i rkyen du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: @123a * // dam chos bha ga ni nang du song ba'i dngos po'i rkyen du shes par bya ste /
translated: The bhaga of the sublime Dharma should be understood as the condition of the inner entity.

original: des na chos nyid ni sa bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: des na chos nyid ni sa bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the reality is the thirteenth stage.

original: 'jog par gyur pa ni 'od gsal ba la ye shes kyi sku 'jug par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'jog par gyur pa ni 'od gsal ba la ye shes kyi sku 'jug par mdzad de /
translated: The one who is placed is the gnosis body entering into clear light.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas so zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas so zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: By the stage of manifest enlightenment, there is a remainder of the words.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas 'od gsal ba rab tu bzhugs par gyur to zhes pa ni de'i bdag nyid du mdzad pa'o //üîΩde nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa bzhi pa'i bsgom pas de kho na nyid thob pas na 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas 'od gsal ba rab tu bzhugs par gyur to zhes pa ni de'i bdag nyid du mdzad pa'o // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa bzhi pa'i bsgom pas de kho na nyid thob pas na 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase the clear light and so forth indicates that Vajradhara, by means of the stage of the seal and contemplation, abides in the clear light. Abides means he becomes of that nature.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdo rje'i sku blangs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdo rje'i sku blangs so zhes bstan to //
translated: Then, and so forth indicates that, by means of the cultivation of the fourth stage, he attains reality, and then, in order to perform the welfare of the world, he takes the vajra body by means of the contemplation of union.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nam mkha'i kun gyi skabs na dpal //
analyzed: nam mkha'i kun gyi skabs na dpal //
translated: In the space of all, the glorious

original: zhes pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings ma lus pa las khyab pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings ma lus pa las khyab pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This means that he is endowed with the accumulations of merit and knowledge that pervade the entire realm of space.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rab tu bzhugs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rab tu bzhugs //
translated: Vajrasattva abides

original: zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: This means that he is the essence of non-abiding nirvana, the great Vajradhara.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor yang snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor yang snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The ultimate ma·πá·∏çala should be explained as before.

original: nges pa'i don zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definitive meaning is intended to be expressed by the stages of the pure mind, the self-consecration, the manifest enlightenment, and the union.

original: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bar du bsgom pa rdzogs pa na de nyid yang spros te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bar du bsgom pa rdzogs pa na de nyid yang spros te /
translated: When the meditation on the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala is complete, that itself is elaborated again

original: bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to be taught.

original: don 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, this very meaning, etc.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs ba zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs ba zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The past and future are the tathƒÅgatas of the three times.

original: zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis gcig tu mdzad pa ni zhes pa la /
analyzed: zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis gcig tu mdzad pa ni zhes pa la /
translated: The performance of the single [nature] by the stages of the moon, vajra, and so forth, etc.

original: lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor du zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i steng du rnam par dgod cing bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor du zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i steng du rnam par dgod cing bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúsubjugation‚Äù is that one should visualize and meditate on the mandala of devoted interest, on the moon and vajra, etc.

original: / de'i don du rdo rje ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: / de'i don du rdo rje ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gyi ming ngo //
translated: The name of the samadhi is stated by ‚Äúfor that purpose, the vajra . . .‚Äù

original: de la snyoms par zhugs zhes pa ni lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor du bdag po nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs zhes pa ni lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor du bdag po nyid du gnas so //
translated: ‚ÄúEnters into samadhi‚Äù means that one remains as the lord in the mandala of devoted interest.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas dbus kyi bdag po de nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang chen @123b po'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams myur du bsgom par bstan to //üîΩdes zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas dbus kyi bdag po de nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang chen @123b po'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams myur du bsgom par bstan to // des zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: By ‚Äúall tathagatas‚Äù and so forth, he teaches that the mandala of Great Vajradhara is quickly meditated upon by that very central lord.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid thob bo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams kyis sems can gyi don gyi bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid thob bo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams kyis sems can gyi don gyi bya ba bstan to //
translated: From ‚Äúby that‚Äù up to ‚Äúattains the state of Vajrasattva‚Äù teaches the activity for the welfare of sentient beings by the mandala of Great Vajradhara.

original: 'di ltar bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor myur du bsgom zhing de ma thag tu 'gro ba thams cad de'i rang bzhin du bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor myur du bsgom zhing de ma thag tu 'gro ba thams cad de'i rang bzhin du bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In particular, one should quickly meditate on the mandala of imagination and immediately transform all beings into that nature.

original: spyi'i don zhes pa ni lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor dang po sbyor ba'i phyogs gcig bstan pas so //
analyzed: spyi'i don zhes pa ni lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor dang po sbyor ba'i phyogs gcig bstan pas so //
translated: The general meaning is that the mandala of imagination is taught by the first application, and one part is shown.

original: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su 'gog par byed pa kun rdzob kyi byang chub kyi sems la brten pa'i bde ba chen po'i
analyzed: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su 'gog par byed pa kun rdzob kyi byang chub kyi sems la brten pa'i bde ba chen po'i
translated: In order to teach the ultimate mandala, by ‚Äúwhich samƒÅdhi‚Äù and so on, the great bliss based on the conventional awakening mind that completely stops the concepts of the aggregates and so on

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bstan to //
translated: is taught as ‚Äúentering into equipoise in samƒÅdhi.‚Äù

original: 'dir rtsa phran stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi khong stong zhes pa ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can lus 'di la ji snyed kyi ba spu yod pa de srid kyi rtsa rnams kyi dbus kyi khong stong ni nam mkha'i cha'o //
analyzed: 'dir rtsa phran stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi khong stong zhes pa ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can lus 'di la ji snyed kyi ba spu yod pa de srid kyi rtsa rnams kyi dbus kyi khong stong ni nam mkha'i cha'o //
translated: Here, the ‚Äúcavity‚Äù of the seventy-two thousand subtle channels is the cavity in the middle of the channels, which are as numerous as the body hairs of this body, which is of the nature of the five aggregates.

original: thabs kyi ye shes ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thabs kyi ye shes ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The gnosis of method is the gnosis of the appearance of the increase.

original: phung po la sogs pa zhes pa ni de'i rgyur gyur pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa zhes pa ni de'i rgyur gyur pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: The ‚Äúaggregates, etc.‚Äù are the natures of desire, etc., which are the causes of those.

original: thabs kyi ye shes shar bas zhes pa ni bshad ma thag pa de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: thabs kyi ye shes shar bas zhes pa ni bshad ma thag pa de nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the arising of the gnosis of method‚Äù is by that which was just explained.

original: dbang po gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dam pa dga' ba'i bde ba nyams su myong ba thob par gyur to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dam pa dga' ba'i bde ba nyams su myong ba thob par gyur to zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe two organs, etc.,‚Äù teaches that the experience of the bliss of supreme joy is attained.

original: des ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan to //
translated: By that, the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala is taught from the perspective of the purity of desire, etc.

original: sbas pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbas pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The hidden is taught for the purpose of teaching the characteristics of the phenomena of passion.

original: phung po lnga rnams so zhes pa nas de'i ngo bor gnas par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong pa gsum gyi rim pas thams cad stong pa la 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams so zhes pa nas de'i ngo bor gnas par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong pa gsum gyi rim pas thams cad stong pa la 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: From the five aggregates up to abiding in the nature of that teaches the entry into the emptiness of everything by the sequence of the three emptinesses.

original: mthar thug pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pas so //
translated: The ultimate is the entry into clear light.

original: de ltar lhag par mos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas lhag par mos pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su rdzogs par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar lhag par mos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas lhag par mos pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su rdzogs par bstan to //
translated: Thus, by the yoga of imagination, etc., teaches the perfection of Great Vajradhara by the yoga of imagination.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: That is an illustration,

original: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor yang rdzogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor yang rdzogs par mdzad do //
translated: for he also perfects the ultimate mandala.

original: yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa @124a * //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa @124a * //
translated: The pure and impure are the two mandalas.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa las skyes pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag po so sor bstan par byed do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa las skyes pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag po so sor bstan par byed do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the three syllables are the lord of the mandala circle, born from the stage of self-consecration and the stage of generation, so thinks [the BhagavƒÅn].

original: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to complete the stage of the yoga of imagination,

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa bstan par byed de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa bstan par byed de /
translated: he teaches the meditative concentration of equipoise.

original: sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid yin pas yi ge gsum po kho na sku la sogs pa ste dbyer med par brtags pas so //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid yin pas yi ge gsum po kho na sku la sogs pa ste dbyer med par brtags pas so //
translated: Since the nature of the body, etc., is the nature of the three syllables, the body, etc., are just the three syllables, because they are imagined as inseparable.

original: 'da' bar mi bya bas ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dor bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'da' bar mi bya bas ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dor bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not to be transcended, they are not to be abandoned by the yogis of the stage of generation.

original: sngags kyi yi ge rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og tu yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma dang padma gsum po rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og tu yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma dang padma gsum po rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: The three syllables and so forth refer to the three moons, suns, and lotuses that are generated from the transformation of the three syllables below the ultimate mandala.

original: de'i steng du yi ge gsum las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la zla ba la sogs pa 'jug par byas la /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge gsum las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la zla ba la sogs pa 'jug par byas la /
translated: Then, on top of those, the moon ma·πá·∏çala generated from the three syllables is entered with the moon, and so on.

original: chos kyi dbyings brjod pa'i sngags kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par sems brtan par byas la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings brjod pa'i sngags kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par sems brtan par byas la /
translated: The mind is stabilized in the form of the moon ma·πá·∏çala with the mantra that expresses the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de'i steng du yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa rnam par bsgoms pas spro ba dang bsdu ba yang byas te /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa rnam par bsgoms pas spro ba dang bsdu ba yang byas te /
translated: Then, the five-tined vajra generated from the transformation of the three syllables is visualized, and emanation and gathering are performed.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' //
translated: Vajrasattva arises from the transformation of that.

original: de'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The gnosis being and the concentration being are blessed in his heart.

original: mig la sogs pa dang sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Having consecrated the eyes, etc. , and the body, speech, and mind,

original: sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhal gsum pa dang / phyag drug pa'i gzugs 'chang bar gyur to //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhal gsum pa dang / phyag drug pa'i gzugs 'chang bar gyur to //
translated: he became one who bore the form of three faces and six arms upon a variegated lotus and moon disk.

original: des ni rnal 'byor bzhi'i bdag nyid can dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rnal 'byor bzhi'i bdag nyid can dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: This teaches the samadhi called ‚Äúfirst yoga‚Äù which has the nature of the four yogas.

original: sgrub thabs las bshad pa'i rim pas zhes pa ni mdor bsdus pa'i sgrub thabs nas bshad pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: sgrub thabs las bshad pa'i rim pas zhes pa ni mdor bsdus pa'i sgrub thabs nas bshad pa'i rim pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the manner explained in the sadhana‚Äù means in the manner explained in the Concise Sadhana.

original: rnal 'byor bzhi'i rim gyis /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bzhi'i rim gyis /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the process of the four yogas‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang / rjes su rnal 'byor dang / shin tu rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po'i rim pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang / rjes su rnal 'byor dang / shin tu rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po'i rim pas so //
translated: means by the process of the yoga, the subsequent yoga, the great yoga, and the yoga of great yoga.

original: sems dpa' gsum gyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyis /
analyzed: sems dpa' gsum gyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyis /
translated: ‚ÄúUp to the culmination of the three beings‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku rdzogs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku rdzogs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar ro //
translated: means up to the culmination of the completion of the body of Great Vajradhara, who has the nature of the three beings.

original: byin gyis brlabs @124b pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbus kyi bdag po'i zhal dang phyag mtshan gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs @124b pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbus kyi bdag po'i zhal dang phyag mtshan gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: The blessing and so forth indicate the special faces and hand implements of the central lord.

original: zhal gsum lta bur zhes pa ni phyag drug la sogs pas kyang nye bar mtshon par bya'o //üîΩ'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa rnams kyis //
analyzed: zhal gsum lta bur zhes pa ni phyag drug la sogs pas kyang nye bar mtshon par bya'o // 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas pa rnams kyis //
translated: The three faces and so forth are also illustrated by the six arms and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas pa la gnas pa'i 'khor thams cad kyis mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas pa la gnas pa'i 'khor thams cad kyis mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: The beings in the world means that all the retinues abiding in the limitless buddhafields see it.

original: drang ba'i don zhes pa ni rnal 'byor bzhi'i bdag nyid can dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin du bshad pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don zhes pa ni rnal 'byor bzhi'i bdag nyid can dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin du bshad pas so //
translated: The interpretable meaning is explained as the samƒÅdhi of the first yoga, which has the nature of the four yogas.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ril por 'dzin pa dang / rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na mngon du byas te /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ril por 'dzin pa dang / rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na mngon du byas te /
translated: The clear light and so forth are the clear light that is to be attained by the samƒÅdhis of totalities and of dissolutions, and it is actualized.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i lha'i sku zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid can blangs par gyur to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i lha'i sku zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid can blangs par gyur to zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one has taken up the deity‚Äôs form, which is the union of relative and ultimate truths, and which is characterized by the meditative absorption of union.üîΩüîΩ

original: chen po'i sgra'i don rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: chen po'i sgra'i don rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúgreat‚Äù has six aspects:

original: mchog ni dper na skyes bu chen po bzhin te skye dgu thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchog ni dper na skyes bu chen po bzhin te skye dgu thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Supreme, like a great person, meaning the supreme of all beings.

original: tshad med pa ni dper na rgya mtsho chen po bzhin tshang med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni dper na rgya mtsho chen po bzhin tshang med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Immeasurable, like the great ocean, meaning boundless.

original: mkhas pa ni dper na blo gros chen po de mkhas pa chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni dper na blo gros chen po de mkhas pa chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Skilled, like a great intellect, meaning greatly skilled.

original: brtson pa ni dper na chen por 'gro ba ste brtson 'grus kyis kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson pa ni dper na chen por 'gro ba ste brtson 'grus kyis kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Diligent, like a great traveler, meaning traveling everywhere with diligence.

original: spro ba ni dper na chen po dge ba ste dge ba'i las rnams la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: spro ba ni dper na chen po dge ba ste dge ba'i las rnams la brtson pa'o //
translated: Enthusiastic, like a great virtue, meaning diligent in virtuous actions.

original: rmad byung byed pa ni dper na bstan bcos chen po brtsam pa bzhin sngar med pa sprul pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rmad byung byed pa ni dper na bstan bcos chen po brtsam pa bzhin sngar med pa sprul pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Wondrous, like composing a great treatise, meaning skilled in creating what did not exist before.

original: 'dir ni mchog gi don gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni mchog gi don gtso bo yin te /
translated: Here, the supreme meaning is the principal one.

original: thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has the aspect of being supreme over all, is the meaning.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa nas snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bstan to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa nas snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bstan to //
translated: The ultimate truth, up to as before, teaches the body of Great Vajradhara.

original: nges pa'i don zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pa dang zung du 'jug pa rjod par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: nges pa'i don zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pa dang zung du 'jug pa rjod par 'dod pas so //
translated: The definitive meaning is the fourth stage and union, which he wishes to teach.

original: gzhung de tsam gyis ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud ston par bzhed pa dpal rdo rje 'chang chen pos ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi khams gdul bar bya ba'i don du gnas dang bgegs bskrad pa dang stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang / ye shes kyis gzhi dang gzhal yas khang bsgom pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang gdan gyi dbye ba dang chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid mngon du bya @125a * //
analyzed: gzhung de tsam gyis ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud ston par bzhed pa dpal rdo rje 'chang chen pos ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi khams gdul bar bya ba'i don du gnas dang bgegs bskrad pa dang stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang / ye shes kyis gzhi dang gzhal yas khang bsgom pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang gdan gyi dbye ba dang chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid mngon du bya @125a * //
translated: The glorious great Vajradhara, who asserts that the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra teaches just that, for the sake of taming the element of sentient beings of the future, taught the place, the expulsion of obstructors, the meditation on emptiness, the meditation on the ground and the immeasurable palace by way of exalted wisdom, the mandala of imagination, the ultimate mandala, the divisions of the seat and the actualization of the thatness of the dharmadhatu.

original: ba dang / sa bon las phyag mtshan bsgom pa dang / de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje 'dzin pa sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid bskyed pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i byin gyis rlob pa dang sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i mtshan nyid dang po'i rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin las bsgrub pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhugs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ba dang / sa bon las phyag mtshan bsgom pa dang / de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje 'dzin pa sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid bskyed pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i byin gyis rlob pa dang sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i mtshan nyid dang po'i rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin las bsgrub pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhugs so zhes bstan to //
translated: The samadhi of the first yoga, which has the characteristics of the consecration of the eyes, etc., and the consecration of body, speech, and mind, is taught as the establishment of the Great Vajradhara who resides on a variegated lotus and moon mandala.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud gsungs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa spro ba sngon du 'gro bar slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩde nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud gsungs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa spro ba sngon du 'gro bar slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the relationship between the master and the disciple, preceded by the emanation of the Tathagatas, the teacher says,

original: de'i dgongs pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po des mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spros te /
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po des mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams spros te /
translated: Then, the Bhagavat Vajradhara, having emanated the Tathagatas Akshobhya, etc.,üîΩand having gathered them together again,

original: de rnams kyi ched du brjod pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ched du brjod pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The very expression of that is taught.üîΩThe two aspects of the deity's body, etc. ,

original: lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpal rdo rje 'chang chen po'i lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gnyis bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rmad du byung ba zhes
analyzed: lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpal rdo rje 'chang chen po'i lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gnyis bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rmad du byung ba zhes
translated: The two aspects of the deity's yoga of glorious Great Vajradhara are taught to be the two corresponding samadhis, which are called wondrous.üîΩThe expression of all Tathagatas, etc. ,

original: bstan to // de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud de dang rjes su mthun par bstan to //
analyzed: bstan to // de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud de dang rjes su mthun par bstan to //
translated: teaches the concordance with the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa ni rim pa gnyis gtsor gyur pa'i rgyud kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa ni rim pa gnyis gtsor gyur pa'i rgyud kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-intentional is the teaching of the reality of the Tantra, which is primarily the two stages.üîΩNow, beginning with thus, etc. ,

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa sngon du 'gro bar gsol ba gdab par rigs te /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa sngon du 'gro bar gsol ba gdab par rigs te /
translated: it is proper to supplicate, preceded by worship.

original: de bas na dang po phyi dang nang gi mchod pa'i bye brag yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na dang po phyi dang nang gi mchod pa'i bye brag yongs su bstan to //
translated: Therefore, first the various external and internal worships are taught.

original: 'dus pa mdzad nas zhes pa ni mdun du thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa mdzad nas so //
analyzed: 'dus pa mdzad nas zhes pa ni mdun du thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa mdzad nas so //
translated: Having gathered together means having gathered all in front into one.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa rgyas pa de kho na nyid dam tshig rin po che'i rgya mtsho'i tshogs ni zhes pa la nye bar spyod pa lnga la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi lnga dag ni sprin dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa rgyas pa de kho na nyid dam tshig rin po che'i rgya mtsho'i tshogs ni zhes pa la nye bar spyod pa lnga la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi lnga dag ni sprin dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: That reality of the extensive worship of all the Tathagatas, the ocean-like assembly of the jewel commitments, is the five enjoyments and so forth and the five nectars, which are like clouds.

original: de dag gis yang dag par mchod nas so ;
analyzed: de dag gis yang dag par mchod nas so ;
translated: Having perfectly worshipped with those,

original: / drang ba'i don ni phyi'i me tog la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi'i mchod pa brjod par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: / drang ba'i don ni phyi'i me tog la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi'i mchod pa brjod par 'dod pas so //
translated: the interpretable meaning is the expression of the worship of external flowers and so forth and the nectar, which is desired.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ste zhes pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ste zhes pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas so //
translated: The form and so forth is the form vajra and so forth.

original: bud med rin po che zhes pa ni mchog tu bde ba ster bar byed pas na rin po che'o //
analyzed: bud med rin po che zhes pa ni mchog tu bde ba ster bar byed pas na rin po che'o //
translated: The jewel woman is a jewel because she bestows supreme bliss.üîΩHaving worshipped with those, having bowed down, they said this.

original: de rnams kyis mchod de @125b phyag btsal nas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni de'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis mchod de @125b phyag btsal nas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni de'i don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of that.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i thugs ka nas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga phyung ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i thugs ka nas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga phyung ste /
translated: From the heart of Great Vajradhara, the five Tathagatas emerge,

original: nye bar spyod pa lnga la sogs pa'i phyi'i mchod pa dang / bdud rtsi'i lnga'i mtshan nyid nang gi gsang ba'i mchod pa dang / gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pas /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa lnga la sogs pa'i phyi'i mchod pa dang / bdud rtsi'i lnga'i mtshan nyid nang gi gsang ba'i mchod pa dang / gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pas /
translated: and with the outer offerings of the five enjoyments and so on, the inner secret offering of the five nectars, and the secret offering of union with Rupadharani and so on,

original: de nyid la mchod cing 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nyid la mchod cing 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: they make offerings to him and make this request:

original: nges pa'i don ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i mchod par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i mchod par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definitive meaning is expressed as the offering of union.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba gdab pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba gdab pa'o //
translated: The Tathagatas make the request.

original: gnyis gcig tu gyur pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis gcig tu gyur pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The two becoming one means the nature of emptiness and compassion.

original: yi ge'i don ni de nyid tsam so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge'i don ni de nyid tsam so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the syllables is taught individually, just as they are.

original: rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor ba ni zhes pa la gsang ba'i rdo rje dang chu skyes sbyangs pa las khams gsum gyi bdag nyid dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor ba ni zhes pa la gsang ba'i rdo rje dang chu skyes sbyangs pa las khams gsum gyi bdag nyid dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The union of the vajra and lotus is the generation of the mandala circle with the nature of the three realms from the purification of the secret vajra and lotus.

original: spyi'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The general meaning is that it is the union of wisdom and means, because it is desired to express the creation stage.

original: shes rab dang / thabs yang dag par sbyor ba ni zhes pa la /
analyzed: shes rab dang / thabs yang dag par sbyor ba ni zhes pa la /
translated: The union of wisdom and means is the union of the wisdom and the method.

original: shes rab ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de snang ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de snang ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Wisdom has the characteristic of stopping the engaging consciousness and is the pristine consciousness of appearance.

original: thabs ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid 'gog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can snang ba mchod pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thabs ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid 'gog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can snang ba mchod pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The method has the characteristic of stopping the afflicted consciousness and is the pristine consciousness of the increase of appearance.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid can snang ba thob pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid can snang ba thob pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The union is the pristine consciousness of attainment, which has the characteristic of stopping the all-base consciousness.

original: don de lta bu ston par byed pa'i phyir na 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: don de lta bu ston par byed pa'i phyir na 'dus pa'o //
translated: The GuhyasamƒÅja is so called because it teaches that meaning.

original: sbas pa ni ye shes gsum rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid gtsor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbas pa ni ye shes gsum rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid gtsor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The hidden meaning is that the mantra repetition is the principal characteristic of the purification of the three intuitions.

original: yang na shes rab ni yi ge a'a:'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab ni yi ge a'a:'o //
translated: Alternatively, wisdom is the letter A.

original: thabs ni h'um ngo //
analyzed: thabs ni h'um ngo //
translated: Means is the letter Hum.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba ni ma ning gi ngo bo nyid yi ge aom mo //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba ni ma ning gi ngo bo nyid yi ge aom mo //
translated: Their union is the letter Om, which is the nature of the neuter.

original: de rnams kyi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pa la brten te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pa la brten te /
translated: In dependence on the process of their engagement, etc.,

original: dam tshig gam ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang / 'brel pas yan lag ma nyams pa'i mtshan nyid can bzlas pa ni 'dus pa'o zhes 'dod chags kyis chos bshad pa'i sgo nas rdo rje bzlas pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gam ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang / 'brel pas yan lag ma nyams pa'i mtshan nyid can bzlas pa ni 'dus pa'o zhes 'dod chags kyis chos bshad pa'i sgo nas rdo rje bzlas pa bshad pa'o //
translated: the mantra repetition, which has the characteristic of being unimpaired by the loss of any branch, is the assembly, which is the union of the pledge seal or intuition seal.

original: yang na shes rab ni zla ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba'o //üîΩthabs ni nyi ma dang 'dra ba'i snang ba mched pa'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab ni zla ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba'o // thabs ni nyi ma dang 'dra ba'i snang ba mched pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, wisdom is the appearance like the moon.üîΩMeans is the appearance like the sun.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba ni mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba ni mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba thob pa'o //
translated: Their union is the attainment of the appearance like the twilight.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las @126a * //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las @126a * //
translated: From their complete transformation,

original: yang dag par skyes pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes kyi sku ste /
analyzed: yang dag par skyes pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes kyi sku ste /
translated: The body of intuition which is like a magical creation, and which is correctly generated, is the ‚Äúassembly‚Äù of the two truths.

original: 'dus pa'o zhes kun rdzob kyi bden pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus pa'o zhes kun rdzob kyi bden pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the process of self-consecration, which is characterized by the realization of the conventional truth, has been explained.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dag tu 'dus pa ni zhes pa la nye bar mtshon pa 'di yin pas yong ba dang med pa dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / rnam pa dang / rnam pa med pa dang /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dag tu 'dus pa ni zhes pa la nye bar mtshon pa 'di yin pas yong ba dang med pa dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / rnam pa dang / rnam pa med pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúThe assembly of the conventional and ultimate truths‚Äù is an illustration, and so the existence and non-existence, entity and non-entity, form and formless,

original: rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / gcig pu dang / du ma dang / thabs dang shes rab la sogs pa gnyis po gcig tu 'dus pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / gcig pu dang / du ma dang / thabs dang shes rab la sogs pa gnyis po gcig tu 'dus pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: permanent and impermanent, singular and manifold, method and wisdom, etc., are all included in the single nature of the two.

original: gsal ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba ste rim pa bzhi pas thob par bya ba de kho nyid do //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba ste rim pa bzhi pas thob par bya ba de kho nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe clear light‚Äù is the clear light, which is the thatness to be attained by the fourth process.

original: de las byung ba ni zhes pa la myur ba'i rnam pas so zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni zhes pa la myur ba'i rnam pas so zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from that‚Äù is a quick way of saying ‚Äúarisen from the clear light.‚Äù

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba'i bar du ste zhes pa la /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba'i bar du ste zhes pa la /
translated: up to the state of Great Vajradhara, whose nature is nondual pristine awareness.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim par thob par bya ba phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ye shes so //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim par thob par bya ba phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ye shes so //
translated: The pristine awareness is the nature of the great seal, which is to be attained in the stage of union.

original: mthar thug pa ni rim pa bzhi pa dang lnga pa'i rim pas so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni rim pa bzhi pa dang lnga pa'i rim pas so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate is taught by the fourth and fifth stages.

original: de ltar gsang ba 'dus pa'i don bshad pas rim pa gnyis gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar gsang ba 'dus pa'i don bshad pas rim pa gnyis gsal bar bstan to //
translated: Thus, by explaining the meaning of the Guhyasamaja, the two stages are clearly taught.

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i zhes pa la /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i zhes pa la /
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows:

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po nas brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'brel pa drug gtsor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po nas brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'brel pa drug gtsor gyur pa'o //
translated: The six relationships, beginning with the one with the Tathagata, are the principal ones.

original: sba bar bya'o zhes pa la bya ba dang spyod pa'i tshul la gnas pa rnams la bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sba bar bya'o zhes pa la bya ba dang spyod pa'i tshul la gnas pa rnams la bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It should be concealed from those who are not fit vessels, that is, from those who do not abide by the way of action and conduct.

original: de rnams kyi gcig tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can ni zhes pa la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gcig tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can ni zhes pa la /
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows:

original: rigs brgya'i dbye ba la brten te bsdus pas sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi ngo bor bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs brgya'i dbye ba la brten te bsdus pas sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi ngo bor bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the essence of body, speech, and mind, based on the division into one hundred families.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is, means that the two stages are to be expressed.

original: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis zhus pa'o //üîΩde nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brda sprod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos legs so legs so sbyin pa sngon du 'gro ba rin po che lta bu dbang po rno ba rnams kyang spyod yul ma yin na
analyzed: des ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis zhus pa'o // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brda sprod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos legs so legs so sbyin pa sngon du 'gro ba rin po che lta bu dbang po rno ba rnams kyang spyod yul ma yin na
translated: Thus, the request of the Tathagatas.üîΩThen, etc., up to the explanation indicates that Vajradhara, having given the approval Excellent, excellent! to the question, How can those of dull faculties, such as sandalwood, etc.,

original: / tsandan la sogs pa dbang po dman pa rnams kyi ga las 'gyur ro zhes pas dri ba la lan mi rtsol zhes bstan to //
analyzed: / tsandan la sogs pa dbang po dman pa rnams kyi ga las 'gyur ro zhes pas dri ba la lan mi rtsol zhes bstan to //
translated: attain the supreme state, which is not even the domain of those of sharp faculties, such as the jewel-like ones who have gone before in generosity?

original: de lhar bya ba nas @126b brtsams te ston pa yin te zhes pa'i bar du ni dbang po rno ba dang dman pa dag gis yul ma yin pa nyid kyis dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud mi gsung ba'i phyir ngo mtshar dang rmad du byung ba'i de bzhin
analyzed: de lhar bya ba nas @126b brtsams te ston pa yin te zhes pa'i bar du ni dbang po rno ba dang dman pa dag gis yul ma yin pa nyid kyis dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud mi gsung ba'i phyir ngo mtshar dang rmad du byung ba'i de bzhin
translated: From ‚ÄúHe is the deity‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe teacher‚Äù indicates that the Tathagatas, who are wondrous and marvelous, do not teach the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra because it is not the domain of those of sharp and dull faculties.

original: gshegs pa rnams kyis rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gi ngo bo bdag cag rnams 'khor 'di yin pas /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsol cig ces gsol ba btab par gyur to zhes bstan to //

translated: Since we are the retinue, we are the nature of the person who is like a jewel, and therefore we request the Bhagavan to teach.

original: da ni snod du rung bar bya ba sngon du 'gro bas dpal gsang ba 'dus pa rab tu ston cig ces slar yang gsol ba gdab par bya ba'i phyir dam tshig dang sdom pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni snod du rung bar bya ba sngon du 'gro bas dpal gsang ba 'dus pa rab tu ston cig ces slar yang gsol ba gdab par bya ba'i phyir dam tshig dang sdom pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to request again, in order to demonstrate the glorious Guhyasamaja, having gone before by becoming a suitable vessel, the pledges, vows, etc. are stated.

original: de la dam tshig ni bsrung bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la dam tshig ni bsrung bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: Therein, the pledge is that which is to be guarded and that which is to be eaten.

original: de la bsrung bar bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga'i dam tshig ste dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa las log pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsrung bar bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga'i dam tshig ste dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa las log pa'o //
translated: Therein, that which is to be guarded is the pledge of the five Tathagata families, going for refuge to the Three Jewels, etc., and turning away from killing, etc.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su srog gcod pa la sogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su srog gcod pa la sogs pa kho na'o //
translated: In the direction of the completion stage, it is killing, etc.

original: bza' bar bya ba ni bdud rtsi dang lcags kyu la sogs pa myang bar bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba ni bdud rtsi dang lcags kyu la sogs pa myang bar bya ba kho na'o //
translated: That which is to be eaten is the nectar, hook, etc. which are to be tasted.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the cultivation of the four immeasurables, etc.

original: rigs gsum yongs su gyur pa ste zhes pa ni dam tshig la sogs pa blangs nas bskyed pa'i rim pa las lus dang ngag dang yid sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs gsum gyi gzugs su bdag nyid yongs su gyur nas lha'i
analyzed: rigs gsum yongs su gyur pa ste zhes pa ni dam tshig la sogs pa blangs nas bskyed pa'i rim pa las lus dang ngag dang yid sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs gsum gyi gzugs su bdag nyid yongs su gyur nas lha'i
translated: The transformation of the three families means that after taking the commitments and so on, one transforms oneself into the form of the three families such as Vairocana in order to purify body, speech, and mind through the creation stage.üîΩ

original: nga rgyal gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: The three families are the three families of Vairochana, etc. Having taken the vows, etc. means that, in order to purify body, speech, and mind through the creation stage, one transforms oneself into the form of the three families of Vairochana, etc. and abides with the pride of the deity.

original: yi ge'i don ni dam tshig la sogs pa tsam so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: yi ge'i don ni dam tshig la sogs pa tsam so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The meaning of the syllables is taught individually as the vows, etc.

original: yi ge gsum ste zhes pa ni yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las skyes bu'i lha'i sku'o //
analyzed: yi ge gsum ste zhes pa ni yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las skyes bu'i lha'i sku'o //
translated: The three syllables are the three syllables that arise from the transformation of the three consciousnesses.

original: spyi'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The general meaning is the creation stage, which is the basis of the three wisdoms.

original: ye shes gsum ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi gnyen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes gsum ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi gnyen por gyur pa'o //
translated: The three wisdoms are the antidotes to the three consciousnesses.üîΩThe three natures are the three natures of the three consciousnesses.

original: rang bzhin gyis snang ba rlung gi bzhon pa dang ldan pa ste /üîΩzhes pa ste 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi tshogs @127a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis snang ba rlung gi bzhon pa dang ldan pa ste /üîΩzhes pa ste 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi tshogs @127a * //
translated: The three natures are the three natures of the three consciousnesses.

original: dang bcas pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gsum po ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dang bcas pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gsum po ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The three, the engaging consciousness and so forth, are the counteragents.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i sgo nas sems rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i sgo nas sems rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the mind becomes pure by means of the counteragents and their antidotes.

original: sbas pa ni ye shes gsum po brtags pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbas pa ni ye shes gsum po brtags pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The hidden meaning is the stage of the purification of the mind, which has the characteristic of the three wisdoms, taught individually.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku ste zhes pa ni ye shes ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku ste zhes pa ni ye shes ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The body of wisdom is the fourth wisdom.

original: de las byung ba'i sku ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sku ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The body that arises from that is the wisdom body.

original: mthar thug pa ni 'od gsal ba dang zung du 'jug pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni 'od gsal ba dang zung du 'jug pa bstan pas so //
translated: The culmination is taught by the clear light and union.

original: sku la sogs pa bzhugs pa ste de mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir padma'i nang du dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro bar mdzad nas so //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa bzhugs pa ste de mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir padma'i nang du dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro bar mdzad nas so //
translated: The abiding of the body and so forth, and the performance of those, is the performance of the emanation of the mandala of the pledge in the lotus in order to make the body and so forth a suitable vessel.üîΩThe seed syllable that is generated from that

original: des bskyed pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge ste //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge ste //
translated: The seed syllable generated from that.üîΩ

original: zhes pa ni badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa phyung ba'i sngags kyi yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa phyung ba'i sngags kyi yi ge rnams so //
translated: This is the mantra syllables that are uttered, beginning with vajradhrk.

original: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i bar ro ;
analyzed: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i bar ro ;
translated: Having blessed them, up to here.

original: / spyi'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / spyi'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The general meaning is that, in order to describe the mandala of the Supreme Victor, which is a branch of the creation stage,

original: dbang po gnyis kyis snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje dang chu skyes phrad pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyis snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje dang chu skyes phrad pa'o //
translated: the union of the two organs is the meeting of the secret vajra and lotus.

original: rdo rje'i dam tshig ces pa ni rdo rje dang dam tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dam tshig ces pa ni rdo rje dang dam tshig go //
translated: The vajra commitment is the vajra and commitment.

original: rdo rje dang dam tshig ste zlas dbye ba'i bsdu ba'i don gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang dam tshig ste zlas dbye ba'i bsdu ba'i don gcig pa'o //
translated: The vajra and commitment are a single combined meaning of a compound.

original: yang na rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Or, the vajra is of the tathagatas or of the yogis.

original: dam tshig ni dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa kho na'o //
translated: The commitment is the union of the two organs.

original: byang chub sems kyi thig le zhes pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i sgras nam mkha'i dbyings ma lus pa na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'jug pas yongs su gyur pa'i shu kra'i thig le rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi thig le zhes pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i sgras nam mkha'i dbyings ma lus pa na gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'jug pas yongs su gyur pa'i shu kra'i thig le rnams so //
translated: The bindu of bodhicitta is the bindu of ≈õukra that has entered the space of the mother and is completely transformed by the entry of the tathƒÅgatas that abide in the entire realm of space.

original: dbang bskur bar bya ba ste zhes pa ni chos 'byung nang du thig le rnams kyis gsang ba'i dbang byin nas so //
analyzed: dbang bskur bar bya ba ste zhes pa ni chos 'byung nang du thig le rnams kyis gsang ba'i dbang byin nas so //
translated: ‚Äú To be empowered‚Äù is to be given the secret empowerment by the bindus in the inner bhaga.

original: sbas pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bstan pas so //
analyzed: sbas pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos bstan pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Concealed‚Äù is the teaching of the dharma of passion.

original: 'od gsal ba ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Luminous‚Äù is the fourth reality to be attained by means of the stage of the consort and samƒÅdhi.

original: chen po stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chags pa bar ma dang chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chen po stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chags pa bar ma dang chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Great emptiness‚Äù and so on are the middling, lesser, and passionless passions.

original: des byin gyis rlob pa ni chags pa bar pa la sogs pa bkag nas so //
analyzed: des byin gyis rlob pa ni chags pa bar pa la sogs pa bkag nas so //
translated: ‚Äú To be empowered by that‚Äù is to block the middling passion, and so on.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la ni 'khor gyi sems @127b kyi rgyud rnams su'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la ni 'khor gyi sems @127b kyi rgyud rnams su'o //
translated: ‚Äú In the mindstreams of disciples‚Äù is in the mindstreams of the retinue.

original: lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis gsal bar mdzad nas zhes pa ni sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku dbyer med par byas nas so //
analyzed: lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis gsal bar mdzad nas zhes pa ni sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku dbyer med par byas nas so //
translated: Having made clear the two aspects of the deity body, having made the mantra body and the intuition body inseparable.

original: mthar thug pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa dang zung du 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa dang zung du 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate is taught as the entry into clear light and union.üîΩThus, having made the request, etc.

original: de ltar gsol ba btab pa dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi snying gnas spros pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsol ba btab pa thos ma thag tu de rnams la dbang bskur bas chos bstan pa la dbang ba yin pas de dang 'brel pa'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor sprul par mdzad
analyzed: de ltar gsol ba btab pa dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi snying gnas spros pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsol ba btab pa thos ma thag tu de rnams la dbang bskur bas chos bstan pa la dbang ba yin pas de dang 'brel pa'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor sprul par mdzad
translated: The emanated Tathagatas from one's heart, having heard the request, are consecrated by them, and since they are empowered to teach the Dharma, they emanate the intuition ma·πá·∏çala connected with that.

original: do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: do zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ni legs par sbyangs pa'i yan lag dang nying lag dang ldan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya padma'i nang du byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le las sprul pa'i dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ni legs par sbyangs pa'i yan lag dang nying lag dang ldan pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya padma'i nang du byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le las sprul pa'i dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The intuition ma·πá·∏çala is the emanated pledge ma·πá·∏çala in the lotus of the pledge seal, who has well-developed limbs and secondary members, from the bindu of enlightenment spirit.

original: de'i sprul pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de'i sprul pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach the samƒÅdhi that is in accord with the emanation of that,

original: ye shes nyid sgron ma yin pas na zhes smos to //
analyzed: ye shes nyid sgron ma yin pas na zhes smos to //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthe lamp of pristine consciousness.‚Äù

original: ye shes ni dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i phyir sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes ni dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i phyir sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Pristine consciousness is the one-pointed mind in order to emanate the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: sgron ma ni sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgron ma ni sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu bstan pas so //
translated: The lamp is the ma·πá·∏çala of the emanation that is revealed.

original: yi ge'i don ni de tsam bar du bstan pas so //
analyzed: yi ge'i don ni de tsam bar du bstan pas so //
translated: The meaning of the syllables is taught up to that point.

original: sems can rnams kyi rgyud la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gdul bya'i rgyud la'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rgyud la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gdul bya'i rgyud la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the continuum of sentient beings‚Äù and so on refers to the continuum of the disciples.

original: ye shes ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: Pristine consciousness is the pristine consciousness of the utterly pure dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de nyid kyis rab tu snang ba mdzad pas na ye shes kyi sgron ma ste mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis rab tu snang ba mdzad pas na ye shes kyi sgron ma ste mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Since it is the one who illuminates that, the lamp of pristine consciousness is Ak·π£obhya.

original: spyi'i don ni mdo sde la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gyod pa bzlog pas so //
analyzed: spyi'i don ni mdo sde la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gyod pa bzlog pas so //

translated: Having experienced the reality of clear light through the stages of passion, passionlessness, and the middle state of passion, he emanates the Tathagatas and so forth with the mantra of extraction, ‚Äúvajra-dhi,‚Äù and so forth, as will be explained.

translated: The provisional meaning is that the mere pure hand-symbol is taught.

original: bde ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: bde ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of the two joys

original: zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: is the nature of the samƒÅdhi of union.

original: nges pa'i don ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definitive meaning is the teaching of reality that is the result.

original: des na ni yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: des na ni yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'i mtshan nyid lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, the two yogas of the deity, with the characteristics of pure and impure, are taught.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor pa gzhan rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor pa gzhan rnams la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should understand the others of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas reg bya rdo rje ma'i padma nas byung ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas reg bya rdo rje ma'i padma nas byung ste /
translated: The one called Great Vajradhara, previously explained, arises from the lotus of Spar≈õavajrƒÅ,

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyangs te /
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyangs te /
translated: purifies the realm of sentient beings who engage in anger,

original: mngon par dga' ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bzhag nas slar yang gshegs te /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bzhag nas slar yang gshegs te /
translated: and, having placed them in the world of Abhirati, returns again.

original: phyogs bcu la gzigs pa sngon du 'gro ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la mar la mar thim pa bzhin du gyur nas mi bskyod pa kho na ai ndra n'i la dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa
analyzed: phyogs bcu la gzigs pa sngon du 'gro ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la mar la mar thim pa bzhin du gyur nas mi bskyod pa kho na ai ndra n'i la dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa
translated: Having first looked into the ten directions, the body, speech, and mind vajras of Great Vajradhara dissolve into the mind vajra like butter into melted butter, and he becomes Ak·π£obhya alone, with three faces like Indra‚Äôs column, and six arms.

original: cung zad mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: cung zad mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: He has slightly bared fangs.

original: padma dang nyi ma'i steng du rdo rje'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal gsum gyi nye bar mdzes pa /
analyzed: padma dang nyi ma'i steng du rdo rje'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal gsum gyi nye bar mdzes pa /
translated: He sits in vajra posture upon a lotus and sun, with three faces‚Äîblue, white, and red‚Äîthat are very beautiful.

original: rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma dang dril bu dang yid bzhin nor bu dang / ral gri 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma dang dril bu dang yid bzhin nor bu dang / ral gri 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds a vajra, wheel, lotus, and bell in his four right hands and a wish-fulfilling gem and sword in his two left hands.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i cod pan can mdog kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spro bar gyur to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i cod pan can mdog kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spro bar gyur to //
translated: He has a crown of Great Vajradhara and emanates a halo of light with five colors.

original: de gsum gyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de gsum gyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The phrase having the nature of those three means having the nature of the three beings.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can //
translated: Having the nature of the two truths

original: zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor gyi skabs su zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor gyi skabs su zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: means that, in the context of the yoga of the completely pure deity, he has the nature of union.

original: gcig tu gyur pa de ni rdo rje 'chang chen po de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa de ni rdo rje 'chang chen po de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: Having become one, he is of the nature of Great Vajradhara.

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes kha dog gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes kha dog gi khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase as before refers to the distinction of color.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gcig gi ngo bor rab tu gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gcig gi ngo bor rab tu gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase Great Vajradhara and so forth indicates that he should be made to abide in a single nature.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' chung ba zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i lhag ma'i ting nge 'dzin gyi lhag mar gyur pa phyag rgya sbyar ba dang mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' chung ba zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i lhag ma'i ting nge 'dzin gyi lhag mar gyur pa phyag rgya sbyar ba dang mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po nyid ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase the small Vajrasattva indicates that he is the remainder of the remaining meditative stabilization of the first application, and he is the lord of the Akshobhya mandala, who is the application of the seal.

original: sgra ji bzhin zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa dang dang po'i sbyor ba ston par byed pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa dang dang po'i sbyor ba ston par byed pas so //
translated: The phrase in accordance with the words refers to the teaching of the first union, which is a branch of the creation stage.

original: @130a * // dang po'i sbyor ba'i 'og tu zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog ston par byed de /
analyzed: @130a * // dang po'i sbyor ba'i 'og tu zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog ston par byed de /
translated: The phrase after the first union and so forth teaches the mandala of the supreme victor.

original: sems can rmongs pa rnams rnam par sbyong bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni gti mug gi rigs can gdul bya rnams sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rmongs pa rnams rnam par sbyong bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni gti mug gi rigs can gdul bya rnams sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in order to purify deluded sentient beings refers to the purification of disciples who are of the deluded type.

original: zhi ba'i tshul ni zhi ba'i las kyi rab 'byams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par snang mdzad yin zhes mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: zhi ba'i tshul ni zhi ba'i las kyi rab 'byams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par snang mdzad yin zhes mtshon par byed do //
translated: The phrase the method of peace indicates Vairocana, who is the nature of the infinite varieties of peaceful activities.

original: rgyal ba'i ngang tshul can zhes pa ni so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'i sems can rnams las rgyal ba ste bdud do //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i ngang tshul can zhes pa ni so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'i sems can rnams las rgyal ba ste bdud do //
translated: The phrase victorious nature refers to the demon who is victorious over sentient beings who abide on the stage of ordinary beings.

original: bdud ni lha'i bu la sogs pa'i bdud rnams so //
analyzed: bdud ni lha'i bu la sogs pa'i bdud rnams so //
translated: The demon is the demons of the sons of the gods and so forth.

original: de dag las rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i chos kyi 'khor los rgyal bas ni dzi na dzi ka go //
analyzed: de dag las rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i chos kyi 'khor los rgyal bas ni dzi na dzi ka go //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma with twelve spokes is turned by the Victorious One with the twelve aspects of the noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ste bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ste bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four noble truths are the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and the path.

original: sdug bsngal ni shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / lam bsgom par bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is to be known, the truth of origin is to be abandoned, the truth of the path is to be practiced, and the truth of cessation is to be actualized.

original: sdug bsngal shes zin pa dang / kun 'byung spong pa dang / lam bsgom pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du byas so zhes mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes zin pa dang / kun 'byung spong pa dang / lam bsgom pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du byas so zhes mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The twelve spokes are the paths of seeing, cultivation, and no learning, which are the knowledge that suffering has been known, the abandonment of origin, the cultivation of the path, and the actualization of cessation.

original: rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi 'khor lo yin zhes la 'dod do //
analyzed: rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi 'khor lo yin zhes la 'dod do //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma has the characteristics of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: drang ba'i don ni nyan thos dang theg pa chen po'i lta ba tsam bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don ni nyan thos dang theg pa chen po'i lta ba tsam bstan pas so //
translated: The provisional meaning is taught by the mere view of the Listeners and the Great Vehicle.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes pa ni kun du 'od kyi sa'i skad cig ma dang pos thob bar bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes pa ni kun du 'od kyi sa'i skad cig ma dang pos thob bar bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: The phrase through the vajra-like meditative stabilization refers to the special meditative stabilization to be attained by the first moment of the ground of Universal Illumination.

original: nges pa'i don gyi bzhi pa dang lnga pa'i rim pa dag so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pas dzi na dzi ka ces spro ba'i rjes su chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya nas phyi rol du byung ste /üîΩgti mug la spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams sbyangs nas 'og min gyi gnas su bzhag nas slar yang gshegs te /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi bzhi pa dang lnga pa'i rim pa dag so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro // rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pas dzi na dzi ka ces spro ba'i rjes su chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya nas phyi rol du byung ste / gti mug la spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams sbyangs nas 'og min gyi gnas su bzhag nas slar yang gshegs te /
translated: This is because the fourth and fifth stages of the definitive meaning are taught separately.

original: phyogs bcur gzigs pa sngon du 'gro bas bcom ldan 'das kyis shar phyogs su sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i gdan la 'khor lo'i steng du rdo rje dkyil mo krung du bzhugs pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcur gzigs pa sngon du 'gro bas bcom ldan 'das kyis shar phyogs su sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i gdan la 'khor lo'i steng du rdo rje dkyil mo krung du bzhugs pa /
