original: 'khor lo la sogs pa phyag mtshan drug 'dzin pa sku mdog dkar po rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa phyag mtshan drug 'dzin pa sku mdog dkar po rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs so zhes bstan to //
translated: The white color of the six-handed one, holding the wheel and so forth, is Vairocana.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The just as the words is as before.

original: kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems zhes pa ni bde @130b ba chen po'i rgyu mthun pas rin thang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems zhes pa ni bde @130b ba chen po'i rgyu mthun pas rin thang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conventional awakening mind is the cause of great bliss, because it is priceless.

original: de las byung ba zhes pa ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du spros pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba zhes pa ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi nang du spros pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising from that is the emanation into the mandala of the pledge beings.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The concentration should be understood in the same way.

original: drang ba'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang ba'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The interpretable meaning is because it is intended to express the stage of generation.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems te zhes pa ni /
translated: The ultimate awakening mind is

original: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: the reality of clear light.

original: de las byung bas na zhes pa ni bdag byin gyis rlob pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa dag brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung bas na zhes pa ni bdag byin gyis rlob pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa dag brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising from that is because it is intended to express the stages of self-consecration and union.

original: nges pa'i don ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The definitive meaning is the stage of completion, because it is taught individually.

original: bsam pa thams cad yongs su zhes bya ba la sogs pas rin chen 'byung ldan gyi don dang ldan pa'i mtshan so sor bstan to //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs su zhes bya ba la sogs pas rin chen 'byung ldan gyi don dang ldan pa'i mtshan so sor bstan to //
translated: The meaning of Ratnasa·πÉbhava is taught individually by the words ‚Äúfulfilling all wishes‚Äù and so forth.

original: re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na zhes pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can rnams la dbul ba nyid bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na zhes pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can rnams la dbul ba nyid bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFulfilling all wishes‚Äù is the meditative absorption of the sky treasury, because it destroys the poverty of sentient beings.

original: drang ba'i don ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog brjod par mdzad par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog brjod par mdzad par 'dod pas so //
translated: The provisional meaning is the stage of action, because it is taught by the one who composes the King of Tantras of Action.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i rin po che zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i rin po che zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The ‚Äújewel of the limit of reality‚Äù is the reality of clear light, which is to be attained by the fourth stage.

original: nges pa'i don ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa /
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa /
translated: The definitive meaning is the stage of manifest enlightenment,

original: rjod par byed pas so //
analyzed: rjod par byed pas so //
translated: because it is taught by the one who composes the King of Tantras of Manifest Enlightenment.

original: nam mkha' ltar gos pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes pa ni skye ba bzhis bsdus pa'i sems can thams cad tha dad pa rnams gcig tu yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar gos pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes pa ni skye ba bzhis bsdus pa'i sems can thams cad tha dad pa rnams gcig tu yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wisdom of equality, which is like space and unstained, is because of the complete knowledge of all sentient beings, who are included in the four kinds of birth and are different, as being one.

original: nor gyis dregs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nor mang pa'i phyir nga rgyal gang la yod pa de rnams la nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin las rin po che la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'i sgo nas dregs pa bcag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor gyis dregs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nor mang pa'i phyir nga rgyal gang la yod pa de rnams la nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin las rin po che la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'i sgo nas dregs pa bcag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are arrogant with wealth and so on, because of their great wealth, he brings down their arrogance by means of a rain of jewels and so on from the sky treasury meditative absorption.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs su bzhugs zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du rdo rje dang padma'i ting nge 'dzin las phyung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs su bzhugs zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du rdo rje dang padma'i ting nge 'dzin las phyung ste /
translated: Residing to the right of the BhagavƒÅn, as before, he emerges from the vajra and lotus meditative absorption.

original: de nas yang phyi rol du gshegs te /
analyzed: de nas yang phyi rol du gshegs te /
translated: Then again he goes outside.

original: nga rgyal can gyi sems can gyi khams sbyangs te rin po che'i 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la rab tu gnas par byas nas slar yang gshegs te /üîΩzhal gsum pa phyag drug pa rin po che la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan 'dzin pa sku mdog ser po bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs su sna tshogs padma dang zla ba @131a * //
analyzed: nga rgyal can gyi sems can gyi khams sbyangs te rin po che'i 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la rab tu gnas par byas nas slar yang gshegs te / zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa rin po che la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan 'dzin pa sku mdog ser po bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas phyogs su sna tshogs padma dang zla ba @131a * //
translated: Having purified the realm of proud sentient beings, and having established them in the buddha-field called RatnƒÅkara, he again went to the buddha-field called RatnƒÅvatƒ´,

original: dang rin po che'i gdan la bzhugs nas so //
analyzed: dang rin po che'i gdan la bzhugs nas so //
translated: where he sat on a multicolored lotus, moon, and jewel seat to the right of the Blessed One, with three faces, six arms, holding jewel and other insignia, and yellow in color.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The literal meaning is as before.

original: 'dod chags kyi 'dod chags rab tu spang ba'i don du zhes pa ni 'dod chags ni de kho na nyid la chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'dod chags rab tu spang ba'i don du zhes pa ni 'dod chags ni de kho na nyid la chags pa'o //
translated: For the sake of abandoning attachment to attachment, attachment to reality,

original: yang 'dod chags ni nyon mongs pa nyid do //üîΩdon des spong ba ste gsal ba'o ;
analyzed: yang 'dod chags ni nyon mongs pa nyid do // don des spong ba ste gsal ba'o ;
translated: and attachment to afflictions,üîΩhe taught the great attachment of the bodhisattvas, which is the abandonment of attachment.

original: / mchog tu dga' ba ni 'dod chags chen po 'od gsal ba chen po'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / mchog tu dga' ba ni 'dod chags chen po 'od gsal ba chen po'i rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme joy is the natural outflow of great attachment, great clear light.

original: byang chub kyi sems yin la zhes pa ni kun rdzob pa'i rdzas kyi tshul can shu kra'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yin la zhes pa ni kun rdzob pa'i rdzas kyi tshul can shu kra'o //
translated: The bodhicitta is the semen, which is the substance of the relative.

original: de las byung ba ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas rdzogs zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas rdzogs zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚Äú Arisen from that‚Äù is up to ‚Äúperfected by the stages of the ma·πá·∏çala of the pledge.‚Äù

original: drang ba'i don ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang ba'i don ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin rang bzhin thams cad ni //

analyzed: sbas pa ni ye shes gsum rnam par spyod pas so //

original: ril por 'dzin pa dang @133a * //

analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa de ni ril por 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ting nge 'dzin to //

analyzed: rdo rje ye shes ni bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes so //

analyzed: btsun mo mchog gi phun sum tshogs pa'i sgras spyan la sogs pa'i rigs kyi yum bshad do //

original: rnam par snang mdzad nyid kyis dbang bskur ba'i rdo rje zhes pa ni 'phags pa gshin rje gshed po dpal rnam par snang mdzad kyi cod pan can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: sgra ji bzhin pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam brjod pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam brjod pas so //

analyzed: dmyal ba zhes pa ni yi dags kyi lhag par bdag po'o //

analyzed: khro bo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes pa ni thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba'i bar ro //

analyzed: drang ba'i don ni khro bo'i rnam pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The interpretable meaning is that it is stated in order to express the aspect of wrath.

original: rmongs pa'i mun pa ste zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i mun pa ste zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid do //

original: ma rig pa ni de'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni de'i khyad par ro //

original: don dam pa'i bden pa shes pa ni phyag rgya dang sngags kyis thob par bya ba'i sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'od gsal bas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa shes pa ni phyag rgya dang sngags kyis thob par bya ba'i sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'od gsal bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe knowledge of ultimate truth‚Äù is the clear light that has the characteristic of the purified mind to be attained by means of the seal and the mantra.

analyzed: des pa'i don ni sems rnam par dag pa nyid bstan pas so //

original: sgra ji bzhin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: rin chen 'byung ldan zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nang na chos kyi rgyal srid kyi bdag po'i mtshan nyid kyis mngon par byang chub thob pa'i phyir dang nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nang na chos kyi rgyal srid kyi bdag po'i mtshan nyid kyis mngon par byang chub thob pa'i phyir dang nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ratnasa·πÉbhava means that he is the lord of the sovereignty of the Dharma among all the TathƒÅgatas, because he has attained manifest enlightenment by the characteristic of being the lord of the sovereignty of the Dharma, and because he possesses the sky-treasury samƒÅdhi.

original: de'i cod pan du rdo rje gang la yod pa zhes pa ni 'phags pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i cod pan du rdo rje gang la yod pa zhes pa ni 'phags pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He who has the vajra on his crown means that ƒÄrya AparƒÅjitƒÅ is of the Ratnasa·πÉbhava family.

original: drang ba'i don ni shes rab mthar byed kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang ba'i don ni shes rab mthar byed kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The provisional meaning is because it teaches only the generation stage of Praj√±ƒÅntak·πõt.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis pas thob par bya ba de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis pas thob par bya ba de kho na nyid do //

original: nges pa'i don ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa brjod pas so //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa brjod pas so //
translated: The definitive meaning is because it expresses the completion stage.

original: shes rab kyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi blos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi blos so //
translated: By wisdom means by the mind which has the characteristic of the path of seeing and cultivation.

original: nyon mongs pa zhes pa ni khams gsum la gnas pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes pa ni khams gsum la gnas pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions are the attachment, etc. that abide in the three realms.

original: de la mdor bsdus pa ni 'dir bden pa bzhi po la brten te /üîΩnyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdus pa ni 'dir bden pa bzhi po la brten te / nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, in brief, they are abandoned on the basis of the four noble truths.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la brten te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la brten te /
translated: The afflictions are abandoned on the basis of the truth of suffering,

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa bcu spong ba yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: the ten afflictions of the path of seeing are abandoned.

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom dang lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom dang lnga'o //
translated: They are attachment, anger, delusion, pride, and doubt,

original: lta ba yang rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: lta ba yang rnam pa lnga yin te /
translated: and the five views:

original: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar @134a * //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar @134a * //
translated: the view of the perishing aggregates,

original: 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: the view of holding a view as paramount, and the view of holding morality and asceticism as paramount.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa la brten pa bdun spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa la brten pa bdun spang bar bya ste /
translated: The seven afflictions that are abandoned on the basis of the truth of origin

original: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba ma gtogs pas so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba ma gtogs pas so //
translated: except for the afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la brten te bdun po de nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la brten te bdun po de nyid do //

original: lam gyi bden pa la brten te mthong ba'i lam gyis sngar bshad pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba ste spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la brten te mthong ba'i lam gyis sngar bshad pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba ste spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Seven are abandoned by the path of seeing, as previously explained, plus the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni bzhi ste /

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: They are attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams sum cu rtsa drug nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams sum cu rtsa drug nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, in the desire realm there are thirtysix afflictions to be abandoned.

original: de bzhin du ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su khong khro bcu ma gtogs par dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su khong khro bcu ma gtogs par dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //

original: gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus te /

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spang ba dang / bcu ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya'o //

original: gang yang nyon mongs pa'i chos gzhan rnams 'du byed kyi phung por 'dus pa de dag nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kho na yin te /

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /

original: sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / 'tshig pa dang / kho na 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa rnam pa du ma'o //
analyzed: sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / 'tshig pa dang / kho na 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa rnam pa du ma'o //
translated: They are deceit, dissimulation, anger, hostility, hypocrisy, malice, envy, avarice, conceit, pride, etc.

original: bcu ni kun du sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bcu ni kun du sbyor ba ste /
translated: There are ten fetters:üîΩ1-5. the five lower fetters: 1. attachment, 2. repugnance, 3. attachment to form, 4. attachment to non-form, 5. conceit;

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / rgyags pa dang ; 'gyod pa dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / khro bo dang / 'chab pa dang / bcu'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / rgyags pa dang ; 'gyod pa dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / khro bo dang / 'chab pa dang / bcu'o //
translated: 6-10. the five higher fetters: 6. ignorance, 7. overesteeming of morality and certain kinds of spiritual practices, 8. craving for existence, 9. excitability, 10. nescience.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag ni zag pa'i sgras bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag ni zag pa'i sgras bshad pa'o //
translated: These defilements are also called fluxes.

original: de la zag pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la zag pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: There are three fluxes:

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: the defilement of desire, the defilement of existence, and the defilement of ignorance.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams su song ba'i nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa rnam pa lnga ma gtogs par rdzas sum cu rtsa gcig gi ngo bo ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams su song ba'i nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa rnam pa lnga ma gtogs par rdzas sum cu rtsa gcig gi ngo bo ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The defilement of desire is the thirty-one real entities that are the afflictions of the desire realm, excluding the five types of ignorance.

original: de bzhin du yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa rnam pa bcu ma gtogs par rdzas lnga bcu rtsa gnyis kyi @134b ngo bo srid pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa rnam pa bcu ma gtogs par rdzas lnga bcu rtsa gnyis kyi @134b ngo bo srid pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the defilement of existence is the fifty-two real entities that are the afflictions of the form and formless realms, excluding the ten types of ignorance.

original: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa ni rdzas bco lnga'i bdag nyid can ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa ni rdzas bco lnga'i bdag nyid can ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The defilement of ignorance is the fifteen real entities that are the ignorance of the three realms.

original: dmigs pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba dag ni rjes su 'gro bas na nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba dag ni rjes su 'gro bas na nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions are so called because they are in accord with the object and the correct application.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas kun du 'khor bar zag par byed pas na zag pa'i don to //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas kun du 'khor bar zag par byed pas na zag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of defilement is that they cause the defilement of the six sense bases to flow out from the peak of existence down to Avƒ´ci Hell.

original: chu bo bzhi ste /
analyzed: chu bo bzhi ste /
translated: There are four rivers:

original: 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Desire, existence, views, and ignorance.

original: de la 'dod pa'i zag pa kho na 'dod pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i zag pa kho na 'dod pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: The flood of desire is the same as the flood of the attachment to desire.

original: srid pa'i zag pa nyid ni srid pa'i chu bo ste /üîΩlta ba rnams ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa nyid ni srid pa'i chu bo ste / lta ba rnams ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The flood of existence is the same as the flood of the attachment to existence.

original: khams gsum pa'i lta ba dag ni lta ba'i chu bo ste rdzas sum cu rtsa drug go //üîΩma rig pa'i zag pa nyid ni /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i lta ba dag ni lta ba'i chu bo ste rdzas sum cu rtsa drug go // ma rig pa'i zag pa nyid ni /
translated: The flood of views is the same as the flood of the attachment to views.üîΩThe flood of ignorance is the same as the flood of the attachment to ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i chu bo ste khyer bar byed pas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i chu bo ste khyer bar byed pas so //
translated: The flood of ignorance is the same as the flood of ignorance.

original: bzhi po de nyid ni sbyor ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzhi po de nyid ni sbyor ba bzhi ste /
translated: The four yokes are the same as the four floods.

original: sbyor bar byed pas na sbyor ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pas na sbyor ba'i don to //
translated: They are called yokes because they yoke one to the suffering of the three realms.

original: len pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: len pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The four clingings are the clingings to:

original: 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i len pa'o //
translated: desire, views, morality and ascetic practices, and to the theory of a self.

original: de la 'dod pa'i len pa ni rdzas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i len pa ni rdzas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The clinging to desire is the twenty-four things beginning with the eye.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa ni bdag tu lta ba'i len pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa ni bdag tu lta ba'i len pa ste /
translated: The clinging to views is the thirty-four things beginning with the two views of individuality and grasping an extreme.üîΩThe clinging to morality and ascetic practices is the ten things beginning with the view of grasping a perishable collection.üîΩThe clinging to a theory of self is the four things beginning with the ignorance that is independent of the other ten ignorances.

original: rdzas sum cu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: rdzas sum cu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: There are thirty-eight real entities.

original: lta ba'i len pa ni rdzas sum cu'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i len pa ni rdzas sum cu'o //
translated: The grasping of views is thirty real entities.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs len pa ni rdzas su drug go //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs len pa ni rdzas su drug go //
translated: The grasping of morality and ascetic practices is six real entities.

original: bzung bar byed pas na len pa'i don to //
analyzed: bzung bar byed pas na len pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of grasping is that of being bound.

original: mdud pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdud pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four knots:

original: mnar sems dang / gnod sems dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'di bden pa zhes mngon par zhen pa ni lus kyi mdud pa'o //
analyzed: mnar sems dang / gnod sems dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'di bden pa zhes mngon par zhen pa ni lus kyi mdud pa'o //
translated: the knot of the body is the adherence to the view that the body is real, the adherence to the view that morality and ascetic practices are supreme, and the adherence to the view that the Buddha is real.

original: sgrib pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five hindrances:

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / rgod 'gyod dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / rgod 'gyod dang / the tshom mo //
translated: sensual desire, malice, torpor and sleep, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

original: mthong ba'i lam du shes pa bcu ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du shes pa bcu ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang /
translated: On the path of insight, there are ten cognitions: cognition of the doctrine, subsequent cognition, conventional cognition, cognition of another's thoughts, cognition of unsatisfactoriness, cognition of the origin, cognition of cessation, cognition of the path, cognition of exhaustion and cognition of non-arising.

original: 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of cessation, the cognition of the path, the cognition of exhaustion, and the cognition of non-arising.

original: bzod pa brgyad de /
analyzed: bzod pa brgyad de /
translated: Eight acceptances:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal la rjes su 'gro ba shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang lam gyi bden @135a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal la rjes su 'gro ba shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang lam gyi bden @135a * //
translated: Acceptance of the cognition of the factors with regard to suffering, and likewise acceptance of the subsequent cognition with regard to suffering, and likewise with regard to the origin, cessation, and path.

original: pa rnams la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: pa rnams la shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the path and the truth of the path.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bar gyur pas 'dod pa thob pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mthong bas spong ba nyon mongs pa la brten te 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bar gyur pas 'dod pa thob pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mthong bas spong ba nyon mongs pa la brten te 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the arising of the acceptance of the cognition of the factors with regard to suffering, the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing suffering in the realm of desire are ceased.

original: chos shes pa yang de rnams kyi de kho na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la brten te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa yang de rnams kyi de kho na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la brten te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition of the factors also arises in dependence on the attainment of that very nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal nyid rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa'i bzod pa skye bar 'gyur bas gzugs dang gzugs med pa na gnas pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spong ba'i nyon mongs pa thob pa blangs te 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa'i bzod pa skye bar 'gyur bas gzugs dang gzugs med pa na gnas pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spong ba'i nyon mongs pa thob pa blangs te 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the acceptance of the knowledge of the subsequent conformity with suffering is generated, the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the suffering of the form and formless realms are relinquished and their obtainment is arrested.

original: rjes su 'gro ba shes pa yang de rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i thob pa blangs te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba shes pa yang de rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i thob pa blangs te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The knowledge of the subsequent conformity also arises, taking the obtainment of nirvana of those beings.

original: de la bzod pa rnams ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la bzod pa rnams ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: Among those, the acceptances are the uninterrupted paths.

original: shes pa ni grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: shes pa ni grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: The knowledges are the liberated paths.

original: de ltar kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams su sems bzhi bzhir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams su sems bzhi bzhir shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the four truths should be understood to have four aspects each.

original: sems rnam pa bcu drug gis bag la nyal brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs pas bden pa bzhi po mngon du gyur ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rnam pa bcu drug gis bag la nyal brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs pas bden pa bzhi po mngon du gyur ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning the eighty-eight latent states through the sixteen aspects of mind, one manifests the four truths and also attains the result of stream entry.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bcu lhag par gyur ba ni 'dod pa na gnas pa bzhi dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa la gnas pa gsum gsum mo //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bcu lhag par gyur ba ni 'dod pa na gnas pa bzhi dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa la gnas pa gsum gsum mo //
translated: The ten that are to be abandoned by cultivation are the four that are in the realm of desire, and the three that are in the realms of form and of the formless, respectively.

original: de la 'dod pa na gnas pa ni 'dod chags dang // khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na gnas pa ni 'dod chags dang // khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa gcig tu byas te /
translated: In the realm of desire, there are four: desire, hatred, pride, and ignorance.

original: rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
translated: These are divided into nine classes,

original: dman pa dang / bar ba dang / rab kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: dman pa dang / bar ba dang / rab kyi dbye bas so //
translated: by the distinctions of weak, medium, and strong.

original: de la rab kyi rab nyon mongs pa la dman pa'i yang dman pa 'phags pa'i lam ni gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de la rab kyi rab nyon mongs pa la dman pa'i yang dman pa 'phags pa'i lam ni gnyen po yin no //
translated: The weak of the weak is the antidote to the strong of the strong.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa drug spangs pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa drug spangs pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: The once-returner has abandoned six classes of defilements.

original: rnam pa dgu po spangs pas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu po spangs pas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: The non-returner has abandoned nine classes.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dang / de rnams kyi yang bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba dgu gnyen po yin pa de bzhin du yang sa re re la nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dang / de rnams kyi yang bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba dgu gnyen po yin pa de bzhin du yang sa re re la nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu dang /
translated: Just as the nine levels of affliction of the desire realm and the nine antidotes to them, called uninterrupted and liberated paths, exist, so too there are nine levels of affliction for each of the remaining three higher absorptions and formless realm levels.üîΩ

original: de rnams kyi gnyen po yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen po yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as the nine levels of affliction that abide in the desire realm and the nine antidotes that are called uninterrupted and liberated paths are antidotes, so too the nine levels of affliction on each level and their antidotes should be understood in the same way.

original: de'i phyir snga ma snga ma spong bas phyi ma phyi ma nyes pa rnams mi gnas pas srid pa'i rtse mo pa dman yang dman pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa rab tu spangs @135b pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma snga ma spong bas phyi ma phyi ma nyes pa rnams mi gnas pas srid pa'i rtse mo pa dman yang dman pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa rab tu spangs @135b pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the latter faults do not abide due to the abandonment of the former, even though the summit of existence is inferior, one becomes an arhat through completely abandoning the aspects of affliction.

original: 'bras bu bzhi'i bar na gnas pa rnams ni lam du zhugs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi'i bar na gnas pa rnams ni lam du zhugs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Those abiding between the four results should be understood as entering the path.

original: sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can skad cig ma bco lnga'i bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam dang / bcu drug pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can skad cig ma bco lnga'i bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam dang / bcu drug pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis mdor bsdus te /
translated: The path of seeing has the nature of fifteen moments of the subject that is the four noble truths such as suffering, and the path of cultivation is the sixteenth moment.

original: lam gnyis kyis nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam gnyis kyis nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In brief, the two paths cause the complete abandonment of the afflictions.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
translated: Because of not seeing and seeing, there is the path of seeing.

original: der ni skad cig bco lnga yin //
analyzed: der ni skad cig bco lnga yin //
translated: It has fifteen moments.

original: bcu drug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam //
analyzed: bcu drug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam //
translated: The sixteenth is the path of cultivation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: And so on.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la dmigs pa'i shes rab de lta bus nyon mongs pa rnams mthar byed pas na shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la dmigs pa'i shes rab de lta bus nyon mongs pa rnams mthar byed pas na shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: Therefore, because the afflictions are terminated by that kind of wisdom that focuses on the paths of seeing and cultivation, wisdom is the terminator.

original: drang ba'i don ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i lam brjod do //
analyzed: drang ba'i don ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i lam brjod do //
translated: The interpretable meaning is that the path of discord and the path of antidote are expressed.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ni shes rab ste zhes pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ni shes rab ste zhes pa la /
translated: Wisdom is the nature of conceptualization.

original: rtog pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of conceptualization:

original: snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba thob pa'o //
translated: appearance, increase of appearance, and attainment of appearance.

original: de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal bar 'jug pas mthar byed pas shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal bar 'jug pas mthar byed pas shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: Since they are terminated by the process of mantra and seal, entering into clear light, he is the wisdom terminator.

original: nges pa'i don ni sems rnam par dag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni sems rnam par dag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definitive meaning is the expression of the pure mind.

original: rdo rje dam tshig gis zhes pa ni khro bo'i gzugs dang ha ha dgod pa dang gsod pa la sogs pa drag po las kyi rab 'byams rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig gis zhes pa ni khro bo'i gzugs dang ha ha dgod pa dang gsod pa la sogs pa drag po las kyi rab 'byams rnams kyis so //
translated: By the adamantine commitment means by the extensive range of fierce actions such as the form of wrath, the laughter of ha ha, and killing.

original: gdug pa ni brgya byin la sogs pa phyogs skyong ba rnams so //
analyzed: gdug pa ni brgya byin la sogs pa phyogs skyong ba rnams so //
translated: The wicked are the guardians of the directions such as Indra.

original: de rnams skrag par mdzad pa ni dgug pa dang phur bus gdab pa dang / brdung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams skrag par mdzad pa ni dgug pa dang phur bus gdab pa dang / brdung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Terrifying them is the characteristic of summoning, nailing down, and beating.

original: yang na zhes bya ba 'dis phyogs gzhan bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba 'dis phyogs gzhan bshad pa yin te /
translated: Or else, this indicates another position.

original: 'jig rten pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni /
translated: The mundane dakinis are

original: au ma dang / bde phyogs ma dang / dpal mo dang / grags pa ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: au ma dang / bde phyogs ma dang / dpal mo dang / grags pa ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Uma, Bhadra, Sri, Yasodhara, and so forth.

original: de rnams skrag par mdzad pa ni nan gyis phrogs te longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams skrag par mdzad pa ni nan gyis phrogs te longs spyod pa'o //
translated: The terrifying is the enjoyment of the objects by the force of the conquest.

original: khro bo'i gzugs kyis de dag gdul ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: khro bo'i gzugs kyis de dag gdul ba'i phyir ro // ji skad du /
translated: It is because of the form of wrath that they are to be subdued.

original: bde mchog las /üîΩsangs rgyas thams cad lhag mos pas //üîΩsdig med stobs kyis mnan nas kyang //
analyzed: bde mchog las / sangs rgyas thams cad lhag mos pas // sdig med stobs kyis mnan nas kyang //
translated: As it is said in the Cakrasamvara Tantra:üîΩBy the power of the Buddha's compassion,üîΩand by the power of the Buddha's strength,

original: gnod dang zil gyis gnon pa yis //
analyzed: gnod dang zil gyis gnon pa yis //
translated: the Buddha, who is the conqueror of all worlds,

original: 'jig rten thams cad rab 'joms byed //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad rab 'joms byed //
translated: conquers all the worlds.üîΩThe Buddha, who is the conqueror of all worlds,

original: shin du gdug pa drag po mchog / sems can khams ni du ma rnams //
analyzed: shin du gdug pa drag po mchog / sems can khams ni du ma rnams //
translated: binds the many realms of sentient beings

original: byi shor rgu ba bcings pa yis//
analyzed: byi shor rgu ba bcings pa yis//
translated: with the bonds of the five hooks,

original: @136a * // sems can khams ni sbyor bar mdzad //üîΩnan gyis sgyu ma'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: @136a * // sems can khams ni sbyor bar mdzad // nan gyis sgyu ma'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: and liberates them into the realm of sentient beings.üîΩThe Buddha, who is the conqueror of all worlds,

original: sdig med stobs kyis bkug byas nas //
analyzed: sdig med stobs kyis bkug byas nas //
translated: having attracted them by the power of the Buddha's strength,

original: mtshon cha lnga yi go bgo zhing //
analyzed: mtshon cha lnga yi go bgo zhing //
translated: and having them don the armor of the five weapons,

original: 'jig rten kun las rgyal bar 'gyur //üîΩ'gro ba brtan dang g-yo ba dag //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun las rgyal bar 'gyur // 'gro ba brtan dang g-yo ba dag //
translated: conquers all the worlds.üîΩThe Buddha, who is the conqueror of all worlds,

original: 'grub pa thams cad las rgyal zhing ;
analyzed: 'grub pa thams cad las rgyal zhing ;
translated: having conquered all the worlds,

analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas //

analyzed: thog ma tha ma bar ma med //

analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer dang mtshungs pa //

analyzed: gzhan dag rmugs byed 'jigs pa ste //

original: 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin du snang //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin du snang //

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis ka las min rgyu med min //
analyzed: gnyis ka las min rgyu med min //
translated: not from both, not without cause,

original: dngos po gang dang gang du yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang du yang //

original: skye ba nam yang 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: skye ba nam yang 'thad ma yin //
translated: arising is never tenable.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang //
translated: And in the treatise it is said:

original: 'dir ni kha cig mi skye zhing //
analyzed: 'dir ni kha cig mi skye zhing //

original: kha cig kyang ni 'chi mi 'gyur //
analyzed: kha cig kyang ni 'chi mi 'gyur //

original: sems kyi ngo bor rnam gnas pa'i //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bor rnam gnas pa'i //

original: 'khor ba nyid du shes par bya //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid du shes par bya // zhes 'byung ngo //

original: srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las kyang //üîΩdngos po las kyang dngos mi skye //üîΩdngos med las kyang skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las kyang // dngos po las kyang dngos mi skye // dngos med las kyang skye mi 'gyur //
translated: And in the Transmigration in Existence S≈´tra it says:üîΩThings do not arise from things.üîΩThey do not arise from non-things.

original: dngos po rtag tu skye ba ni //
analyzed: dngos po rtag tu skye ba ni //
translated: Things do not arise from themselves.

original: 'khrul pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khrul pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Like sky-flowers, they are always non-arisen.

original: kampa la'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang //
analyzed: kampa la'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang //
translated: And ƒÄcƒÅrya Kamala≈õƒ´la says:

original: de nyid yang dag mtha' yin te //
analyzed: de nyid yang dag mtha' yin te //

original: de nyid de bzhin de stong nyid //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin de stong nyid //
translated: That is suchness, that is emptiness.

original: de nyid mnyam nyid de grol ba //
analyzed: de nyid mnyam nyid de grol ba //
translated: That is equality, that is liberation.

original: de nyid rnam rig tsam nyid de //
analyzed: de nyid rnam rig tsam nyid de //
translated: That is mere awareness.

original: chos kun nang du chud pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos kun nang du chud pa'i phyir //
translated: Because all phenomena are included within it,

original: ring por ma yin gam du min //
analyzed: ring por ma yin gam du min //
translated: It is not far, nor is it near.

original: de nyid rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is difficult to realize,

original: de yi ngo bo spyod mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo spyod mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its nature is not experienced.

original: de bas na dang po ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid thabs kyi dbang gis ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na dang po ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid thabs kyi dbang gis ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could suchness, whose nature is non-arisen from the beginning, arise through the power of methods?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: de kho na nyid ni thabs gang gis kyang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni thabs gang gis kyang skye bar mi 'gyur te /

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i @138a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i @138a * //

original: phyir ro // 'on kyang de rang bzhin gyis grub kyang de'i dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin gyi skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir ro // 'on kyang de rang bzhin gyis grub kyang de'i dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin gyi skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, even though it is intrinsically real, the union of the two organs is the cause that manifests it, but it is not the cause that produces it.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu ni rnam pa bcu yang yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu ni rnam pa bcu yang yin te /
translated: Because there are ten types of causes:üîΩProduction, abiding, manifestation,üîΩchange, condition, attainment,

original: skye dang gnas dang gsal byed dang // 'gyur ba rkyen dang thob pa dang / sbyor dang gzhan dang rten dang ni //üîΩrgyu ni rnam pa bcu ru bshad //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang gsal byed dang // 'gyur ba rkyen dang thob pa dang / sbyor dang gzhan dang rten dang ni // rgyu ni rnam pa bcu ru bshad //
translated: application, other, support,

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: and cause are explained as ten types.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsal ba tsam rgyu yin na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsal ba tsam rgyu yin na /

original: de kho na nyid la skyed pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la skyed pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: 'on te skad kyi dbyings don du ma yin pas mdzas pa'i sgra ni gsal bar byed pa tsam la 'jug gi byed pa po'i nus pa la ma yin no zhes shin tu rgyas pas chog go //
analyzed: 'on te skad kyi dbyings don du ma yin pas mdzas pa'i sgra ni gsal bar byed pa tsam la 'jug gi byed pa po'i nus pa la ma yin no zhes shin tu rgyas pas chog go //
translated: Or, since the phonemes are not the meaning, the beautiful sound is applied to the mere expression, not to the power of the agent.

original: da ni rnal ma dpyad par bya ste //üîΩsgra ji bzhin pa ni khro bo'i rgyal po dbyings tsam bstan pas so //
analyzed: da ni rnal ma dpyad par bya ste // sgra ji bzhin pa ni khro bo'i rgyal po dbyings tsam bstan pas so //
translated: Now, the natural state should be analyzed.

original: don yod par grub pa ni /
analyzed: don yod par grub pa ni /
translated: The literal meaning is the mere indication of the Realm of the Wrathful King.üîΩAmoghasiddhi

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la sogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la sogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //

original: don yod grub pa ni phrag dog rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo phrag dog yang zhe sdang las byung ba ste /
analyzed: don yod grub pa ni phrag dog rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo phrag dog yang zhe sdang las byung ba ste /

analyzed: zhe sdang gi ngo bo nyid thugs rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rigs su 'dus par 'gyur ro //

original: yang na 'dod chags las byung ba yin na /
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags las byung ba yin na /

analyzed: de nyid rdo rje zhes pa ni rigs sam rgyas btab pas so //

analyzed: drang ba'i don zhes bya ba 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa khro bo brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The interpretable meaning is so called because it is intended to express the wrathful noble Am·πõtaku·πá·∏çali.

original: rnam par dag pa'i gnas ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i gnas ni 'od gsal ba ste /

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i sems kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i sems kyi de kho na nyid do //

analyzed: nges pa'i don zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The definitive meaning is so called because it is taught by the mind-purification stage.üîΩHe is the terminator and destroyer of obstacles,

original: bgegs rnams mthar mdzad cing 'jigs par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni de la bgegs ni bdud bzhi ste /

original: lus gzir bas na zhes pa ni lus kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i sems gzir bas so //üîΩde rnams thabs kyi ye shes shar bas na //

original: de bas na bgegs thams cad rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni brgya byin la sogs pa phyogs skyong rnams 'joms par mdzad pas so //

analyzed: shar gyi mtshams nas brtsams te zhes pa ni me dang / bden bral dang rlung dang dbang ldan gyi mtshams rnams su'o //

analyzed: nub kyi snam bu la 'jam dpal dang 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ and Loke≈õvara in the west,

analyzed: byang gi snam bu la ni kun du bzang po dang sgrib pa rnam par sel ba dag dgod pa ni bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: dgod pa'o // mtshams su ni sangs rgyas spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dgod par bya'o //

analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi byang shar gyi mtshams nas brtsams te zhes pa la nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol dang byang chub sems dpa'i snam bu'i bar du grva rnams la gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa dgod do zhes pa ni gzugs rdo rje ma

analyzed: reg bya rdo rje ma ni dbus kyi bdag po la brten te bzhugs so //

analyzed: de ltar sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor yin no //

analyzed: de ltar na sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor gang las rtogs par bya ste /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The mandala is characterized by the support and the supported.

original: gzhan dag tu bshad pa'i rgyud la sogs par ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu bshad pa'i rgyud la sogs par ro //
translated: In other tantras, etc., which have been explained.

original: rdzogs pa ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: Complete means without exception.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos so //
translated: The Bhagavat is the Great Vajradhara.

original: ma gsungs pa ni ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma gsungs pa ni ma bstan pa'o //

original: de gleng gzhi'i tshig gi don yin te /

translated: In order to teach just that,
