original: dbang du mdzad nas kyang zhes pa ni de la brten pas so //
analyzed: dbang du mdzad nas kyang zhes pa ni de la brten pas so //
translated: And having taken power means having relied on that.

original: don gang zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don gang zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: As for what is the meaning, it is the characteristic of the two stages.

original: bstan pa zhes pa ni so sor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes pa ni so sor bstan pa'o //
translated: As for taught, it is taught individually.

original: de nyid du ni zhes pa ni gleng gzhi'i tshig kho na la'o //
analyzed: de nyid du ni zhes pa ni gleng gzhi'i tshig kho na la'o //
translated: As for right there, it is right in the nidana verses.

original: rgyud kyi don zhes pa ni rgyud phyi ma dang lhan cig tu le'u bcu bdun gyi bdag nyid can gyi dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi don bstan to //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don zhes pa ni rgyud phyi ma dang lhan cig tu le'u bcu bdun gyi bdag nyid can gyi dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi don bstan to //
translated: As for the meaning of the tantra, it is the meaning of the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra, which has a nature of seventeen chapters, together with the continuation tantra.

original: aa rga las sbrang thob 'gyur na //
analyzed: aa rga las sbrang thob 'gyur na //
translated: As for like a bee obtains honey,

original: ci yi phyir ni ri la 'gro //
analyzed: ci yi phyir ni ri la 'gro //
translated: why does one go to the mountain?

original: 'dod pa'i don ni rnyed 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don ni rnyed 'gyur na //
translated: As for if one obtains the desired aim,

original: mkhas pa gang gi yang 'bad byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa gang gi yang 'bad byed //
translated: what effort does the wise one make?

original: ces tshig las gleng gzhi'i tshig tsam yongs su shes pas rnal 'byor ba bya ba byas par 'gyur @141a * //
analyzed: ces tshig las gleng gzhi'i tshig tsam yongs su shes pas rnal 'byor ba bya ba byas par 'gyur @141a * //
translated: Thus, by fully understanding just the nidana verses from the words, the yogi will have done what needs to be done.

original: zhes ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u bcu bdun gyi bdag nyid bstan zhe na /
analyzed: zhes ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u bcu bdun gyi bdag nyid bstan zhe na /
translated: Why did the bhagavat teach the seventeen chapters?

original: smras pa / lhag ma zhes pa la /
analyzed: smras pa / lhag ma zhes pa la /
translated: As for the remainder,

original: gleng gzhi'i tshig las gzhan thams cad rgyud kyi lus ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i tshig las gzhan thams cad rgyud kyi lus ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The body of the tantra is everything else except for the nidana words.

original: dgos pa las gzhan ni lhag ma yin zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgos pa las gzhan ni lhag ma yin zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The remainder is the purpose.

original: zhar la byung ba zhes pa ni gleng gzhi'i tshig gis rgyud kyi don shes kyang de'i spobs pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhar la byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhar la byung ba zhes pa ni gleng gzhi'i tshig gis rgyud kyi don shes kyang de'i spobs pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhar la byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The incidental is the characteristic of the confidence in the meaning of the tantra even though it is known by the words of the nidana. The meaning of incidental is that.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sgrub pa'i de rnams ni legs par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i de rnams ni legs par gzung ba yin te /
translated: Those are well-held by the means of accomplishment.

original: gang gi mtshan nyid dang spros pa yod pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi mtshan nyid dang spros pa yod pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The characteristic of that is the existence of elaboration.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: yang rgyas par bshad pa ni shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: yang rgyas par bshad pa ni shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: the extensive explanation will be very clear.

original: gal te de lta yin na bshad pa'i rgyud dang / rgyud phyi ma dang / yan lag gi rgyud bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na bshad pa'i rgyud dang / rgyud phyi ma dang / yan lag gi rgyud bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: If that is so, why did the BhagavƒÅn teach the explanatory tantra, the Later Tantra, and the Branch Tantra?

original: smras pa / 'dir ni bskal pa dang po 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyi man ngag kho na gsungs te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir ni bskal pa dang po 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyi man ngag kho na gsungs te /
translated: Here, in this first eon, the BhagavƒÅn taught only the oral instructions of the face-to-face transmission.

original: de tsam gyis gdul bya rnams kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis gdul bya rnams kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that much, the disciples will attain the powers.

original: de'i rjes su zhal gyi man ngag 'dzin par nus pa med par gzigs nas rtsa ba'i rgyud rnams gsungs pas glegs bam du grags so //üîΩde'i yang rjes su rtsa ba'i rgyud kyis kyang rtogs pa med pas rgyud phyi ma yan lag gi rgyud gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su zhal gyi man ngag 'dzin par nus pa med par gzigs nas rtsa ba'i rgyud rnams gsungs pas glegs bam du grags so // de'i yang rjes su rtsa ba'i rgyud kyis kyang rtogs pa med pas rgyud phyi ma yan lag gi rgyud gsungs so //
translated: After that, seeing that they were not able to hold the oral instructions of the face-to-face transmission, the root tantras were taught, and thus became known as the books.üîΩAfter that, since they were not understood even by the root tantras, the continuation tantras and the branch tantras were taught.

original: de'i rjes su rgyud phyi ma dang yan lag gi rgyud kyis gang gis gsal bar ma gyur pas bshad pa'i rgyud rnams kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su rgyud phyi ma dang yan lag gi rgyud kyis gang gis gsal bar ma gyur pas bshad pa'i rgyud rnams kyang gsungs te /
translated: After that, since they were not illuminated even by the continuation tantras and the branch tantras, the explanatory tantras were also taught.

original: gang gi tshe de rnams kyis kyang rtogs par ma gyur na de'i tshe sngon gyi slob dpon khyad par du gyur pa rnams kyis 'grel pa dang / dka' 'grel dang / t'i k'a dang / rgyan la sogs pa byas pa dang / byed par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de rnams kyis kyang rtogs par ma gyur na de'i tshe sngon gyi slob dpon khyad par du gyur pa rnams kyis 'grel pa dang / dka' 'grel dang / t'i k'a dang / rgyan la sogs pa byas pa dang / byed par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: When they were not understood even by those, then the special masters of the past composed commentaries, difficult-to-understand commentaries, tƒ´kƒÅs, ornaments, and so forth, and will continue to do so.

original: de'i phyir na dus kyis dbye ba dang / gdul bya'i blo'i bye brag la brten te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na dus kyis dbye ba dang / gdul bya'i blo'i bye brag la brten te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat's teaching of the Dharma, in brief and in detail, is based on the distinctions of time and the distinctions of the minds of those to be trained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ni mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par gsungs pa zhes zhar la gsungs pa la skyon med do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ni mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par gsungs pa zhes zhar la gsungs pa la skyon med do //
translated: Hence, there is no fault in the incidental statement.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs gsang ba la gzigs nas zhes pa la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs gsang ba la gzigs nas zhes pa la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Having seen the secret of body, speech, and mind, the meaning is this.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su rigs lnga nye bar bsdus pa'i rigs gsum gyi ngo bo de kho na nyid bstan pas sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su rigs lnga nye bar bsdus pa'i rigs gsum gyi ngo bo de kho na nyid bstan pas sku gsung thugs so //
translated: In the direction of the creation stage, the three families, which are included in the five families, are taught to be reality, and thus are body, speech, and mind.

original: gsang ba ni de yang nye bar sdud par byed pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo nyid so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: gsang ba ni de yang nye bar sdud par byed pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo nyid so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The secret is that, moreover, the individual teachings of the nature of the Great Vajradhara, who is the one who includes them, are secret.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la @141b yang lus dang ngag yid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje bzlas pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i mtshan nyid dang man ngag bzhi pa'i 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la @141b yang lus dang ngag yid rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje bzlas pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i mtshan nyid dang man ngag bzhi pa'i 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the stage of completion separately, which has the nature of the purification of body, speech, and mind, the vajra repetition, the purification of mind, the nature of self-consecration, and the nature of the fourth luminous clarity,

original: sku gsung thugs gang yin pa la de nye bar bsdus pa myur du yang dag par skyes pa'i bde ba gnyis mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid can mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa so sor bstan par byed pa'i
analyzed: sku gsung thugs gang yin pa la de nye bar bsdus pa myur du yang dag par skyes pa'i bde ba gnyis mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid can mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa so sor bstan par byed pa'i
translated: in order to teach the stage of manifest enlightenment separately, which has the nature of non-abiding nirvana, the nature of the indivisibility of the two joys that are quickly generated in the body, speech, and mind,

original: phyir gsang ba yang yin pas sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: phyir gsang ba yang yin pas sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba'o //
translated: and because it is secret, it is the secret of body, speech, and mind.

original: gzigs nas zhes pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: gzigs nas zhes pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dag gis so //
translated: Having seen means by hearing and reflection.

original: thugs su chud par zhes pa ni bsgom pas so //
analyzed: thugs su chud par zhes pa ni bsgom pas so //
translated: Having understood means by meditation.

original: mdzad pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po las thob nas dbyangs de nyid dang tshig de nyid dang / de dang mthun pa'i don gyis sdud pa pos rnam par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po las thob nas dbyangs de nyid dang tshig de nyid dang / de dang mthun pa'i don gyis sdud pa pos rnam par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The composition is that, having obtained it from Great Vajradhara, the compiler composed it with just that melody, just those words, and with a meaning consistent with that.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor ni padma'i nang du bskyed cing sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor ni padma'i nang du bskyed cing sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The samadhi mandala is the mandala of emanation generated within the lotus.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i don dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i don dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: The Guhyasamaja is endowed with the meaning explained above.

original: byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa ni spro ba dang dgod pa le'u gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa zhes pa ni spro ba dang dgod pa le'u gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The consecration is the chapter on which the emanation and arrangement exist, which is called the consecration of the samadhi mandala of all tathagatas.

original: le'u zhes pa ni 'di ni grags pa'i sgra ste rgyud kyi don yongs su gcod pa'i mtshan nyid so sor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: le'u zhes pa ni 'di ni grags pa'i sgra ste rgyud kyi don yongs su gcod pa'i mtshan nyid so sor bstan pa'o //
translated: The chapter is a well-known term that indicates the individual presentation of the characteristics of the meaning of the tantra.

original: yang na sbyor ba la grags pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba la grags pa'i sgra'o //
translated: Or it is a well-known term in the practice.

original: yan lag gi don gyi dbye ba'i sgo nas gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi don gyi dbye ba'i sgo nas gzung bar bya'o //
translated: It should be grasped from the perspective of the division of the meaning of the branches.

original: sha sbrang dang mchu snyung la sogs pa'i gnod pa 'joms par byed pa gos su grags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sha sbrang dang mchu snyung la sogs pa'i gnod pa 'joms par byed pa gos su grags pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as clothing is known to protect from the harm of flies, mosquitoes, and so on,

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba 'joms par byed pas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba 'joms par byed pas na /
translated: so the Dharma protects from the harm of the afflictions, karma, and birth.

original: gos dang 'dra bas na gos so //
analyzed: gos dang 'dra bas na gos so //
translated: Therefore, it is like clothing.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel pa yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid srid pa'i 'khor lo gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel pa yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid srid pa'i 'khor lo gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the BhagavƒÅn has taught the wheel of existence, which is the characteristic of the twelve links of dependent origination, as follows:

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
translated: Ignorance, formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth,üîΩand aging-and-death.

original: rga shi'o // de la dang po dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rga shi'o // de la dang po dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Among these, the first, eighth, and ninth‚Äîignorance, craving, and grasping‚Äîare called the afflictions.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa thams @142a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa thams @142a * //
translated: Because all afflictions are included in these three.

original: cad kyi rtsa ba ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: cad kyi rtsa ba ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The root of all of them is ignorance.

original: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa rnams su rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang bdag tu snang ba ni ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa rnams su rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang bdag tu snang ba ni ma rig pa ste /
translated: Because of the appearance of permanence, purity, pleasure, and self in the impermanent, the impure, the painful, and the insubstantial, there is ignorance.

original: gti mug chen po'i mun pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug chen po'i mun pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is characterized by the darkness of great delusion.

original: de dang lhan cig spyod pa ni srid pa dang dga' ba dang chags par bcas pa gang gis srid pa'i longs spyod rnams la 'dod pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig spyod pa ni srid pa dang dga' ba dang chags par bcas pa gang gis srid pa'i longs spyod rnams la 'dod pa skye ba'o //
translated: The co-existent is the desire for the enjoyments of existence, which arises through the desire for existence, pleasure, and attachment.

original: de dag srid pa snga ma ma rig pa dang srid pa dag gi 'gro ba rigs drug gi srid pa'i 'khor lo ma lus pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag srid pa snga ma ma rig pa dang srid pa dag gi 'gro ba rigs drug gi srid pa'i 'khor lo ma lus pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: These two, ignorance and desire, are the root of the entire wheel of existence of the six destinies.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag yod pa ni gzhan gyi 'du shes te //
analyzed: bdag yod pa ni gzhan gyi 'du shes te //
translated: When there is a self, there is the notion of other.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi dbye bas chags sdang byung //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi dbye bas chags sdang byung //
translated: From the distinction of self and other, attachment and aversion arise.

original: de gnyis phan tshun kun du 'brel pa las //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun kun du 'brel pa las //
translated: From the mutual connection of these two,

original: skyon rnams thams cad rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skyon rnams thams cad rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
translated: And all faults will arise.üîΩ

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: All the faults arise.

original: len pa yang de dag rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid phung po so sor len pa'o //
analyzed: len pa yang de dag rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid phung po so sor len pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the individual appropriation of the aggregates, which is the characteristic of their increase.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa de dag go //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa de dag go //
translated: Thus, these are the afflictions.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang bcu pa ste 'du byed dang srid pa dag ni las so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang bcu pa ste 'du byed dang srid pa dag ni las so //
translated: Likewise, the second and the tenth members, i.e., karmic forces and becoming, are karma.

original: de la 'du byed ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'du byed ni gnyis te /
translated: Here, karmic forces are twofold:

original: sems dang ldan pa dang sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa dang sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: those associated with mind and those not associated with mind.

original: de la sems dang ldan pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sems dang ldan pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Among them, those associated with mind are threefold:üîΩvirtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The indeterminate is twofold:

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: obstructed and unobscured.

original: de la gang nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa de ni bsgribs la lung du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa de ni bsgribs la lung du bstan pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is associated with the afflictions is obstructed and indeterminate.

original: gang de dang bral ba de ni ma bsgribs la lung du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang de dang bral ba de ni ma bsgribs la lung du bstan pa'o //
translated: That which is free from them is unobscured and indeterminate.

original: de la sems dang ldan pa ni sems pa dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'dun pa dang reg pa dang / blo dang dran pa dang yid la byed pa dang lhag par mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dad pa dang / ngo tsha dang khrel dang ser sna med pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang /
analyzed: de la sems dang ldan pa ni sems pa dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'dun pa dang reg pa dang / blo dang dran pa dang yid la byed pa dang lhag par mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dad pa dang / ngo tsha dang khrel dang ser sna med pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang /
translated: the eleven virtuous mental factors of non-delusion, effort, pliancy, vigilance, equanimity, non-violence, and the five beginning with non-attachment;üîΩthe two changeable mental factors of sleep and investigation; the two root afflictions of attachment and hostility;

original: gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sbyangs pa dang bag yod pa dang btang snyoms dang rnam par 'tshe ba med pa dang / 'dod chags nas brtsams te spyod pa'i bar du lnga bcu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sbyangs pa dang bag yod pa dang btang snyoms dang rnam par 'tshe ba med pa dang / 'dod chags nas brtsams te spyod pa'i bar du lnga bcu rtsa gcig go //
translated: the twenty secondary afflictions of anger, enmity, dissimulation, vexation, hypocrisy, envy, avarice, deceit, guile, pride, harmfulness, lack of conscience, shamelessness, lethargy, excitement, faithlessness, indolence, negligence, and forgetfulness;

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa dang / skal pa mtshungs pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes ma yin pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa dang / srog gi dbang po dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa dang / skal pa mtshungs pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes ma yin pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa dang / srog gi dbang po dang / skye ba dang /
translated: and the two non-associated formative factors of acquisition and non-acquisition, the similarity of type, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, the meditative attainment of cessation, the faculty of life force, birth, aging, and duration and non-duration.

original: gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa dang ming gi tshogs dang @142b tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs te sems dang mi ldan pa ni bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa dang ming gi tshogs dang @142b tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs te sems dang mi ldan pa ni bcu bzhi'o //
translated: the four undefined factors, i.e., acquisition, nonacquisition, the characteristic of nondifferentiation, and the realm of noncausality;üîΩthe two unobscured indeterminate factors, i.e., the collection of names and the collection of letters;üîΩand the four characteristics of the second order, i.e., origination of origination, duration of duration, deterioration of deterioration, and passing away of passing away.

original: srid pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: srid pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three forms of existence:

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa'o //
translated: the existence at death, the intermediate existence, and the existence at birth.

original: de dag ni las te /
analyzed: de dag ni las te /
translated: These are karma,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the essence of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: lhag ma bdun ni sdug bsngal can gyi rnam grangs te skye ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma bdun ni sdug bsngal can gyi rnam grangs te skye ba'o //
translated: The remaining seven are synonyms for suffering:

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba dang skye ba dang / rga shi'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba dang skye ba dang / rga shi'o //
translated: birth, consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, and old age and death.

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: Among them, consciousness refers to the store consciousness, defiled mind, eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mental consciousness.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste brgyad do //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste brgyad do //
translated: The eight are the eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness.

original: yang na lnga ste /
analyzed: yang na lnga ste /
translated: Alternatively, there are five:

original: kun gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the fundamental consciousness, afflicted mind, the sense consciousnesses that exist in one's own and others' continuums, the operative consciousnesses, and the consciousnesses that perceive the individual appearances of forms and so on.

original: yang na gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na gsum ste /
translated: Alternatively, there are three:

original: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //üîΩ'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o // 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po gcig tu byas te /
translated: the consciousness that is the ripening of karma, the mental consciousness, and the operative consciousnesses.üîΩThe six operative consciousnesses are taken as one and called the single consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig ces la la 'dod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig ces la la 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it says:üîΩThe appearance of objects, sentient beings, and the self

original: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / so sor snang ba rab skye ba //
analyzed: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / so sor snang ba rab skye ba //
translated: arises individually.

original: rnam par shes pa de don med //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de don med //
translated: Consciousness does not exist as an object.

original: de med pas ni de yang med //
analyzed: de med pas ni de yang med //
translated: Since that does not exist, it also does not exist.

original: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam shes te //
analyzed: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam shes te //
translated: One is the consciousness of conditions.

original: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can //üîΩlongs spyod yongs su spyod pa dang / skul byed de la sems las byung //
analyzed: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can // longs spyod yongs su spyod pa dang / skul byed de la sems las byung //
translated: The second is the one that experiences.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The one that experiences experiences the objects of experience, and the one that impels is the mind.

original: de bzhin du yang /üîΩrnam bar smin pa ngar sems dang // yul la rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang / rnam bar smin pa ngar sems dang // yul la rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: And also:

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The result of evolution is the mind that thinks ‚ÄúI,‚Äù and the awareness of objects.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And also:

original: gcig pu nyid ni gnyis su snang //
analyzed: gcig pu nyid ni gnyis su snang //
translated: The one that is one appears as two.

original: sems nyid rnam par 'khrul pas so //üîΩgzung 'dzin dag gi dbye ba yis //üîΩshin tu mkhas pas ci min nam //
analyzed: sems nyid rnam par 'khrul pas so // gzung 'dzin dag gi dbye ba yis // shin tu mkhas pas ci min nam //
translated: It is the mind itself that is deluded.üîΩThe wise one should understand

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas so //
translated: that the division into subject and object is nothing at all.

original: ming dang gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Name-and-form is fourfold:

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed ni gzugs med pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed ni gzugs med pa'i phung po'o //
translated: feeling, conceptualization, and the karmic forces are the formless aggregates.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste //
translated: Form is the form aggregate.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam pa bcu gcig @143a * //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam pa bcu gcig @143a * //
translated: It is the eleven kinds of form: the five sense faculties, the five sense objects, and non-revealing form.

original: go // de ltar phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi ming dang / gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: go // de ltar phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi ming dang / gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the four aggregates are called name.

original: skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug ste /
translated: The six sense spheres are

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: the sense spheres of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is the arising of the union of the sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: tshor ba ni myong ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni myong ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Feeling is the experience of the three kinds of feeling.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the essence of pleasure, suffering, and neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: de yang mig la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam par bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang mig la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam par bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is divided into eighteen kinds by way of the eye and so forth.

original: skye ba yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: skye ba yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Birth is of four kinds:

original: sgo nga dang / drod gsher dang / mngal dang / rdzus te skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sgo nga dang / drod gsher dang / mngal dang / rdzus te skyes pa'o //
translated: birth from an egg, birth from heat and moisture, birth from a womb, and spontaneous birth.

original: dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / byol song dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi'i dbye bas drug ces la la 'dod do //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / byol song dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi'i dbye bas drug ces la la 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that it is sixfold by way of the divisions of hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals, gods, demigods, and humans.

original: ngan song dang bde 'gro'i dbye bas gnyis su yang 'dod do //
analyzed: ngan song dang bde 'gro'i dbye bas gnyis su yang 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that it is twofold by way of the divisions of the lower realms and happy realms.

original: rga ba yang nus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos so //
analyzed: rga ba yang nus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos so //
translated: Aging is the characteristic of the separation from potency.üîΩDeath is the abandonment of the aggregates.

original: shi ba ni phung po 'dor bas rnam par shes pa'i skad cig mtshor ba la gnas pa'i ngo bo chos bdun po de dag ni skye ba ste skyes pa la ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos bdun dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shi ba ni phung po 'dor bas rnam par shes pa'i skad cig mtshor ba la gnas pa'i ngo bo chos bdun po de dag ni skye ba ste skyes pa la ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos bdun dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These seven dharmas, which are the nature of the momentariness of consciousness, are birth, because that which is born is associated with the seven dharmas beginning with consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba 'di dag gis khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can gyi tshogs zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du 'khor bar byed pas 'gro ba gcig nas gcig tu thob par gyur nas nyon mongs pa tshon po myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba 'di dag gis khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can gyi tshogs zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du 'khor bar byed pas 'gro ba gcig nas gcig tu thob par gyur nas nyon mongs pa tshon po myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These afflictions, actions, and births cause the multitudes of beings who dwell in the three realms to revolve like a waterwheel. Having attained one life from another, they experience the afflictions.

original: thal tshan gyi chu bo'i mdo las kyang //
analyzed: thal tshan gyi chu bo'i mdo las kyang //
translated: In the River of Ashes Sutra it says,

original: nor phrogs rkun ma las bdag mi 'jigs //
analyzed: nor phrogs rkun ma las bdag mi 'jigs //
translated: I am not afraid of thieves who steal my wealth,

original: de yis nor phrogs de yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de yis nor phrogs de yang yod ma yin //
translated: But that wealth which is stolen by them does not exist.

original: yid la bsags shing bsags pa'i dag pa'i nor //
analyzed: yid la bsags shing bsags pa'i dag pa'i nor //
translated: The wealth of pure accumulation which is mentally accumulated

original: tha mal rtog pa dag gis nges par 'phrog / ces dgon pa'i dge slong gis lag pa gyen du brkyang zhes nyin mo'i'o 'dod 'bod ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tha mal rtog pa dag gis nges par 'phrog / ces dgon pa'i dge slong gis lag pa gyen du brkyang zhes nyin mo'i'o 'dod 'bod ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The monk in the monastery is certainly carried away by ordinary thoughts.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis las 'byung ba dang / las kyi dbang gis skye ba dang / de las kyang las dang / yang nyon mongs pa skye zhes 'khor ba tha ma med pa la 'khor lo bzhin du yongs su 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis las 'byung ba dang / las kyi dbang gis skye ba dang / de las kyang las dang / yang nyon mongs pa skye zhes 'khor ba tha ma med pa la 'khor lo bzhin du yongs su 'khor ba'o //
translated: Thus, karma arises by the power of the afflictions, birth arises by the power of karma, and from that, karma and afflictions arise again. Thus, like a wheel, one revolves in cyclic existence without any beginning.

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo 'di ni bdag la sogs pa gang gis kyang mi bskyed de //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo 'di ni bdag la sogs pa gang gis kyang mi bskyed de //
translated: This wheel of existence is not set in motion by anyone, such as a self.

original: stong pa kho na las kyang chos stong pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa kho na las kyang chos stong pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a phenomenon arises from emptiness alone, it is empty.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gsum las gnyis so skye bar 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: gsum las gnyis so skye bar 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Two arise from three,üîΩfrom two, seven arise,

original: gnyis las bdun po @143b skye zhing bdun las ni //üîΩgnyis po yang dag skye 'gyur de phyir 'di //
analyzed: gnyis las bdun po @143b skye zhing bdun las ni // gnyis po yang dag skye 'gyur de phyir 'di //
translated: and from seven,üîΩtwo arise again.

original: thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i 'khor lo yin //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i 'khor lo yin //
translated: Therefore, this is the wheel of existence without beginning.

original: stong pa kho na'i chos las chos rnams ni //
analyzed: stong pa kho na'i chos las chos rnams ni //
translated: From phenomena that are empty alone, phenomena

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin rab tu skye bar 'gyur //üîΩkha thon mar me me long rgya /
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin rab tu skye bar 'gyur // kha thon mar me me long rgya /
translated: arise that have the nature of emptiness.üîΩRecitation, lamp, mirror, seal,

original: me shel sa bon skyur dang sgra //
analyzed: me shel sa bon skyur dang sgra //
translated: fire-glass, seed, sour, and sound.

original: phung po nyid mtshams sbyor ba yang //
analyzed: phung po nyid mtshams sbyor ba yang //
translated: The aggregates themselves are connected,

original: mi 'pho bar yang mkhan rtogs bya //
analyzed: mi 'pho bar yang mkhan rtogs bya //
translated: and the creator is understood to be without transference.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba nyid ni nye bar 'tshe ba ste skyon chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba nyid ni nye bar 'tshe ba ste skyon chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, afflictions, actions, and birth itself are the harm, the great fault.

original: de rnams rim pa gnyis sgom pa'i sgo nas bzlog pa ni nye bar byed pas gos dang 'dra bas gos so //
analyzed: de rnams rim pa gnyis sgom pa'i sgo nas bzlog pa ni nye bar byed pas gos dang 'dra bas gos so //
translated: Their reversal through the cultivation of the two stages is like a garment, since it covers them.

original: de len cing 'dzin pas na zhes pa la /
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pas na zhes pa la /
translated: It is said, because it takes them up and holds them.

original: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis brjod par bya ba'i don rjod par byed pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis brjod par bya ba'i don rjod par byed pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The meaning to be expressed, which has the characteristic of being produced and completed, is the characteristic of the words that express it.

original: de ston pa'i gzhung gi tshogs la yang le'u zhes bya'o zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis ka'i ngo bo rtog pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i lha'i sku ston par byed pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni le'u zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ston pa'i gzhung gi tshogs la yang le'u zhes bya'o zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis ka'i ngo bo rtog pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i lha'i sku ston par byed pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni le'u zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of chapter is the collection of words that teach the nature of both stages, the deity‚Äôs body that is imagined and the deity‚Äôs body that is complete.

original: la la ni rlung dang char pa la sogs pa'i skyon sel bar byed pa'i khyim gyi bla gab bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa zhi bar byed pas le'u zhes smra'o //
analyzed: la la ni rlung dang char pa la sogs pa'i skyon sel bar byed pa'i khyim gyi bla gab bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa zhi bar byed pas le'u zhes smra'o //
translated: Some say that a chapter is so called because it pacifies obscurations such as the afflictions, like a roof that removes the faults of wind, rain, and so on.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel ba'i t'i k'a las le'u dang po'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel ba'i t'i k'a las le'u dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter from the commentary called Illuminating Lamp.

original: // / de ltar le'u dang pos thams cad bskyed nas zhes pa ni le'u dang pos ni rgyud kyi don ma lus pa mtshon par byed pa gleng gzhi'i tshig gi khyad par du gyur pa'i le'us so //
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u dang pos thams cad bskyed nas zhes pa ni le'u dang pos ni rgyud kyi don ma lus pa mtshon par byed pa gleng gzhi'i tshig gi khyad par du gyur pa'i le'us so //
translated: Thus, the first chapter generates everything. The first chapter is the chapter that is the special introductory words that illustrate the entire meaning of the tantra.

original: thams cad bskyed pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gdul bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod chags chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis lha mo'i 'khor lo nye bar spyod pa dang / bgegs bskrad pa nas brtsams te gzhal yas khang pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang /
analyzed: thams cad bskyed pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gdul bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod chags chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis lha mo'i 'khor lo nye bar spyod pa dang / bgegs bskrad pa nas brtsams te gzhal yas khang pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang /
translated: All of this is generated by the BhagavƒÅn Great Vajradhara for the purpose of training future sentient beings, through the samƒÅdhi of great desire, the enjoyment of the retinue of goddesses, from the expulsion of obstructors, the celestial mansion, the mandala of resolute interest, the ultimate mandala,

original: padma la sogs pa'i gdan dang chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid mngon du bya ba dang / yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las skye pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo bsgom pa dang mig la sogs pa byin gyis rlob pa dang / sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i bar du dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu phyag rgya spyang ba dang /
analyzed: padma la sogs pa'i gdan dang chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid mngon du bya ba dang / yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las skye pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo bsgom pa dang mig la sogs pa byin gyis rlob pa dang / sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i bar du dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu phyag rgya spyang ba dang /

syllables, the consecration of the eyes, and so on, the consecration of awakened body, speech, and mind, and so on, and the purification of the pledge beings and the entrance of the awareness beings, the mandala, and so

original: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa dang / de las mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dkyil 'khor ba spro ba dang / de dag gis sems can gyi don bya ba dang / @144a * //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa dang / de las mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dkyil 'khor ba spro ba dang / de dag gis sems can gyi don bya ba dang / @144a * //
translated: The union of the vajra and lotus, the emanation of Ak·π£hobhya and so forth of the mandala, the performance of the welfare of sentient beings by those [emanations],

original: dkyil 'khor gyi shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su dgod pa dang / cod pan du bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su dgod pa dang / cod pan du bya ba bstan to //
translated: and the arrangement in the east and so forth of the mandala, and the teaching of the crown empowerment.

original: sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yang dag par 'byung ba'i yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su bstan pa ni de dag thams cad bskyed par bstan to //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yang dag par 'byung ba'i yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su bstan pa ni de dag thams cad bskyed par bstan to //
translated: The teaching of the complete stage of the pure divine body that arises by the process of the purification of the mind and so forth is taught as the generation of all of those.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud bstan pa'i ched du lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis kyi rang bzhin dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spros te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud bstan pa'i ched du lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis kyi rang bzhin dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spros te /
translated: In order to clarify the complete stage, for the sake of teaching the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra, the mandala of the pledge is emanated, which has the nature of the two yogas of the deity.

original: da ni don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu gtong ba'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa lnga yang gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu gtong ba'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa lnga yang gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Now, in order to clarify the five stages, which are the cause of the creation stage of reality, which has the nature of the sole ultimate truth, and which have the nature of the completion stage, such as vajra repetition, and so forth.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u ni gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin ston par byed pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u ni gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin ston par byed pa'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the thought of awakening is the chapter that teaches the nature of primordial non-arising.

original: gsungs te ni gsungs pa'o zhes sbyar ba ni bya ba dang byed pa po'i sgra dag gi phan tshun 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs te ni gsungs pa'o zhes sbyar ba ni bya ba dang byed pa po'i sgra dag gi phan tshun 'brel pa'o //
translated: The word says is connected with the words the speaker and the deed, which are the mutual connection of the words the agent and the action.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni sku la sogs pa nye bar bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni sku la sogs pa nye bar bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la'o //
translated: Great Vajradhara is the glorious Vajrasattva, whose characteristics are the summary of the body and so forth.

original: mchod pa ni me tog ma la sogs pa'i lha mo spros pas so //
analyzed: mchod pa ni me tog ma la sogs pa'i lha mo spros pas so //
translated: Worship is the emanation of the goddesses such as Pushpam.

original: bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa ni byang chub sems kyi le'u nyan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa ni byang chub sems kyi le'u nyan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The request to the Bhagavan is for the sake of listening to the chapter on the thought of awakening.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang gsum gyi mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi bsgom pas mi snang bar byas pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang gsum gyi mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi bsgom pas mi snang bar byas pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of the indivisibility of body, speech, and mind is the ordinary body, etc., which are made invisible by the meditation on emptiness, and thus are born as the nature of vajra.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu'i nye bar gdags pas mchog ni rgyu ni stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu'i nye bar gdags pas mchog ni rgyu ni stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The supreme is the cause, which is the reality of emptiness.

original: 'bras bu ni de'i dbang gis sku la sogs pa mi phyed par thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de'i dbang gis sku la sogs pa mi phyed par thob pa'o //
translated: The result is the attainment of the indivisibility of body, etc., by the power of that.

original: de dag dbyer med par byas te sku gsung thugs kho na mchog tu bshad do //
analyzed: de dag dbyer med par byas te sku gsung thugs kho na mchog tu bshad do //
translated: Having made them indivisible, only body, speech, and mind are explained as supreme.

original: gang gi phyir nye bar btags pa ni rgyu mtshan gsum gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nye bar btags pa ni rgyu mtshan gsum gyis 'gyur te /
translated: For what reason is there a designation of the result on the cause? It is because of three reasons:

original: don gtso bo bkag pa dang / rgyu mtshan dang dgos pas so //
analyzed: don gtso bo bkag pa dang / rgyu mtshan dang dgos pas so //
translated: the negation of the primary meaning, the reason, and the purpose.

original: dper na tshong dpon ba lang yin te /
analyzed: dper na tshong dpon ba lang yin te /
translated: For example, a merchant is a cow.

original: ba lang dang tshong dpon phyugs dang mi dang shin tu 'gal ba yin pas don gtso bo bkag pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang dang tshong dpon phyugs dang mi dang shin tu 'gal ba yin pas don gtso bo bkag pa'o //
translated: Since a cow and a merchant are very much in conflict with cattle and humans, the primary meaning is negated.

original: rgyu mtshan ni gsal ba dang blun pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni gsal ba dang blun pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: The reason is the connection with the qualities of clarity, stupidity, and so on.

original: gang gi dbang gis gzhi mthun pa'i sgo nas ba lang dang tshong dpon dag byed pa'i tshig dang pos so sor bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis gzhi mthun pa'i sgo nas ba lang dang tshong dpon dag byed pa'i tshig dang pos so sor bstan to //
translated: By whose power, through the common locus, the words ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúmerchant‚Äù are taught separately by the first word.

original: dgos pa ni @144b ba lang dang 'dra bar rmongs par gyur pa'i tshong dpon la mi rtsi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgos pa ni @144b ba lang dang 'dra bar rmongs par gyur pa'i tshong dpon la mi rtsi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The purpose is that, like the cow, the merchant is not to be considered confused.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang sku gsung thugs dang byang chub kyi sems phan tshun 'gal ba ste 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyis don gtso bo bkag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang sku gsung thugs dang byang chub kyi sems phan tshun 'gal ba ste 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyis don gtso bo bkag pa'o //
translated: In the same way, here also, the body, speech, mind, and awakening mind are mutually contradictory, and the primary meaning is negated by the conditioned and unconditioned.

original: rgyu mtshan ni de la dmigs pa'i yon tan gyi 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni de la dmigs pa'i yon tan gyi 'brel ba'o //
translated: The reason is the connection with the quality of observing that.

original: gang gi dbang gis sku gsung thugs ni byang chub kyi sems zhes gzhi mthun pas don gnyis ka yang byed pa'i tshig dang pos brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis sku gsung thugs ni byang chub kyi sems zhes gzhi mthun pas don gnyis ka yang byed pa'i tshig dang pos brjod do //
translated: By whose power, the body, speech, mind, and awakening mind are a common locus, and the two meanings are expressed by the first word.

original: dgos pa ni byang chub kyi sems bzhin du sku gsung thugs kyang stong pa dang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba yin pas nye bar gdags pa ni rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni byang chub kyi sems bzhin du sku gsung thugs kyang stong pa dang sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba yin pas nye bar gdags pa ni rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: The purpose is that just as with the thought of awakening, the body, speech, and mind are to be fully known as the nature of emptiness and illusion. Therefore, the designation is only reasonable.

original: bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams la mi bstan pas na zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi bar du rnal 'byor ba rnams la sba bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la gnas pa rnams la mi bstan pas na zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi bar du rnal 'byor ba rnams la sba bar bya'o //
translated: Since it is not to be taught to those who abide in the Action Tantra and so forth, it is to be concealed from yogins up to the Yoga Tantra.

original: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol bas na zhes pa la /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol bas na zhes pa la /
translated: Since it is completely liberated from all obscurations,

original: nyon mongs ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa bral ba ste ;
analyzed: nyon mongs ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa bral ba ste ;
translated: it is free from the afflictive and the cognitive obscurations and so forth.

original: byang chub sems kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the thought of awakening completely pacifies all conceptual thoughts.üîΩSince it generates the completely pure divine body,

original: yongs su dag pa lha'i sku bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i sgra 'dir ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa lha'i sku bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i sgra 'dir ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: the word ‚Äúpure‚Äù here has two aspects.

original: gcig ni sngags kyi sku rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig ni sngags kyi sku rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: One is the expression of the mantra body.

original: tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zlog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zlog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it turns back the conceptualization of ordinary bodies, etc.

original: gnyis pa ni ye shes kyi sku rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ye shes kyi sku rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: The second is the expression of the body of intuition,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpes nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpes nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is illustrated by the examples of illusion, etc.

original: rdo rje'i sku yang yongs su dag pa'i lha'i skur brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku yang yongs su dag pa'i lha'i skur brjod pa yin te /
translated: The vajra body is also called the pure divine body,

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyis rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyis rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the realm of non-abiding nirvana, which is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: 'dir ni thams cad gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni thams cad gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Here, everything should be taken,

original: byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the spirit of enlightenment is the nature of emptiness, and because it teaches the stage of completion.

original: byang chub chen po'i sems brtan par mdzad pa na zhes pa la /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i sems brtan par mdzad pa na zhes pa la /
translated: When he made firm the spirit of great enlightenment,

original: byang chub kyi sems chen po ni stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems chen po ni stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: the spirit of great enlightenment is the reality of emptiness and the reality of the stage of completion.

original: chen po yang yin la byang chub kyi sems kyang yin pas na byang chub kyi sems chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po yang yin la byang chub kyi sems kyang yin pas na byang chub kyi sems chen po'o //
translated: It is great and it is the Thought of Enlightenment, thus it is the Great Thought of Enlightenment.üîΩBy it, there is the great benefit of sentient beings.

original: des ni sems can gyi don chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o zhes pa ni sems can ni tsandan lta bu la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams so //üîΩchen po ni rin po @145a * //
analyzed: des ni sems can gyi don chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o zhes pa ni sems can ni tsandan lta bu la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams so // chen po ni rin po @145a * //
translated: Sentient beings are persons who are like sandalwood, etc.

original: che lta bu'i gang zag rnams so //
analyzed: che lta bu'i gang zag rnams so //
translated: Great is the person who is like a jewel.

original: de rnams kyi don ni rang gi bsam pa dang mthun pa'i rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni rang gi bsam pa dang mthun pa'i rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Their benefit is the nature of liberation in accordance with their own intention.

original: gang gi phyir tsandan lta bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pas grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tsandan lta bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pas grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because those who are like sandalwood, etc. are liberated by the branch of the stage of generation which generates them, and by the conviction of the reality of emptiness.

original: rin po che lta bu'i gang yin pa de rnams kyang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid yid la byed pas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rin po che lta bu'i gang yin pa de rnams kyang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid yid la byed pas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And those who are like jewels are liberated by the reality of the stage of completion which is the mental orientation of them.

original: de lta bu'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving understood such a complete conception of the mind‚Äù means that the buddhas possess the six superknowledges.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa ni rim pa gnyis mdo tsam bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa ni rim pa gnyis mdo tsam bstan pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the words‚Äù means that the two stages are taught in brief.

original: khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúYou‚Äù and so forth.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid can sngags kyi sku rnams tha mi dad par bstan to //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid can sngags kyi sku rnams tha mi dad par bstan to //
translated: The mantra bodies, which are the nature of body, speech, and mind, are taught to be undifferentiated.

original: sku rdo rje lta bur ni thugs kyi rdo rje'i ngo bo yang yin te /
analyzed: sku rdo rje lta bur ni thugs kyi rdo rje'i ngo bo yang yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúLike the vajra body‚Äù means that the nature of the mind vajra is also the body vajra.

original: sku rten med pas brten pa yang sems mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku rten med pas brten pa yang sems mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the body is without support, the supported mind also does not abide.

original: thugs rdo rje lta bur zhes pa ni sku rdo rje'i sku yang thugs kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje lta bur zhes pa ni sku rdo rje'i sku yang thugs kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúLike the vajra mind‚Äù means that the body vajra body is also the nature of the body of the mind vajra holder.

original: sku ni sems kyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku ni sems kyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the body is the appearance of the mind.

original: tshig tu brjod pa ni ngag tu smra ba ste zhes pa la /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa ni ngag tu smra ba ste zhes pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúSpeech‚Äù means verbal expression.

original: ji srid ngag gi brjod pa ni 'jig rten pa'i brda la sogs pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i kha thon dang klog pa dang / bzlas pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams gsung rdo rje lta bur zhes pa ni gsung rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin gyis thugs rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs kho na ste sems las ngag byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji srid ngag gi brjod pa ni 'jig rten pa'i brda la sogs pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i kha thon dang klog pa dang / bzlas pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams gsung rdo rje lta bur zhes pa ni gsung rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin gyis thugs rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs kho na ste sems las ngag byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As long as the expressions of speech, whatever they may be, are worldly signs and so on, or supramundane recitations, readings, and repetitions, they are ‚Äúlike the vajra of speech.‚Äù The nature of the vajra of speech is the form of the mind-vajra-holder, because speech arises from the mind.

original: de ltar lte ba'i phyogs nas 'byung ba'i srog ces bya ba'i rlung yid kyis bskul ba'i phyi rol gyi don gzung bar 'dod pas gnas brgyud kun reg pas yi ge rnams bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar lte ba'i phyogs nas 'byung ba'i srog ces bya ba'i rlung yid kyis bskul ba'i phyi rol gyi don gzung bar 'dod pas gnas brgyud kun reg pas yi ge rnams bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the wind called ‚Äúlife‚Äù that arises from the navel region should be activated by the mind. It should be made to generate the syllables by touching all the places, desiring to apprehend external objects.

original: yi ge rnams kyis kyang tshig de rnams kyis kyang ngag chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyis kyang tshig de rnams kyis kyang ngag chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the syllables should generate the words, and the words should generate the great speech.

original: de bas na ngag gi spros pa thams cad 'di sems kyi rtsa ba can yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ngag gi spros pa thams cad 'di sems kyi rtsa ba can yin no //
translated: Therefore, all the elaborations of speech have the mind as their root.

original: 'ji skad du /
analyzed: 'ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nam mkha' las byung rlung ni lus po las //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung rlung ni lus po las //
translated: The wind that arises from space moves the body.

original: kun du rgyu zhing dbyangs ni khar 'byin pa //
analyzed: kun du rgyu zhing dbyangs ni khar 'byin pa //
translated: wandering everywhere, the sound is emitted from the mouth.

original: gnas gzhan rnams la rab tu dbye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gnas gzhan rnams la rab tu dbye 'gyur ba //
translated: It is divided into the other abodes.

original: yi ge nyid du gyur pa gang de sgra //
analyzed: yi ge nyid du gyur pa gang de sgra //
translated: That which becomes the letters is sound.üîΩThat letter is the supreme purifier of BrahmƒÅ,

original: yi ge de ni tshangs pa dag byed mchog / gsang ba la gnas bral ze @145b yang dag 'dod //
analyzed: yi ge de ni tshangs pa dag byed mchog / gsang ba la gnas bral ze @145b yang dag 'dod //
translated: the secret abode, the pure, the desired.

original: de ni yang dag rab tu sbyor ba na //
analyzed: de ni yang dag rab tu sbyor ba na //
translated: When it is applied correctly,

original: legs thob mngon par 'byung bas skyes bur sbyar //
analyzed: legs thob mngon par 'byung bas skyes bur sbyar //
translated: it is applied to the person who has attained well and has arisen.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de ltar sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la /
analyzed: de ltar sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la /
translated: Thus, for the yogis of Body-vajra and so forth,

original: sku la sogs pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi phan tshun dbyer med pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi phan tshun dbyer med pa nyid bstan to //
translated: the three aspects of body and so forth are taught to be inseparable.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces pa ni bgegs bskrad pa'i de kho na nyid don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas thob pa'i stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyis so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces pa ni bgegs bskrad pa'i de kho na nyid don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas thob pa'i stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of emptiness‚Äù refers to the emptiness that is attained through the stage of the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala, the reality of expelling obstructors.

original: gcig tu byas nas zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig tu byas nas zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving made it one‚Äù means that one should meditate on the absence of nature.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: bgegs bskrad pa'i bsgom pas thugs rdo rje 'chang bsgom pa dang gzhal yas khang pa'i bsgom pas sku rdo rje 'chang bsgom pa dang / lhag pa mos pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis gsung rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyi sku bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs bskrad pa'i bsgom pas thugs rdo rje 'chang bsgom pa dang gzhal yas khang pa'i bsgom pas sku rdo rje 'chang bsgom pa dang / lhag pa mos pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis gsung rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyi sku bsgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the obstructor-expeller is the meditation on Vajradhara of mind, the meditation on the immeasurable palace is the meditation on Vajradhara of body, and the meditation on the mandala of imagination is the meditation on the body of Vajradhara of speech.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang gi sku rnams bsgoms nas yang rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa'i don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas stong pa nyid du gyur par rnam par bsam par bya ba dang / aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyang brjod do //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang gi sku rnams bsgoms nas yang rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa'i don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas stong pa nyid du gyur par rnam par bsam par bya ba dang / aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyang brjod do //
translated: Having meditated on the bodies of Vajradhara of body, speech, and mind, one should imagine that they become emptiness by the stages of the ultimate mandala as taught in the Vajra- garland Tantra, and one should also recite the mantra ‚ÄúO·πÉ ≈õ≈´nyatƒÅüîΩj√±ƒÅnavajrasvabhƒÅvƒÅtmako ‚Äôha·πÉ.‚Äù

original: drang ba'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i yan lag don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid rab tu bstan pa'i
analyzed: drang ba'i don ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i yan lag don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid rab tu bstan pa'i
translated: because it teaches the reality of emptiness, which is the nature of the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala.

original: phyir ro // rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gcig pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phyir ro // rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gcig pa zhes bstan to //
translated: In order to teach the completion stage, the ‚Äúone-mind-made body‚Äù is taught.

original: sems gsum po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems gsum po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three minds are

original: kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: the three consciousnesses, the store consciousness, etc.

original: khams phra ba ni 'od gsal ba dang lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: khams phra ba ni 'od gsal ba dang lhan cig tu'o //
translated: The subtle constituent is together with clear light.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku lta bu zhes bya ba ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'am cig car gyis rdzogs pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sku'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku lta bu zhes bya ba ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'am cig car gyis rdzogs pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sku'o //
translated: The body like the enjoyment body is the illusory body, which is complete either gradually, through the stages of attained light, etc., or instantaneously.

original: lus gang bskyed pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las cig car ram /
analyzed: lus gang bskyed pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las cig car ram /
translated: The body that is generated is either instantaneously or

original: rim gyis ye shes kyi sku spro ba'o //
analyzed: rim gyis ye shes kyi sku spro ba'o //
translated: and gradually the knowledge body is emitted.

original: de ni sems nyid yin no zhes pa la /
analyzed: de ni sems nyid yin no zhes pa la /
translated: That is the mind itself.

original: sems la rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid las ye shes kyi sku byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid las ye shes kyi sku byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the knowledge body arises from the reality of clear light which is to be attained by the process of purification of the mind.üîΩGenerate the mind itself in the nature of that and that expression,

original: tshig tu brjod pa gang yin pa de dang de'i ngo bor sems nyid skyed cig pa'o zhes pa ni tshig tu brjod pa ni yi ge gsum po 'jug @146a * //üîΩpa la sogs pa'i rim pas bzla ba'o //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa gang yin pa de dang de'i ngo bor sems nyid skyed cig pa'o zhes pa ni tshig tu brjod pa ni yi ge gsum po 'jug @146a * // pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bzla ba'o //
translated: means generate the mind itself in the nature of the expression of the three syllables which are repeated by the process of entry, etc.üîΩWhen that is based on the mind which has the characteristic of clear light and enters, then the expression itself is the mind.

original: de gang gi tshe 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid sems la brten te 'jug pa de'i tshe tshig tu brjod pa nyid sems yin no zhes rdo rje bzlas pa dang sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid sems la brten te 'jug pa de'i tshe tshig tu brjod pa nyid sems yin no zhes rdo rje bzlas pa dang sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus he teaches the process of vajra repetition, mind purification, and self consecration.

original: sku dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzhi pa dang lnga pa'i rim pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: sku dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzhi pa dang lnga pa'i rim pa ston par byed de /
translated: By the body, etc. he teaches the fourth and fifth processes.

original: de ltar bskyed pa'i zhes pa ni rim pa gsum bsgom pas so //
analyzed: de ltar bskyed pa'i zhes pa ni rim pa gsum bsgom pas so //
translated: Thus generated, means by meditating on the three stages.

original: nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par sbyor zhing zhes pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par sbyor zhing zhes pa la /
translated: Perfectly joined with the nature of space, means

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi lus kyang 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid kyi rnam par sbyangs nas so //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi lus kyang 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid kyi rnam par sbyangs nas so //
translated: that the illusory body is purified into the nature of luminosity, thatness.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen por bdag nyid bskyed par bya ba ste zhes pa la bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid can zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rdzogs pa'i rdo rje'i sku rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa 'dis mngon par byang chub pa dang zung
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen por bdag nyid bskyed par bya ba ste zhes pa la bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid can zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rdzogs pa'i rdo rje'i sku rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa 'dis mngon par byang chub pa dang zung
translated: One should generate oneself as Great Vajradhara, means that one should complete the perfect vajra body from the samadhi of union, which has the characteristic of the non-duality of the two truths.

original: du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the stage of manifest enlightenment and union.

original: de la mdor bsdus pa ni rigs brgya'i dbye ba'i 'og tu rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas yi ge gsum po 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i rim pas rnam pa bcu gcig yan lag mnyams  pa'i bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdus pa ni rigs brgya'i dbye ba'i 'og tu rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas yi ge gsum po 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i rim pas rnam pa bcu gcig yan lag mnyams  pa'i bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: The concise is that after the division into one hundred families, the perfect yogƒ´/nƒ´ should perform the recitation with eleven aspects by means of the three syllables in the process of entering, abiding, and rising.

original: ngag sbyang ba'i 'og tu sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnam shes gsum po gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba gsum rnam par dag pas sems la dmigs pa thob nas de la cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can
analyzed: ngag sbyang ba'i 'og tu sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnam shes gsum po gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba gsum rnam par dag pas sems la dmigs pa thob nas de la cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sems can
translated: After the purification of speech, having attained the focus on the mind by means of the process of mantra and mudra, the three consciousnesses transformed, the three appearances purified, and the mind either suddenly or gradually, such as in the attainment of appearance,

original: gyi don du blangs la /
analyzed: gyi don du blangs la /
translated: one should take up the illusory body for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sgyu ma'i sku yang chags pa dang chags bral dang / chags pa bar ma'i rim pas sbyang zhing 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i sku yang chags pa dang chags bral dang / chags pa bar ma'i rim pas sbyang zhing 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du byas te /
translated: The illusory body should be purified by means of the stages of passion, separation from passion, and intermediate passion and made into the nature of clear light.

original: de las kyang cig car du rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rnam par mdzes pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo rdo rje'i sku'i rnam grangs can zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob
analyzed: de las kyang cig car du rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rnam par mdzes pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo rdo rje'i sku'i rnam grangs can zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob
translated: Moreover, it is the attainment of the union of the two truths, the vajra body, which is the essence of the nonabiding nirvana, adorned with the major and minor marks of perfect buddhahood.üîΩ

original: par bya ba rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: par bya ba rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should meditate on the body of the great seal of Vajradhara, which is to be attained by means of the meditative stabilization of union, which is a synonym for the vajra body, the nature of the realm of nirvana without remainder, which is beautiful with the major and minor marks endowed with the highest of all aspects.

original: dpal rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: The glorious Vajra Garland and so on teach the validity of scripture.

original: snying por gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khams gsum 'di la snying por gyur pa ni rang gi srog ste /
analyzed: snying por gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khams gsum 'di la snying por gyur pa ni rang gi srog ste /
translated: As for the passage beginning with ‚Äúthe essence of the three realms,‚Äù one‚Äôs life force is the essence of this three-realm world.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
translated: It is the three consciousnesses.

original: de la gzhan med pa ni rnam par shes pa'i sna tshogs pa @146b nyid rnam pa de dang der snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzhan med pa ni rnam par shes pa'i sna tshogs pa @146b nyid rnam pa de dang der snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is nothing else apart from that because the diversity of consciousness appears in that and that way.

original: de nyid sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas rnam par sbyangs nas sems kyi 'od gsal ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas rnam par sbyangs nas sems kyi 'od gsal ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having purified that by the process of purifying the mind, one attains the very clarity of the mind.

original: des ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the process of purifying the mind.

original: skyes bu zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: The person, the yogi,

original: rlung gi khams gsum pa zhes pa la rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi lus dang khams gsum pa la yang dri ma med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: rlung gi khams gsum pa zhes pa la rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi lus dang khams gsum pa la yang dri ma med par mthong ngo //
translated: sees the three worlds as the nature of the wind element, and also sees his own body as the nature of the wind element, and the three worlds as stainless.

original: des ni yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the recitation without loss of limbs by the process of exhalation and so forth, which is the nature of the three syllables.

original: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the process of vajra recitation.

original: khams gsum bdag nyid ces pa ni khams gsum gyi nang du gnas pa khyab 'jug dang drag po dang dbyig snying la sogs pa'i nang na mchog tu gyur pa ye shes kyi sku'i rnam grangs can bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid can sgyu ma'i
