analyzed: khams gsum bdag nyid ces pa ni khams gsum gyi nang du gnas pa khyab 'jug dang drag po dang dbyig snying la sogs pa'i nang na mchog tu gyur pa ye shes kyi sku'i rnam grangs can bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid can sgyu ma'i
translated: The one who is the nature of the three realms is the one who is the supreme among those abiding in the three realms, such as Vi·π£·πáu, ≈öiva, and Kubera, who is the one characterized by the stage of self-consecration, which is a synonym of the gnosis body, and who is the illusory body.

original: sku thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain that.

original: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: That explains the stage of self-consecration.

original: gcig tu myur bar mthong ba ni zhes pa la chags pa dang chags bral dang / chags pa bar ma yongs su spangs nas gcig tu gyur pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo de kho na nyid bzhi pa'i man ngag myur bar phyi dang nang gi phyag rgya'i dbye ba'am /
analyzed: gcig tu myur bar mthong ba ni zhes pa la chags pa dang chags bral dang / chags pa bar ma yongs su spangs nas gcig tu gyur pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo de kho na nyid bzhi pa'i man ngag myur bar phyi dang nang gi phyag rgya'i dbye ba'am /
translated: Seeing the one quickly is seeing the reality of the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of the fourth stage, the reality of the great bliss of the single state arisen from the complete abandonment of attachment, nonattachment, and middling attachment, the instruction of the fourth stage, quickly, either through the division of outer and inner consorts, or through the division of the four joys.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas mthong ba ni thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas mthong ba ni thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This is the stage of the consecration, and the line one will attain the vision by the stages of samadhi teaches the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: byin gyis brlabs nas de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas de bzhin nyid //
translated: Having consecrated, one should meditate on reality.üîΩThis is the stage of reality, and the line one should meditate on reality teaches the stage of reality.

original: ces pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dang chags pa dang chags bral dang / chags pa bar ma dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
analyzed: ces pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dang chags pa dang chags bral dang / chags pa bar ma dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
translated: The line having consecrated, one should meditate on reality teaches the stage of consecration.üîΩThe line one will attain the vision by the stages of samadhi teaches the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: srid pa dang zhi ba dang 'ching ba dang grol ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang yongs su dag pa dang / ma dag pa dang / sngags kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: srid pa dang zhi ba dang 'ching ba dang grol ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang yongs su dag pa dang / ma dag pa dang / sngags kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The line one should meditate on reality teaches the stage of reality.

original: snying rje dang / shes rab dang thabs dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / ma rig pa dang rig pa la @147a * //
analyzed: snying rje dang / shes rab dang thabs dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / ma rig pa dang rig pa la @147a * //
translated: Compassion, wisdom, means, with aspects and without aspects, the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena, ignorance and knowledge, etc.

original: sogs pa ni byin gyis brlab pa rnams so //
analyzed: sogs pa ni byin gyis brlab pa rnams so //
translated: are the consecrations.

original: de rnams kyi gnas ni dbyer med pa'i sgo nas gzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnas ni dbyer med pa'i sgo nas gzhir gyur pa'o //
translated: Their place is the basis by way of the indivisibility.

original: de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa mi slob pa'i lam gyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa mi slob pa'i lam gyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thusness is the essence of all phenomena to be realized by the path of no-more-learning.

original: dngos grub myur ba zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rnams kyis myur du rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub myur ba zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rnams kyis myur du rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: Swift power is the cause of the swift attainment of mundane and supramundane powers.

original: thob par 'gyur zhes pa la rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur zhes pa la rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: One will attain is the attainment by the yogi. This teaches the stage of union.

original: nges pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rim pa lnga pa'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i rim pa gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don zhes bya ba ni rim pa lnga pa'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i rim pa gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúdefinitive meaning‚Äù is because the nature of the five stages is explained clearly.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar kun las bzang ba gang la yod pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar kun las bzang ba gang la yod pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat Vajradhara‚Äù is because he is the best in the beginning, middle, and end.üîΩHis bodhicitta is very stable, which is amazing.

original: de'i byang chub kyi sems rab tu brtan pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su rim pa lnga'i ngo bo byang chub kyi
analyzed: de'i byang chub kyi sems rab tu brtan pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid mngon du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su rim pa lnga'i ngo bo byang chub kyi
translated: In the creation stage, the nature of emptiness is actualized, and in the completion stage, the nature of the five stages is the bodhicitta that is very stable.

original: sems kyi rab tu brtan pa gang yin pa de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa ni tshig gcig gis de rnams bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rab tu brtan pa gang yin pa de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes pa ni tshig gcig gis de rnams bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is amazing. This is taught in one verse.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid mngon du bya'o //
translated: The ultimate truth is the emptiness that is actualized in the creation stage, which is the nature of the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala.

original: de yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus 'jug pa ni lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus 'jug pa ni lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa /
translated: The entry of the mind-made body is the mandala of special imagination, as stated in the Vajra-Garland:üîΩThe aggregate of form is the mirror-notion, etc.

original: gzugs phung rtog pa me long dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi snang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs phung rtog pa me long dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi snang bar bya ba'o //
translated: This is the non-appearance.

original: 'di gsal ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'od gsal ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di gsal ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'od gsal ba las byung ba'o //
translated: The from the clear light is from the clear light.

original: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni tha mal pa'i phung po la sogs pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni tha mal pa'i phung po la sogs pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of holding the completely pure divine body is the completion of the great seal body of Vajradhara, which has the characteristic of the reversal of the ordinary aggregates, etc.

original: bzhengs pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid dkyil 'khor ma lus pa sprul par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bzhengs pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid dkyil 'khor ma lus pa sprul par byed pa'o //
translated: The arising is the emanation of the entire mandala.

original: gang gis rab tu sgrogs shing brjod pa zhes ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis rab tu sgrogs shing brjod pa zhes ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The proclaiming and expressing is the wonder.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang de las byung ba'i dag pa'i sku bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang de las byung ba'i dag pa'i sku bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The so-called non-intentional is for the sake of teaching the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala which is a branch of the creation stage and the pure body which arises from that.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de nyid kyang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de nyid kyang bshad par bya ste /
translated: That very verse should be explained.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par @147b dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par @147b dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The ultimate truth is the clear light which is to be attained by the stage of the mind's complete purification.

original: der yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus 'jug pa ni cig car du spros pas 'ja' tshon dang 'dra ba'i sku mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid dang gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: der yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus 'jug pa ni cig car du spros pas 'ja' tshon dang 'dra ba'i sku mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid dang gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The entry of the mind-made body into that is the clear light reality which has the characteristic of the stage of manifest enlightenment, the body which is like a rainbow, simultaneously arisen from the elaborations.

original: 'od gsal ba las ni man ngag bzhi pa pas yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa ni ji srid 'khor ba'i bar du 'gro ba'i don mdzad bar bya ba'i phyir cig car du 'byung ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las ni man ngag bzhi pa pas yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa ni ji srid 'khor ba'i bar du 'gro ba'i don mdzad bar bya ba'i phyir cig car du 'byung ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis
translated: From the clear light, the fourth initiation, the characteristic of holding the completely pure divine body, the emanations of various aspects that arise simultaneously in order to perform the benefit of migrating beings for as long as samsara exists,üîΩpervade the realm of space, and the supreme deities such as Vajra Heart, who are characterized by the single taste of existence and peace, are the objects of worship at the lotus feet.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings khyab pa srid pa dang zhi ba ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dbyig snying la sogs pa'i lha'i mchog gi zhabs kyi padma mchod par bya ba rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rnam par mdzes pa phyag rgya chen
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings khyab pa srid pa dang zhi ba ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dbyig snying la sogs pa'i lha'i mchog gi zhabs kyi padma mchod par bya ba rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rnam par mdzes pa phyag rgya chen
translated: The great seal is endowed with the supreme of all aspects, beautified by the signs and features.

original: po'i rang bzhin mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rnam grangs shes pa dang shes bya'i bag chags dang bral ba 'od kyi tshogs kyis zla ba dang nyi ma'i gzi brjid zil gyis gnon pa zung du
analyzed: po'i rang bzhin mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rnam grangs shes pa dang shes bya'i bag chags dang bral ba 'od kyi tshogs kyis zla ba dang nyi ma'i gzi brjid zil gyis gnon pa zung du
translated: The nature of the Buddha is called the sphere of non-abiding nirvana, the wisdom of the dharma-element, free from the habitual tendencies of the knower and the known, the mass of light that outshines the brilliance of the moon and sun, the characteristic of the vajra body of the samadhi of union.

original: 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje'i sku'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje'i sku'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni dmigs par bya'o //
translated: This is to be visualized.

original: bzhengs pa 'di ni zhes pa ni ldang ba'o //
analyzed: bzhengs pa 'di ni zhes pa ni ldang ba'o //
translated: This arising is the rising.

original: gang gis rab tu bsgrags shing ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis rab tu bsgrags shing ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: By whom it is proclaimed is spoken by the Bhagavat.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa ni rim pa tha ma de kho na nyid so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa ni rim pa tha ma de kho na nyid so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-intentional is for the sake of teaching the ultimate reality of the final stage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa drug ces bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' lung thos pa'i 'og tu byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis thos pa gang yin pa de nyid bsams nas bsgoms te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa drug ces bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' lung thos pa'i 'og tu byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis thos pa gang yin pa de nyid bsams nas bsgoms te /
translated: After hearing the words of the Bhagavat Great Vajradhara, the tathagatas, who are the essence of the Thought of Enlightenment, having heard that, contemplated it, and meditated on it,

original: de'i don ston par byed pa tshigs su bcad pa drug drug gis 'byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i don ston par byed pa tshigs su bcad pa drug drug gis 'byung bar bstan to //
translated: taught its meaning with six verses each.

original: de la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the verses of Great Vajradhara is the reality of emptiness and the nature of the ultimate mandala.

original: gzhan rnams kyi don ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyi don ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the others is the stage of completion, vajra repetition, etc.üîΩIn order to teach the samadhis that are consistent with those verses,

original: tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa'i sngon du de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa'i sngon du de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: prior to the verses,

original: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The characteristic of the non-duality of the two truths is the meditative concentration of union.

original: de mngon du bya ba'i thabs zhes pa la /
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba'i thabs zhes pa la /
translated: The method for realizing that is the method for realizing the fourth stage.

original: rim pa bzhi pa bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid @148a * //
analyzed: rim pa bzhi pa bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid @148a * //
translated: The characteristic of the meditation on the fourth stage is

original: do // gang gi phyir rim pa bzhi pas rim pa lnga pa thob par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: do // gang gi phyir rim pa bzhi pas rim pa lnga pa thob par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the method for realizing the fifth stage.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The non-intentional is the teaching of reality which is the result.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir brtan pa dang g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir brtan pa dang g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚Äúthe moving and unmoving,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar snang bar gyur pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar snang bar gyur pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, this appearance which has become the nature of the moving and unmoving does not exist,

original: gcig dang du mas bral ba de mi dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: gcig dang du mas bral ba de mi dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas so //
translated: because of the non-apprehension of that by way of one or many, like a reflection, by the non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams med do //
translated: Therefore, entities do not exist.

original: bsgom par bya ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the non-existence of the object of meditation,

original: zhes pa ni shes bya'i yul can gyi sgom pa yang med do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes bya'i yul can gyi sgom pa yang med do //
translated: This is the meditation of the object of knowledge, which also does not exist.

original: yang na / 'gro ba'i dngos po thams cad 'di /
analyzed: yang na / 'gro ba'i dngos po thams cad 'di /
translated: Moreover, all things of the world

original: ma brtags pa la nyams dga' ba //
analyzed: ma brtags pa la nyams dga' ba //
translated: are delightful when not examined.

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas mi spyod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas mi spyod do //
translated: When one does not engage in non-observation,üîΩbut rather asserts that things appear as if they exist,

original: 'on kyang ji ltar snang ba tsam yul nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe dngos po de rnams yod pa ltar snang ngo zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar snang ba tsam yul nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe dngos po de rnams yod pa ltar snang ngo zhes 'dod na /
translated: then at that time, one asserts that those things appear as if they exist.

original: de la smras pa /üîΩgang yod par sgom pa zhes pa ni yongs su brtags pa'i tshul du snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po'i sgom pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su dran pa'am 'jog pa nyid gang yin pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la smras pa / gang yod par sgom pa zhes pa ni yongs su brtags pa'i tshul du snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po'i sgom pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su dran pa'am 'jog pa nyid gang yin pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: To that, we reply:

original: sgom pa med pas kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgom pa med pas kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditation of what exists is the meditation of things that appear in the manner of imputation. That is neither recollection nor placement, because meditation does not exist.

original: de'i dgongs pa ni gang brtags pa'i dngos po 'di yin pa de rang las grub na rang las grub pa ni gzhan la rag ma las pas sgom pa mi dgos so //
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni gang brtags pa'i dngos po 'di yin pa de rang las grub na rang las grub pa ni gzhan la rag ma las pas sgom pa mi dgos so //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: If this thing that is being examined were established from itself, then it would be established from itself, and since it would not depend on another, meditation would be pointless.

original: yang na gzhan las grub pa'i dngos po zhes brjod na de'i tshe de ni yod par mi brjod de rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gzhan las grub pa'i dngos po zhes brjod na de'i tshe de ni yod par mi brjod de rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, if you say that a thing is established from another, then at that time it is not said to exist, because it is dependently arisen.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de de rten nas gang byung ba //
analyzed: de de rten nas gang byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on that

original: de nyid kyis ni de ma skyes //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de ma skyes //
translated: Does not arise from that itself.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes gang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes gang //
translated: Whatever does not arise from its own nature

original: de ni skye zhes ji ltar yin //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni skye zhes ji ltar yin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: How can that be said to arise?

original: de bas na gzhan las grub pa'i phyogs su yang bsgom pa ni dgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan las grub pa'i phyogs su yang bsgom pa ni dgos pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, meditation is also pointless in the position that it is established from another.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas dngos po med par gyur pa dang de nas yod pa'i bsgom pa bkag nas bsgom pa yang med do zhes dgongs na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas dngos po med par gyur pa dang de nas yod pa'i bsgom pa bkag nas bsgom pa yang med do zhes dgongs na /
translated: If you think that the nonobservation of a thing that is nonexistent is refuted by the meditation on existence, and then you think that meditation on the absence of meditation is also pointless,

original: de'i phyir yod pa dang med par 'dres pa'i dngos po kha cig yod de zhes dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa dang med par 'dres pa'i dngos po kha cig yod de zhes dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.

original: dngos po med pa dang yod par 'dod pas ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po yin na rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshogs pa las bdag nyid rnyed pa @148b don gyi bya ba byed pa yin pa des dngos po thams cad kyi nus pa dang bral
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang yod par 'dod pas ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po yin na rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshogs pa las bdag nyid rnyed pa @148b don gyi bya ba byed pa yin pa des dngos po thams cad kyi nus pa dang bral
translated: If it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.

original: ba'i mtshan nyid nam yang med pa'i phyogs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i mtshan nyid nam yang med pa'i phyogs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.

original: dngos po med pa yang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba don gyi bya ba byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba brjod par mi nus pas ji ltar dngos po'i gnas 'thob par 'gyur te phan tshun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba don gyi bya ba byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba brjod par mi nus pas ji ltar dngos po'i gnas 'thob par 'gyur te phan tshun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir
translated: If it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.üîΩIf it is nonexistent, it is not a thing.üîΩIf it is a thing, it is not nonexistent.

original: ro // de nyid kyi phyir dngos po yang yin la /
analyzed: ro // de nyid kyi phyir dngos po yang yin la /
translated: If it is nonexistent, it

original: dngos po med pa yang yin zhes gcig tu gnyi ga'i tha snyad mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang yin zhes gcig tu gnyi ga'i tha snyad mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it is both, nor that it is neither.

original: 'on dngos po nyid dang skad cig ma dang phan tshun 'gal ba ji ltar dngos po gcig la yod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on dngos po nyid dang skad cig ma dang phan tshun 'gal ba ji ltar dngos po gcig la yod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhe na /
translated: But just as existence and momentariness are mutually exclusive, how can they be in one thing?

original: smras pa / dngos po nyid dang skad cig ma nyid ni dngos po gnyis ni 'thad de /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po nyid dang skad cig ma nyid ni dngos po gnyis ni 'thad de /
translated: We reply: Existence and momentariness are possible in one thing,

original: 'on kyang skad cig ma nyid gang yin pa de nyid dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig ma nyid gang yin pa de nyid dngos po nyid do //
translated: but that which is momentary is itself impermanent.

original: brtan pa ni dngos por smra bas 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan skyed pas slu ba'i blo dang ldan pa dngos po brtan pa gcig 'di yin no zhes sems so //
analyzed: brtan pa ni dngos por smra bas 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan skyed pas slu ba'i blo dang ldan pa dngos po brtan pa gcig 'di yin no zhes sems so //
translated: The reificationists, who are confused about the nature of things, think that a thing is permanent, because it is similar to itself.

original: tho ba la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad pa'i dus su rmugs pa'i blo dang ldan pas bum pas 'jig go zhes sems so //
analyzed: tho ba la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad pa'i dus su rmugs pa'i blo dang ldan pas bum pas 'jig go zhes sems so //
translated: When it comes in contact with a cause of destruction, such as a hammer, they think that the thing is destroyed.

original: don dam par de ni thog mar 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par de ni thog mar 'jig pa yin te /
translated: In reality, it is destroyed from the very beginning,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is momentary.

original: de bas na dngos por smra ba brtan ba rnams kyi 'khrul ba bsal bar bya ba'i don du dngos po nyid dang skad cig ma nyid ldog pa'i dbye bas brtags te bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa mkhas pa rnams kyis byas so //
analyzed: de bas na dngos por smra ba brtan ba rnams kyi 'khrul ba bsal bar bya ba'i don du dngos po nyid dang skad cig ma nyid ldog pa'i dbye bas brtags te bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa mkhas pa rnams kyis byas so //
translated: Therefore, in order to remove the error of the realists, the wise have made the connection between the probandum and the proof by means of the distinction of the negation of real entities and of momentariness.

original: de bas na 'khrul ba nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul ba nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in order to remove error, the valid cognition of inference is taught.

original: ldog pa ma lus pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po gzung ba la mkhas pa mngon sum gyi skad cig ma nyid gzung ba la nus pa med dam /
analyzed: ldog pa ma lus pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po gzung ba la mkhas pa mngon sum gyi skad cig ma nyid gzung ba la nus pa med dam /
translated: Is it not the case that direct perception, which is the apprehension of a real entity that has an intrinsic nature that is endowed with all the distinctions, is incapable of apprehending momentariness?

original: 'on kyang nges pas gang zhig cha gzung ba mi nus pa de la de'i tshad ma yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pas gang zhig cha gzung ba mi nus pa de la de'i tshad ma yang bstan to //
translated: However, the valid cognition of that is also taught with regard to that which is incapable of apprehending a part.

original: cha dang bral ba'i khyad par ni //
analyzed: cha dang bral ba'i khyad par ni //
translated: The distinction that is partless

original: mngon sum gyis ni gzung bas kyang //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni gzung bas kyang //
translated: is apprehended by direct perception.

original: gang zhig khyad par rtogs nges pa //
analyzed: gang zhig khyad par rtogs nges pa //
translated: That which definitely realizes the distinction

original: de ni rtogs par gyur pa yin //
analyzed: de ni rtogs par gyur pa yin //
translated: has become realization.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: So it is said.

original: de bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa ni rang bzhin gcig par brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa ni rang bzhin gcig par brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: Likewise, it is not logical to say that a thing and a non-thing have the same nature,

original: tha dad pa'i tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ni rang @149a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro // de la don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ni rang @149a * //
translated: because they are the objects of different valid cognitions.

original: gi mtshan nyid dang ma bral ba 'khrul pa med pa gsal bar snang ba dbang po'i mngon gsum gyis nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gi mtshan nyid dang ma bral ba 'khrul pa med pa gsal bar snang ba dbang po'i mngon gsum gyis nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, a thing that performs the function of an object is ascertained by the direct perception of a sense faculty, which is a non-mistaken, clear appearance that is not divorced from its own characteristics.üîΩA non-thing is characterized by the absence of all potentiality, and it is to be designated as non-existent by the non-observation of an appearance.

original: dngos po ma yin pa yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid snang ba mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad du bya'o zhes bsgrub pa dang bkag pa sgrub par byed pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul dngos po dang dngos po ma
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid snang ba mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad du bya'o zhes bsgrub pa dang bkag pa sgrub par byed pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul dngos po dang dngos po ma
translated: Thus, the establishment of a negation and the establishment of a proof, which are the spheres of direct perception and inference, are called ‚Äúthings‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-things.‚Äù

original: yin pa zhes ji ltar dngos po gcig gi rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: yin pa zhes ji ltar dngos po gcig gi rang bzhin yin /
translated: How can they be the same nature?

original: 'o na dngos po gcig gnyis ka'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid kyis bkag pas shes par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po gcig gnyis ka'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid kyis bkag pas shes par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the nature of a single thing understood by negating both natures?

original: dper na bum pa 'di sha za ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa 'di sha za ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThis pot is not a flesh-eater.‚Äù

original: gal te yin na sha za yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yin na sha za yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then a flesh-eater would be seen.

original: de bzhin du yod pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i cha dang 'dres pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i cha dang 'dres pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the aspect of existence and the aspect of nonexistence are mixed in the nature of existence.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: dpe mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the example is not similar.

original: gang gi phyir bum pa 'di sha za ma yin no zhes bya bas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa 'di sha za ma yin no zhes bya bas /
translated: For when it is said, ‚ÄúThis pot is not a flesh-eater,‚Äù

original: sha za las ldog pa tsam bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sha za las ldog pa tsam bstan pa yin te /
translated: only the reversal from a flesh-eater is indicated,

original: bum pa las ldog pa dang ldan pa'i snam bu bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa las ldog pa dang ldan pa'i snam bu bzhin no //
translated: like a cloth that is reversed from a pot but possesses a reversal from a pot.

original: dngos po'i ldog pa ji srid yod pa de srid de brjod pa'i nus pa yod de /
analyzed: dngos po'i ldog pa ji srid yod pa de srid de brjod pa'i nus pa yod de /
translated: As long as there is a reversal from an entity, there is the ability to express it.

original: de bas na sha za las ldog pa'i rang bzhin bum pa 'ba' zhig so sor snang bas 'di sha za ma yin no zhes de'i bdag nyid kyis dgag par rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na sha za las ldog pa'i rang bzhin bum pa 'ba' zhig so sor snang bas 'di sha za ma yin no zhes de'i bdag nyid kyis dgag par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to negate by way of its own nature, ‚ÄúThis is not a flesh-eater,‚Äù because only the nature of a pot appears separately.

original: de bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni mi rigs so //
translated: In the same way, it is not reasonable for a thing to have the nature of both a thing and a non-thing.

original: dngos po med pa bkag pa'i sgo nas dngos po rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / dngos po dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang dngos po med pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa bkag pa'i sgo nas dngos po rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / dngos po dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang dngos po med pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: A thing is understood by way of negating a non-thing, and a non-thing is understood by way of negating a thing.

original: de bas na dngos po dgag pas /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po dgag pas /
translated: Therefore, by negating a thing,

original: dngos po med par bya ba dang dngos po med pa bkag pas dngos po nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med par bya ba dang dngos po med pa bkag pas dngos po nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: a non-thing is made, and by negating a non-thing, a thing is ascertained.

original: de bas na 'ba' zhig dngos po tsam du 'grub pa'am dngos po med pa tsam 'gyur ba yin gyi dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po ni gnyis ka'i rang bzhin mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na 'ba' zhig dngos po tsam du 'grub pa'am dngos po med pa tsam 'gyur ba yin gyi dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po ni gnyis ka'i rang bzhin mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is either established as just a thing or just a non-thing, but it is not reasonable for a thing to have the nature of both a thing and a non-thing.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: bsgom par bya ba ni shes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba ni shes bya'o //
translated: The object of meditation is the knowable.

original: sgom pa po ni dngos po sgom par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgom pa po ni dngos po sgom par byed pa ste /
translated: The meditator is the one who meditates on entities.

original: sgom pa gzhal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa gzhal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Meditation is the evaluation.

original: bsgom pa ni bya ba'i bdag nyid med de /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni bya ba'i bdag nyid med de /
translated: Meditation does not have the nature of an action,

original: las dang byed pa po gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang byed pa po gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no duality of action and agent.

original: de bas na chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are emptiness.

original: yi ge'i don ni khyab par bya ba mi dmigs pas dngos po thams cad @149b kyi stong pa nyid so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge'i don ni khyab par bya ba mi dmigs pas dngos po thams cad @149b kyi stong pa nyid so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the syllables is as follows: in order to individually demonstrate the emptiness of all entities by the non-apprehension of the pervaded,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rim pas dngos po thams cad kyi stong pa nyid so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi rim pas dngos po thams cad kyi stong pa nyid so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: in order to individually demonstrate the emptiness of all entities by the sequence of the three gates of liberation,

original: steng 'og ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: steng 'og ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he said above and below, etc.

original: cha drug dang ldan pa'i sa la sogs pa'i khams bzhi'o //
analyzed: cha drug dang ldan pa'i sa la sogs pa'i khams bzhi'o //
translated: The four elements such as earth have six parts.

original: de rnams gcig dang du ma bral ba'i phyir stong pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo gcig go //
analyzed: de rnams gcig dang du ma bral ba'i phyir stong pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo gcig go //
translated: Since they are neither one nor many, they are empty. This is the one gate of liberation, which is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa ni 'dus byas pa ste phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa ni 'dus byas pa ste phung po lnga'o //
translated: The conditioned and the unconditioned are the conditioned, which is the five aggregates.

original: 'dus ma byas pa ni nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa ni nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is space, etc.

original: de dag thams cad sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas stong pa ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas stong pa ste /
translated: All of them are empty by the reasoning explained above.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is called ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sgom pa gang yin pa de ni sgom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sgom pa gang yin pa de ni sgom pa ma yin te /
translated: is the meditation of the practitioners of the perfections, but it is not meditation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par lta ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la /
translated: Because it is a view that is attached to emptiness.

original: chos thams cad stong pa yin zhes mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyi lta ba gang yin ba rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa yin zhes mngon par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyi lta ba gang yin ba rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcause‚Äù is that it is a view that is the nature of attachment to the idea that all phenomena are empty.

original: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i lta bas 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'i dngos po'i yul can gyi bsgom pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i lta bas 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'i dngos po'i yul can gyi bsgom pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to cultivate an object that is a compounded or uncompounded thing, with a view that is attached to emptiness,

original: de ni rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that [view] has no basis.

original: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa kho na bsgom pa'i rten yin no zhes pas ji ltar sgom pa dgag ce na smras pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa kho na bsgom pa'i rten yin no zhes pas ji ltar sgom pa dgag ce na smras pa /
translated: If you say that only attachment to emptiness is the basis of cultivation, how can you refute cultivation?

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ma yin par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ma yin par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that one understands an object that has the characteristic of an absolute negation, called ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang med par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang med par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Rather, it has the characteristic of a non-implicative negation.

original: de la dngos po 'dra ba yongs su 'dzin par byed pa de ma yin par dgag pa ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po 'dra ba yongs su 'dzin par byed pa de ma yin par dgag pa ste /
translated: In that case, a non-implicative negation is that which takes on the appearance of a thing.

original: dper na bram ze ma yin pa la khyer shog ces bya bas bram ze dang 'dra ba'i rgyal rigs la sogs pa khyer ba ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na bram ze ma yin pa la khyer shog ces bya bas bram ze dang 'dra ba'i rgyal rigs la sogs pa khyer ba ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: For example, when one says ‚ÄúBring the non-Brahmin,‚Äù one understands that one should bring a k·π£atriya, etc., who resembles a Brahmin.

original: med par dgag pa ni dngos po med pa nyid ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: med par dgag pa ni dngos po med pa nyid ston par byed pa'o //
translated: A non-implicative negation teaches the mere absence of a thing.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi dngos po bkag nas gang yang rung ba'i cig shos brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi dngos po bkag nas gang yang rung ba'i cig shos brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, emptiness is not expressed as the other of the negation of an existent thing.

original: gang gis mngon par zhen pa tsam yang gzhag par bya /
analyzed: gang gis mngon par zhen pa tsam yang gzhag par bya /
translated: By what means could one posit even mere adherence?

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i cha thams cad dgag pa stong pa yin no //üîΩrnam pa du mas tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i cha thams cad dgag pa stong pa yin no // rnam pa du mas tha dad pa'i //
translated: However, emptiness is the negation of all aspects of an existent thing.üîΩThings that are different in many ways

original: dngos po rnams ni gos dang 'dra //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni gos dang 'dra //
translated: are like clothes.

original: stong pa nyid mes tshig gyur na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mes tshig gyur na //
translated: When emptiness burns in the fire,

original: thal ba'i dbye ba gang yang med //üîΩsems can dang ni snod ces bya //
analyzed: thal ba'i dbye ba gang yang med // sems can dang ni snod ces bya //
translated: there is no division of ashes.üîΩThe world is burned in this twofold way:

original: 'jig rten gnyis po 'dir bsregs nas//
analyzed: 'jig rten gnyis po 'dir bsregs nas//
translated: sentient beings and the physical cosmos.

original: @150a * // rang bdag kyang ni de nyid do //
analyzed: @150a * // rang bdag kyang ni de nyid do //
translated: One‚Äôs own self is also that.

original: me sgron bzhin du zhi bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me sgron bzhin du zhi bar 'gyur // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It becomes pacified like a lamp.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis cha dang cha tsam gyi rnam par rtog pa yang spong ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ni rnam pa bco brgyad du gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis cha dang cha tsam gyi rnam par rtog pa yang spong ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ni rnam pa bco brgyad du gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn spoke of eighteen kinds of emptiness in order to abandon conceptions of part and whole.

original: lta bas byas pa'i skyon kun ni //
analyzed: lta bas byas pa'i skyon kun ni //
translated: All faults that are fabricated by views

original: spong phyir stong pa nyid gsungs so //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong phyir stong pa nyid gsungs so // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Emptiness was taught in order to abandon all views.

original: gal te nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid yin na /
translated: If emptiness has the characteristic of being devoid of all abilities,

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: then why did the Transcendent Conqueror say in the Perfection of WisdomüîΩSutra:

original: gzugs stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúForm is emptiness; emptiness is form.‚ÄùüîΩIf emptiness is a nonimplicative negation, how could it be related to

original: med par dgag pa'i phyogs ni don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po dang lhan cig tu de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i phyogs ni don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po dang lhan cig tu de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: things that perform functions in the manner of having the same nature?

original: smras pa / med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid can stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid can stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: We say that emptiness is a nonimplicative negation.üîΩHowever, since emptiness and things are related in the manner of having the

original: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid dang dngos po dag ni de'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po ni stong pa nyid yin no zhes rtogs pa dang / stong pa yang dngos po yin no zhes rtogs pas dngos po ni gud na med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid dang dngos po dag ni de'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po ni stong pa nyid yin no zhes rtogs pa dang / stong pa yang dngos po yin no zhes rtogs pas dngos po ni gud na med do //
translated: same nature, it is understood that things are emptiness, and since it is understood that emptiness is things, things do not exist apart from emptiness.

original: gal te de ltar yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar gyur pas ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar gyur pas ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is it understood that the emptiness of things is not contradictory to the performance of a function?‚Äù

original: smras pa / don dam pa don gyi bya ba byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / don dam pa don gyi bya ba byed pa ma yin te /
translated: We reply: The ultimate does not perform the function of an object,

original: 'khrul pas de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pas de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears in that way due to error.

original: dper na mya ngan gyi sa'i bye ma nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs dang phrad pas chu ltar snang ba'i ri bo'i rtse nas shin tu dga' bas 'ongs pa'i ri dags rnams kyi skom pa sel bar mi byed kyi 'on kyang rmos pa de rnams rnam par slu
analyzed: dper na mya ngan gyi sa'i bye ma nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs dang phrad pas chu ltar snang ba'i ri bo'i rtse nas shin tu dga' bas 'ongs pa'i ri dags rnams kyi skom pa sel bar mi byed kyi 'on kyang rmos pa de rnams rnam par slu
translated: For example, the sand of the desert, when it is struck by the rays of the sun, appears like water. The deer, who are tormented by thirst, come to it with great joy, but it does not quench their thirst.

original: bar byed do //
analyzed: bar byed do //
translated: On the contrary, it deceives those who are thirsty.

original: de bzhin du dngos po 'di rnams kyis dngos po las mngon par zhen pa 'khrul pa med pa'i sems kyi rgyu dang ldan pa thob ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis ye shes kyi mig btsums pa rnams kyis don gyi bya ba mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po 'di rnams kyis dngos po las mngon par zhen pa 'khrul pa med pa'i sems kyi rgyu dang ldan pa thob ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis ye shes kyi mig btsums pa rnams kyis don gyi bya ba mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, those who are attached to the reality of things, who are endowed with the cause of the non-erroneous mind, who are blinded by the latent impressions of ignorance, do not perform the function of an object with respect to the ultimate.

original: de rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don gyi bya ba gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba yin gyi bag chags rags pas blo'i me long bsgribs pa bdag cag lta
analyzed: de rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don gyi bya ba gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba yin gyi bag chags rags pas blo'i me long bsgribs pa bdag cag lta
translated: The meaning of the term is that which is to be realized by yogins and yoginƒ´s, the activity that is characterized by the manifestation of the suchness of the dharmadhƒÅtu.üîΩ

original: bu la mi snang ste /
analyzed: bu la mi snang ste /
translated: The meaning of the action of the yogis to realize the reality of the dharmadhatu is not seen by us, who are obscured by the mirror of the mind with its coarse latent tendencies.

original: mi shes pa'i dri ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i dri ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we have the stain of ignorance.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sos ka'i dus su smig rgyu ni //
analyzed: sos ka'i dus su smig rgyu ni //
translated: In the spring season, a mirage

original: ji ltar sems 'khrul g-yo ba ste //üîΩri dags rnams kyis chur 'dzin @150b pa ;
analyzed: ji ltar sems 'khrul g-yo ba ste // ri dags rnams kyis chur 'dzin @150b pa ;
translated: moves,üîΩand the deer, mistaking it for water,

original: / de la chu ngoms yod pa min //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: / de la chu ngoms yod pa min // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: are not satisfied with it.

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: And also:

original: phra bar gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: phra bar gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: The Buddha, who sees the subtle,

original: phra phyir de ni rang rig yin //
analyzed: phra phyir de ni rang rig yin //
translated: says that it is subtle and self-knowing.

original: rang gnas kyang ni bdag 'dra bas //
analyzed: rang gnas kyang ni bdag 'dra bas //
translated: But I, who am like a self-abiding one,

original: blo rags phyir ni ma mthong ngo //üîΩrnal 'byor rig par nam yang ni //
analyzed: blo rags phyir ni ma mthong ngo // rnal 'byor rig par nam yang ni //
translated: do not see it because my mind is coarse.

original: thar pa'i 'du shes ring mi bya //
analyzed: thar pa'i 'du shes ring mi bya //
translated: The yogi should never have the notion of liberation.

original: brtags pa'i ngang tshul rang bdag nyid //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngang tshul rang bdag nyid //
translated: The nature of the investigation is the self-nature.üîΩ

original: stong par mthong na thar pa yin //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong par mthong na thar pa yin // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the imagined is seen to be empty, and that is liberation.

original: de bas na de'i bdag nyid kyi dgag pas dngos po rnams stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i bdag nyid kyi dgag pas dngos po rnams stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the negation of that nature, things are empty.

original: de yang med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid yin pas stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: de yang med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid yin pas stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: And since that is a negation of non-existence, there is no attachment to emptiness.

original: des ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang po bstan to //
analyzed: des ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang po bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching of the first door of liberation called ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma bzlog par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma bzlog par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: In order to reverse the notion of signs,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to teach the second door of liberation.

original: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes pa ni rgyu ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes pa ni rgyu ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCause and effect‚Äù means that the cause, which has the characteristic of the twelve members of dependent origination, is called ‚Äúaffliction, action, and birth.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu ni sems can gyi khams rigs bzhi'i dbye bas phye bar gyur pa mtho ris dang ngan song zhes grags pa 'gro ba drug go //

analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam pa ni so sor snang ba'o //

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis su med pa'i phyir ni bya ba dang byed pa dag gnyis su med pa ste rgyu ni rang bzhin gyis ngo bo med pa dang / 'bras bu yang rang bzhin gyis ngo bo med ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis su med pa'i phyir ni bya ba dang byed pa dag gnyis su med pa ste rgyu ni rang bzhin gyis ngo bo med pa dang / 'bras bu yang rang bzhin gyis ngo bo med ba'o //
translated: Because cause and result are nondual, the doer and the deed are nondual. The cause is essentially nonexistent by nature, and the result is also essentially nonexistent by nature.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa dang bral dngos po de rnams de bas na //

analyzed: phyi'i rnam pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'o //

analyzed: ji skad du //

analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //

analyzed: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //

analyzed: de la stong pa nyid yod de //

original: de la yod na de yod do //
analyzed: de la yod na de yod do //

original: yod dang med dang yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yod dang med dang yod pa'i phyir //

original: sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: zhes pa ni sems nyid so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / so sor snang ba rab skyes pa //

original: rnam par shes pa de don med //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de don med //

original: de med pas kyang de yang med //
analyzed: de med pas kyang de yang med //

analyzed: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //

analyzed: gnyis pa nye bar longs spyod pa //

analyzed: spyod dang gcod dang skul byed ni //

analyzed: de la sems las 'byung ba yin // zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: spyi'i @153b don zhes bya ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i 'gyod pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo sde pa la sogs pa rnams kyi phyogs ni phyi rol gyi don med pa dang rnam par rig pa tsam yod pa'o //

analyzed: gang phung po la sogs pa zhes pa la //

analyzed: de rnams med pa ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir med pa'o // de bas na phyi rol tu gyur pa phung po la sogs pa med pas rnam par shes pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu yod pa zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnams kyi phyogs so //

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsgom par bya bar gyur pa phung po la sogs pa med pas 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa mtha' yas pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsgom par bya bar gyur pa phung po la sogs pa med pas 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa mtha' yas pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /

original: sems tsam gang yin pa ni zhes pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: sems tsam gang yin pa ni zhes pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo //

original: de ni dngos po med de zhes pa la //
analyzed: de ni dngos po med de zhes pa la //

analyzed: ma dag pa yin pas grol ba thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //

analyzed: shes bya med bas shes pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: shes bya'i sngon du shes pa na //

analyzed: ci la dmigs te de 'byung 'gyur //

original: shes bya 'jig nas shes pa na //
analyzed: shes bya 'jig nas shes pa na //

analyzed: ci la dmigs te de 'byung 'gyur // shes dang shes bya lhan cig na // ci la dmigs te de 'byung 'gyur //
translated: what does cognition arise observing?üîΩWhen cognition and object of cognition are simultaneous,

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: what does cognition arise observing?

original: yang na rtag tu med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni //
analyzed: yang na rtag tu med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni //
translated: Because it is not always non-existent.

original: rtag tu ni dus thams cad de dus gsum la yang sems ni med do //
analyzed: rtag tu ni dus thams cad de dus gsum la yang sems ni med do //
translated: At all times, in all three times, mind does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni 'jig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni 'jig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the past mind does not exist, since it has perished.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyang ma phrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems kyang ma phrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The future mind has not yet arisen.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes ma grags so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes ma grags so //
translated: It is not known as consciousness.

original: da ltar byung ba yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma dang ldan pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no zhes dus gsum gyi rang bzhin sems med do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma dang ldan pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no zhes dus gsum gyi rang bzhin sems med do //
translated: The present mind is not tenable, since it is endowed with the past and future moments.

original: gang 'das pa ni de 'jig pa //
analyzed: gang 'das pa ni de 'jig pa //
translated: The past is destroyed.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma thob ste //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma thob ste //
translated: The future is not attained.üîΩThe present does not endure,

original: skad cig gnyis ka ldan pa'i phyir //üîΩda ltar byung ba gang la gnas//üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis ka ldan pa'i phyir // da ltar byung ba gang la gnas// zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: since it is endowed with two moments.

original: de bas na rigs pa 'dis //
analyzed: de bas na rigs pa 'dis //
translated: Thus, by this reasoning,

original: sems rnam par dpyad pa rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dpyad pa rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal bar bya'o //
translated: the mind, which is the nature of the three consciousnesses, should be clarified by the mantra and seal stages.

original: des ni ye shes gsum dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid sbas pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni ye shes gsum dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid sbas pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the hidden meaning, which is the analysis of the three intuitions.

original: gang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid @154a * //
analyzed: gang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid @154a * //
translated: That which has the nature of the reality of the conventional

original: can zhes pa la //
analyzed: can zhes pa la //
translated: The second line of the root verse states:üîΩ

original: 'od gsal ba las myur du 'am snang ba thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas brgya byin gyi gzhung dang 'dra ba'i ye shes kyi sku gang spros pa sgyu ma lta bu'i lha'i sku bsgom pa ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las myur du 'am snang ba thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas brgya byin gyi gzhung dang 'dra ba'i ye shes kyi sku gang spros pa sgyu ma lta bu'i lha'i sku bsgom pa ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The body of wisdom, which is quickly attained from the clear light, by the process of attaining the appearance, and so forth, which is like the scripture of Indra, is the illusory body of the deity, which is cultivated as the illusion-like emanation, and is illustrated by the twelve examples of illusion.

original: de yang mi rigs te zhes pa ni de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te zhes pa ni de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pas so //
translated: And that is not reasonable, because it is not the nature of reality.

original: 'od gsal bar rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bzhi pas de yang sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal bar rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bzhi pas de yang sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is purified into the clear light, and that is to be purified by the fourth stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa tsam gyi dngos po ni zhes pa la bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid lha'i sku'i rnam pa'o//
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa tsam gyi dngos po ni zhes pa la bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid lha'i sku'i rnam pa'o//
translated: Thus, the entity of the mere reality of the conventional is the form of the body of the deity, which has the characteristic of the body of wisdom, to be attained by the stage of self-consecration.üîΩIt is not an entity, because

original: dngos po ma yin te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin te zhes pa ni /
translated: It is not a thing.üîΩ

original: don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: not ultimately.

original: de gnyis pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gnyis su snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gnyis su snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not transcend duality, because of the appearance of duality.

original: der ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lha'i rnam pa dang / sgyu ma'i dpe de gnyis so sor snang ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: der ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lha'i rnam pa dang / sgyu ma'i dpe de gnyis so sor snang ba yod pa'o //
translated: There, the appearance of the divine form as like an illusion and the appearance of the example of the illusion are separate.

original: gang dang gang du gnyis so sor snang ba yod pa de dang de ru 'khor ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang du gnyis so sor snang ba yod pa de dang de ru 'khor ba kho na yin te /
translated: Wherever there is the appearance of duality, there is only cyclic existence,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa so sor snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa so sor snang ba bzhin no //
translated: just as there is the appearance of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: de'i phyir na de yang rnam par dag par bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de yang rnam par dag par bya bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is proper to purify that.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa bzhi'i 'bras bu zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i phan yon tsam bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rim pa bzhi'i 'bras bu zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i phan yon tsam bstan to //
translated: Thus, he explains the benefit of the stage of union, the result of the four stages.

original: bden pa gnyis lta bur bsgom pa ni zhes pa la kun rdzob don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis lta bur bsgom pa ni zhes pa la kun rdzob don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the two truths as a pair is the meditation on the stage of union, the essence of the indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: dka' bas dmigs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: dka' bas dmigs pa yin pas so //
translated: It is difficult to meditate on the two truths as a pair, because of the difficulty of the object.

original: zhes pa ni sngon bsags pa'i dge ba'i stobs dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su skye ba dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang 'brel pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pas thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngon bsags pa'i dge ba'i stobs dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su skye ba dang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang 'brel pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pas thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it is attained by the power of previously accumulated virtue, by meeting a spiritual friend, by being born in a suitable place, by being related to the family of the bodhisattvas, and by the blessing of the buddhas.

original: des ni kun rdzob bden pa yang dag par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can sbas pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: des ni kun rdzob bden pa yang dag par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can sbas pa'i don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the hidden meaning, which is characterized by the correct realization of conventional truth.

original: sbas pa zhes pa la sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa brjod par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: sbas pa zhes pa la sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa brjod par 'dod pas so //
translated: The word hidden is used because it is intended to express the purification of the mind and the stage of self-consecration.

original: don dam pa'i bden pas zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas thob par bya ba mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pas zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas thob par bya ba mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba la'o //
translated: The phrase by means of ultimate truth refers to the stage of manifest enlightenment, which is to be attained by means of the stages of seal and meditative concentration.

original: sgom pa med pa ste zhes pa ni sgom pa'i rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgom pa med pa ste zhes pa ni sgom pa'i rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The phrase not by meditation means that it is not to be attained by the method of meditation.

original: gang gi phyir sgom pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam par dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid can rtog bcas kyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ste 'dus @154b byas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgom pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam par dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid can rtog bcas kyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ste 'dus @154b byas so //
translated: Because what is called ‚Äúcultivation‚Äù is the nature of conceptual consciousness, which has the characteristic of mental analysis, and is conditioned.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rdzas su med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: The ultimate truth is unconditioned because it does not exist substantially.

original: 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that conditioned and unconditioned are related as cause and effect,

original: bum pa dang nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: like a pot and space.

original: gang gi 'dus byas pa nyid 'dus byas pa'i rgyu 'am 'bras bur 'thad de nas kyi sa bon dang nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi 'dus byas pa nyid 'dus byas pa'i rgyu 'am 'bras bur 'thad de nas kyi sa bon dang nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
translated: If it were conditioned, it would be tenable that it is the cause or effect of a conditioned phenomenon, like barley seed and barley sprout.

original: de bzhin du yang 'jim pa dang dbyug pa dang 'khor lo dang skud pa dang skyes pa'i lag pa'i rtsol ba rnams kyis bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang 'jim pa dang dbyug pa dang 'khor lo dang skud pa dang skyes pa'i lag pa'i rtsol ba rnams kyis bum pa bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, it is like a pot in relation to clay, a stick, a wheel, string, and the effort of the potter‚Äôs hands.

original: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi ngo bo don dam pa'i bden pa la de ltar bsgom pa mi rigs te //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi ngo bo don dam pa'i bden pa la de ltar bsgom pa mi rigs te //
translated: It is not tenable to cultivate the nature of the ultimate truth, which is the reality of all phenomena, in that way.

original: rtag pa bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the permanent is not to be generated.

original: ma grub pa 'am ma dag pa gang yin pa de thob par bya ba'am rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa 'am ma dag pa gang yin pa de thob par bya ba'am rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bya ba yin te /
translated: That which is not established or is impure is to be cultivated in order to attain it or to purify it.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis grub pa'am rnam par dag pa yin pa de la sgom pas dgos pa med do //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis grub pa'am rnam par dag pa yin pa de la sgom pas dgos pa med do //
translated: But that which is naturally established or pure has no need of cultivation.

original: gal te yod na don dam pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na don dam pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, it would not be the ultimate.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: gzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir zhes te /
analyzed: gzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir zhes te /
translated: because of primordial purity.

original: rtag pa ni dri ma med pa zag pa med pa ni thog ma nas dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni dri ma med pa zag pa med pa ni thog ma nas dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The permanent, which is stainless and uncontaminated, is pure from the beginning.

original: gal te de lta yin na mngon par byang chub pa thob par bya ba'i phyir phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'i sgom pa ci'i phyir bya zhe na //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na mngon par byang chub pa thob par bya ba'i phyir phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'i sgom pa ci'i phyir bya zhe na //
translated: If this is so, why cultivate the stages of concentration and the seal in order to attain manifest enlightenment?

original: smras pa / phyag rgya'i 'brel pa'am ting nge 'dzin mngon du bya bas 'od gsal ba ni skye ba'am sbyang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / phyag rgya'i 'brel pa'am ting nge 'dzin mngon du bya bas 'od gsal ba ni skye ba'am sbyang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The clear light is not to be generated or purified by the practice of the seal or by the realization of samadhi,

original: de nyid gzod ma nas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid gzod ma nas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is primordially existent.

original: phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis glo bur gyi dri ma bsal bar bya ba yin gyi //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin tsam gyis glo bur gyi dri ma bsal bar bya ba yin gyi //
translated: It is to be purified by the mere seal and samadhi, which remove the adventitious defilements,

original: de kho na nyid thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the attainment of reality.

original: de kho na nyid ni rang snang ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni rang snang ba ste /
translated: Reality is self-illuminating,

original: nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: like space.üîΩIt is asserted that it is pure like

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' yi //üîΩdag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //üîΩces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' yi // dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod // ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the water element, gold, and space.

original: des ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rim pa bzhi pa ston to //
analyzed: des ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rim pa bzhi pa ston to //
translated: Thus, this verse teaches the fourth stage, which has the characteristic of entering the clear light.

original: gang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la rim pa gsum pas thob par bya ba'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sku sgom pa de yang bsgom par bya ba ma yin zhes pa la bsam par bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la rim pa gsum pas thob par bya ba'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sku sgom pa de yang bsgom par bya ba ma yin zhes pa la bsam par bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: That which has the nature of the conventional truth, the cultivation of the illusory body to be attained by the third stage, is not to be cultivated, that is, it is not proper to be contemplated.

original: mi bden pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhi pas rnam par dag pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhi pas rnam par dag pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not true, because it is in relation to the purity of the fourth stage.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: By this ‚Äúaspect‚Äù and so on, the samƒÅdhi of the stage of union is taught.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi @155a * //üîΩbdag nyid zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi @155a * // bdag nyid zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The nature of the two truths

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: is the samƒÅdhi of union, the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: dngos po'i bsgom par bya ba mi 'gyur te zhes pa ni de nyid bsam par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i bsgom par bya ba mi 'gyur te zhes pa ni de nyid bsam par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The object of cultivation does not exist, that is, it is not to be contemplated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med par mthong ba tsam gyis grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings mngon du gyur pa tsam gyis rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir
analyzed: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med par mthong ba tsam gyis grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings mngon du gyur pa tsam gyis rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir
translated: Because one is liberated merely by seeing the two truths as nondual. This is because one attains complete liberation merely by realizing the basic element of nonabiding nirvana, the nature of the inseparability of the two truths.

original: ro // de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa nye bar bsdus pa bstan te /
analyzed: ro // de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa nye bar bsdus pa bstan te /
translated: Therefore, and so on, teaches the summary of the stage of union.

original: sgom pa po zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa po zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The meditator is the yogi.

original: sgom pa ni bsgom pa'i shes rab bsgom par bya ba ni bsgom du rung ba'i man ngag go //
analyzed: sgom pa ni bsgom pa'i shes rab bsgom par bya ba ni bsgom du rung ba'i man ngag go //
translated: Meditation is the meditation of wisdom. To be meditated is the instruction suitable for meditation.

original: de ltar mngon par zhen pa ni 'di nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par zhen pa ni 'di nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Thus refers to the nondual wisdom. Conception is the conception of that.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rtogs pa rnams la zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa'o //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rtogs pa rnams la zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa'o //
translated: For those who understand the stage of union is the attainment of the basic element of nonabiding nirvana.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste mi slong ba'i phyir ro //
