analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste mi slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the case that it exists for yogins, because it is not aroused.

original: zung 'jug ting 'dzin la gnas pas //
analyzed: zung 'jug ting 'dzin la gnas pas //
translated: Abiding in the samƒÅdhi of union,

original: slar zhing gang la mi slob po //
analyzed: slar zhing gang la mi slob po //
translated: there is no further training.

original: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes //
analyzed: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes //
translated: This is called the perfect yoga,

original: de ni rdo rje 'chang chen po //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje 'chang chen po //
translated: and that is the Great Vajradhara.

original: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa'i //
translated: Endowed with the supreme of all aspects,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa de nas 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa de nas 'gyur //
translated: he becomes omniscient.

original: 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa //
translated: The past, the future,

original: da ltar byung ba srid gsum la //üîΩde yis skad cig ma lus par //üîΩ'od gsal rnam dag 'dzin pas mthong //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba srid gsum la // de yis skad cig ma lus par // 'od gsal rnam dag 'dzin pas mthong //
translated: and the present of the three existencesüîΩare seen by him, in every moment,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: as clear light, pure, by the power of his retention.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs te zhes bya ba ni sdud pa po'i tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs te zhes bya ba ni sdud pa po'i tshig go //
translated: The Great Vajradhara said is the statement of the compiler.

original: mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa dang zung du 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa dang zung du 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ultimate is said because it teaches clear light and union.

original: de ltar yi ge'i don gyis bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa dang / spyi'i don gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi sgom pas mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i 'gyod pa sel ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar yi ge'i don gyis bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa dang / spyi'i don gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi sgom pas mdo sde pa la sogs pa'i 'gyod pa sel ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don bstan to //
translated: Thus, the reality of emptiness, which is a branch of the creation stage, is taught by the meaning of the syllables, and the meaning of the general meaning, which is the meditation of the three doors of liberation, is taught, which has the characteristic of dispelling the doubts of the Sutra Followers, and so on.

original: sbas pa'i don gyis sems rnam par dag pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa dag bstan to //
analyzed: sbas pa'i don gyis sems rnam par dag pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa dag bstan to //
translated: The hidden meaning teaches the purification of the mind and the stage of self-consecration.üîΩThe ultimate meaning teaches the stage of union, which is the entry into clear light.

original: mthar thug pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa dag bstan to zhes rdo rje 'chang chen po'i tshigs su bcad pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs gcig dang rdo rje bzlas pa ma gtogs @155b pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: mthar thug pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa dag bstan to zhes rdo rje 'chang chen po'i tshigs su bcad pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs gcig dang rdo rje bzlas pa ma gtogs @155b pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang bstan to //
translated: Thus, the creation stage of Great Vajradhara is taught, except for the creation stage and vajra repetition, and also the completion stage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la rdo rje 'chang lnga'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la rdo rje 'chang lnga'i'o //
translated: All tathƒÅgatas means the five Vajradharas.

original: rnam pa kun nas zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi bya ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa kun nas zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi bya ba rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù means by the activities of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid de gtan tshigs ni 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid de gtan tshigs ni 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIllumination‚Äù means the nature of the TathƒÅgatas‚Äô illumination, because of the reason of transcendence.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la dmigs pa zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas thob par bya ba'i mngon par byang chub pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la dmigs pa zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas thob par bya ba'i mngon par byang chub pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe meditative concentration that has that as its object‚Äù means the meditative concentration of manifest enlightenment that is to be attained by the stages of the seal and meditative concentration, that is to say.

original: snod du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad do //
analyzed: snod du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad do //
translated: ‚ÄúA vessel‚Äù and so on refers to all things such as the self and ƒ™≈õvara.

original: thams cad dang bral ba ni de dag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad dang bral ba ni de dag dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from everything‚Äù means free from them.

original: de la bdag ces bya ba sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas med do //
analyzed: de la bdag ces bya ba sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas med do //
translated: There, the so-called self does not exist by the reasoning explained above.

original: de la rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ga las 'gyur //
analyzed: de la rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ga las 'gyur //
translated: From where would there be such things as permanence?

original: bdag ces bya ba dngos po med //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba dngos po med //
translated: The so-called self is a non-entity.

original: byed pa po zhes ga las brjod //
analyzed: byed pa po zhes ga las brjod //
translated: From where is it said to be an agent?

original: chos can yod na 'jig rten pas //
analyzed: chos can yod na 'jig rten pas //
translated: If the subject exists, then the worldlyüîΩcan engage in thought about the object.

original: chos la bsam pa rab tu 'jug / phung po bdag min der de min //
analyzed: chos la bsam pa rab tu 'jug / phung po bdag min der de min //
translated: The aggregates are not the self, nor does the self possess them,

original: de la de med de med min //
analyzed: de la de med de med min //
translated: nor do they exist in the self, nor is the self in them.

original: me shing bzhin du 'dres pa min //
analyzed: me shing bzhin du 'dres pa min //
translated: They are not mixed like fire and fuel.

original: de phyir bdag ces ji ltar yod //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de phyir bdag ces ji ltar yod // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, how can the self exist?

original: de'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the above.

original: bdag ni phung po yin no zhes brjod pa mi rigs te de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pas phung po bzhin du bdag dang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag ni phung po yin no zhes brjod pa mi rigs te de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pas phung po bzhin du bdag dang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is illogical to say that the self is the aggregates, because, like the aggregates, the self would be impermanent due to the connection of its identity.

original: rigs pa pa rnams kyi phyogs ni bdag ces brtan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa pa rnams kyi phyogs ni bdag ces brtan pa'o //
translated: The position of the logicians is that the self is permanent.

original: skyon de sel bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: skyon de sel bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to eliminate that fault,

original: bdag la phung po yod ces phyogs 'dzin na /
analyzed: bdag la phung po yod ces phyogs 'dzin na /
translated: if one holds the position that the self possesses the aggregates,

original: de'i tshe rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the permanent and the impermanent would not be connected as basis and that which is based on the basis.

original: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa ni //üîΩrtag dang mi rtag dag gi med //
analyzed: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa ni // rtag dang mi rtag dag gi med //
translated: The connection of basis and that which is based on the basis

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: does not exist for the permanent and the impermanent.

original: 'o na gzhi rtag pa yin na gzhi can rnams mi rtag pa yin no zhes 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhi rtag pa yin na gzhi can rnams mi rtag pa yin no zhes 'dod ce na /
translated: But if you maintain that the basis is permanent, then the things based on it are impermanent.

original: smras pa / gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: We reply: The relation of basis and based would not exist.

original: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The relation of basis and based is the relation of cause and effect,

original: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ni gzhi can mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ni gzhi can mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not logical that the based is not something that is benefited.

original: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa nyin ni gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa nyid yin no //üîΩrgyus ni 'bras bu la phan 'dogs na rang la gnas pa'i chos dang med par mi 'byung bas nges par phan 'dogs par byed pa dang / 'bras bus kyang rgyu la gnas pa'i chos ma blangs pas @156a * //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa nyin ni gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa nyid yin no // rgyus ni 'bras bu la phan 'dogs na rang la gnas pa'i chos dang med par mi 'byung bas nges par phan 'dogs par byed pa dang / 'bras bus kyang rgyu la gnas pa'i chos ma blangs pas @156a * //
translated: The relation of basis and based is the relation of benefactor and beneficiary.üîΩIf the cause benefits the effect, it must benefit it by being inseparable from the effect, because it is illogical that what is not a benefactor benefits.

original: de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the effect must be benefited by the cause, because if the effect does not take up the cause, it would not arise.

original: de bas na gal te bdag dang phung po dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa khas blangs na de'i tshe phung po mi rtag pas kyang bdag kyang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gal te bdag dang phung po dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa khas blangs na de'i tshe phung po mi rtag pas kyang bdag kyang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if you accept a relationship of cause and effect between the self and the aggregates, then since the aggregates are impermanent, the self would also be impermanent.

original: gal te bdag rtag pa yin na //
analyzed: gal te bdag rtag pa yin na //
translated: If the self were permanent,

original: phung po rnams kyang rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyang rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the aggregates would also be permanent.

original: de yang ma mthong ste rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ma mthong ste rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not seen, because it contradicts the tenets of our own and other schools.

original: gzhan yang bdag gzhi yin mod kyi de yang rgyu yin pas phung po bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu byung na 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag gzhi yin mod kyi de yang rgyu yin pas phung po bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu byung na 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the self would be a basis, but since it would also be a cause, when the effect of the aggregates arises, the self would be destroyed.

original: phyogs gnyis ka la yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ka la yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And both positions would be impermanent.

original: gal te phung po la bdag yod de zhes 'dod na de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gal te phung po la bdag yod de zhes 'dod na de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa mi 'grub po //
translated: If you assert that the self exists in the aggregates, then, as before, the relationship of basis and what is based on it is not established.

original: de lta yin mod kyi de bzhin du yang phung po rnams gzhi yin pas rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnams nges par mi 'byung ngo zhes pas phung po rnams kyis bdag skye bar mi 'gyur bas bdag kyang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi de bzhin du yang phung po rnams gzhi yin pas rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnams nges par mi 'byung ngo zhes pas phung po rnams kyis bdag skye bar mi 'gyur bas bdag kyang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But even so, the self would not arise from the aggregates, because the aggregates are not its cause, since they are not its basis.

original: gal te res 'ga' byung na de'i tshe de rnams kyis bdag bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te res 'ga' byung na de'i tshe de rnams kyis bdag bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self sometimes arose, then it would be refuted by those aggregates.

original: gang zhig res 'ga' byung ba de ni rtag pa ma yin te lam gyi skyes bu'i bzhin no zhes de nyid mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig res 'ga' byung ba de ni rtag pa ma yin te lam gyi skyes bu'i bzhin no zhes de nyid mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that which sometimes arises is not permanent, like a person on the road. Thus, the self would be impermanent.

original: phung po dang bdag phan tshun tha mi dad pa ste me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: phung po dang bdag phan tshun tha mi dad pa ste me dang bud shing bzhin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the self and the aggregates are not different from each other, like fire and fuel,

original: de'i tshe bud shing rnams sol ba bzhin du 'gyur ba me  zhes brjod pa de bzhin du bdag ni phung po'i ngo bo nyid 'thob /
analyzed: de'i tshe bud shing rnams sol ba bzhin du 'gyur ba me  zhes brjod pa de bzhin du bdag ni phung po'i ngo bo nyid 'thob /
translated: then just as fuel is called fire, the self would be the intrinsic reality of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i tha snyad du brjod do zhes shin tu mi rtag pa nyid khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po'i tha snyad du brjod do zhes shin tu mi rtag pa nyid khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: And just as the aggregates are called the self, the self would be utterly impermanent.

original: de bas na phyogs bzhi po yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyogs bzhi po yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, none of the four positions is good.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po la rnam pa gzhi bkag nas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yang phan tshun bdag tu smra ba khas blangs pa bkag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po la rnam pa gzhi bkag nas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yang phan tshun bdag tu smra ba khas blangs pa bkag par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, having refuted the other three aspects of the form aggregate, the mutual selfhood of feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness should be understood to be refuted.

original: des ni ri'i rtse mo rnam pa nyi shu las byung ba'i 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba bkag go //
analyzed: des ni ri'i rtse mo rnam pa nyi shu las byung ba'i 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba bkag go //
translated: By this, the twenty aspects of the perishable collection view are refuted.

original: gang gis 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ma lus pa 'di nyid mtshan du 'khrul 'khor gyi rigs pas 'khor ba zhes bdag tu smra ba'i phyogs bkag pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ma lus pa 'di nyid mtshan du 'khrul 'khor gyi rigs pas 'khor ba zhes bdag tu smra ba'i phyogs bkag pa'o //
translated: By this, the position of the self-theorist is refuted, that this entire wheel of cyclic life is a wheel of life by the reasoning of a machine.

original: dbang phyug dang thams cad byed pa dang thams cad 'jig par byed pa nus pa gsum gyis sprul pa'i bdag nyid che brtag pa yin no zhes 'gal ba ste gang gi phyir gal te thams cad byed cing 'jig par byed pa na de'i tshe cig car du byed
analyzed: dbang phyug dang thams cad byed pa dang thams cad 'jig par byed pa nus pa gsum gyis sprul pa'i bdag nyid che brtag pa yin no zhes 'gal ba ste gang gi phyir gal te thams cad byed cing 'jig par byed pa na de'i tshe cig car du byed
translated: The great self, which is the nature of the emanation of the three powers of the creator, the doer of all, and the destroyer, is contradictory, because if it does all, then it does all at once.

original: pa'am 'jig pa ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: pa'am 'jig pa ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: Why does it not cause the destruction of the effect?

original: @156b de mi byed pas rim gyis byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @156b de mi byed pas rim gyis byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Since it does not cause the destruction, it does not cause the effect gradually.

original: de nyid mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is impermanence.

original: gang gi phyir gang gi dus su byed na de'i tshe de la nus pa yod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi dus su byed na de'i tshe de la nus pa yod de /
translated: Because when it causes something at a certain time, at that time it has the ability to do so.

original: dus gzhan du de med do zhes ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan du de med do zhes ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: It does not exist at another time.üîΩIt is dependent.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i nus pa med pa ste /üîΩlhan cig byed pa la ltos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i nus pa med pa ste / lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not an existent that is dependent,

original: bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because it depends on the assemblage of causes and conditions, like a pot.

original: de bas na dbang phyug med do //
analyzed: de bas na dbang phyug med do //
translated: Therefore, ƒ™≈õvara does not exist.üîΩSome assert that the creator, the agent, the determiner, the nature,

original: sgrub dang byed pa nges par rang bzhin dang // dus dang gza' dang dbang phyug lha nyid dang // rgal ba bsod nams gshin rje mthar byed ni //
analyzed: sgrub dang byed pa nges par rang bzhin dang // dus dang gza' dang dbang phyug lha nyid dang // rgal ba bsod nams gshin rje mthar byed ni //
translated: time, the planets, ƒ™≈õvara, the gods,

original: mngon du byas pa'i ming gi rnam grangs yin //üîΩzhes la la 'dod de //
analyzed: mngon du byas pa'i ming gi rnam grangs yin // zhes la la 'dod de //
translated: the expeller, merit, and Yama are synonyms for the manifest.üîΩSome assert that the creator is the cause of the creation of these things.

original: de la sgrub pa zhes pas dngos po 'di dag skyed par byed pa dang // 'jig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa zhes pas dngos po 'di dag skyed par byed pa dang // 'jig par byed pa ste /
translated: The agent is the cause of their destruction.

original: de nyid gcig pu 'gro ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gcig pu 'gro ba'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the cause of the migration of beings,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: rang gi las kyi bag chags kyis sprul pa'i khams gsum pa la sprul pa gzhan ni med de de nyid sngar bkag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi bag chags kyis sprul pa'i khams gsum pa la sprul pa gzhan ni med de de nyid sngar bkag pa'i phyir ro // lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //
translated: There is no other emanation in the three realms, which are emanated by the latent impressions of one‚Äôs own karma, because that has been refuted above.üîΩAs it is said:üîΩThe virtuous and nonvirtuous actions of body, speech, and mind

original: dge dang mi dge rang gis byas //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge rang gis byas //
translated: are done by oneself.

original: 'jig rten pa yis de 'bras spyod //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yis de 'bras spyod //
translated: The world experiences the results of those actions.

original: byed pa gzhan ni kha cig med //üîΩces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa gzhan ni kha cig med // ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no other agent.

original: byed pa po zhes bya ba rnam par dpyad na med de /
analyzed: byed pa po zhes bya ba rnam par dpyad na med de /
translated: When the so-called agent is analyzed, it does not exist.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i rgyun gyi phung po rnams 'khor ba nyid khams gsum zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i rgyun gyi phung po rnams 'khor ba nyid khams gsum zhes bshad do //
translated: The continuum of the aggregates, which is the continuum of afflictions, karma, and birth, is explained to be the three realms.

original: khur bu khur ba ltar kha cig gang zag yod do //
analyzed: khur bu khur ba ltar kha cig gang zag yod do //
translated: Some say that the person exists, like a burden that is carried.

original: gang gis phung po 'di rnams spangs te ;
analyzed: gang gis phung po 'di rnams spangs te ;
translated: It is the one who abandons these aggregates

original: phung po gzhan len pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gzhan len pa'o //
translated: and takes up other aggregates.

original: 'dir gang zag ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir gang zag ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid do //
translated: Here the person is the consciousness itself, which possesses the latent imprints of karma and afflictions.

original: de nyid khams gsum gyi ngo bor yongs su 'khor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid khams gsum gyi ngo bor yongs su 'khor bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is that which completely cycles in the nature of the three realms.

original: de bas na byed pa po gzhan med do //
analyzed: de bas na byed pa po gzhan med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no other agent.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag ces brjod de /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag ces brjod de /
translated: ‚ÄúNecessity‚Äù is called the ‚ÄúLord of Death.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyis 'gro ba bskyed cing 'jig par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'gro ba bskyed cing 'jig par byed do zhe na /
translated: It is that which generates and destroys migrating beings.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so.

original: gal te 'chi bdag yin na de'i tshe 'jig pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin gyi //
analyzed: gal te 'chi bdag yin na de'i tshe 'jig pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin gyi //
translated: If it is the Lord of Death, then at that time it has the power to destroy, but

original: skye ba'i nus pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i nus pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it does not have the power to generate.

original: skye ba'i nus pa dang ldan na 'chi bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i nus pa dang ldan na 'chi bdag ma yin no //
translated: If it has the power to generate, it is not the Lord of Death.

original: de bas na nges pa'i smra ba 'di ni brtags pa pa  yin no//
analyzed: de bas na nges pa'i smra ba 'di ni brtags pa pa  yin no//
translated: Therefore, this assertion of necessity is a fabrication.

original: rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang tshe 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang tshe 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: If consciousness, the sense faculties, and life cease,

original: shi'o zhes brjod pas 'chi bdag med do //
analyzed: shi'o zhes brjod pas 'chi bdag med do //
translated: it is called ‚Äúdeath.‚Äù Therefore, the Lord of Death does not exist.

original: rang bzhin gyis smra ba'i phyogs su dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi thams cad rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis smra ba'i phyogs su dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs par skye bar mi 'gyur gyi thams cad rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the position of natural origination, things would not arise in various ways, but everything would have the same nature.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the diversity is the nature,

original: smras pa / de ltar @157a * //
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar @157a * //
translated: we reply:

original: yin na cig car du skye ba dang 'jig par ji ltar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yin na cig car du skye ba dang 'jig par ji ltar mi 'gyur //
translated: If that were so, how could there be simultaneous arising and destruction?

original: de bas na rang bzhin gyis smra ba'i phyogs ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gyis smra ba'i phyogs ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, the position of the proponents of svabhƒÅva is unreasonable.

original: dus smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: dus smra ba rnams na re /
translated: The proponents of time say,

original: dus kyi 'byung ba smin par 'gyur //üîΩzhes zer na /
analyzed: dus kyi 'byung ba smin par 'gyur // zhes zer na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe elements are ripened by time.‚Äù

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That is also unreasonable.

original: gang gi phyir dus de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dbye bas gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dbye bas gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Because that time would be threefold, divided into past, present, and future.

original: 'das pa ni zhig pa'i phyir smin par byed pa'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: 'das pa ni zhig pa'i phyir smin par byed pa'i nus pa med do //
translated: The past, because it has ceased, does not have the ability to ripen.

original: ma 'ongs pas kyang smin pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pas kyang smin pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The future also does not have the ability to ripen because it has not yet been obtained.

original: da ltar byung ba la yang nus pa med de skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la yang nus pa med de skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The present also does not have the ability because it is momentary.

original: de bas na skye ba'am 'jig pa'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na skye ba'am 'jig pa'i nus pa med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not have the ability to give rise to or destroy.

original: gzhan yang nyin mo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid nyi ma la sogs pas byas pa zla ba la sogs pa'i dus yin no zhes mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyin mo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid nyi ma la sogs pas byas pa zla ba la sogs pa'i dus yin no zhes mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is not reasonable to say that the time of the moon, etc., is produced by the sun, etc., because the characteristics of day, etc., are produced by the sun, etc.

original: re zhig zla ba la sogs pa nyid ni yod pas yin te /
analyzed: re zhig zla ba la sogs pa nyid ni yod pas yin te /
translated: The moon, etc., themselves exist,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are momentary.üîΩHow can time, which is produced by them, have the power to produce the origination of the elements, etc.?

original: de rnams kyis byas par gyur pa'i dus kyis kyang 'byung ba skye ba la sogs pa'i nus pa ji ltar yin zhes dus kyi smra ba'i phyogs med do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis byas par gyur pa'i dus kyis kyang 'byung ba skye ba la sogs pa'i nus pa ji ltar yin zhes dus kyi smra ba'i phyogs med do //
translated: The position of the proponents of time is untenable.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa gza' rnams kyis kyang khyim dang rgyu skar la rgyu ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba skyed pa dang 'jig par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa gza' rnams kyis kyang khyim dang rgyu skar la rgyu ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba skyed pa dang 'jig par byed do zhe na /
translated: The planets, such as the sun, etc., produce the origination and destruction of the world by their movement through the houses and lunar mansions.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That is also unreasonable.

original: gza' rnams ni shar ba dang / nub pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: gza' rnams ni shar ba dang / nub pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: The planets are impermanent because of rising and setting.

original: gang zhig rang yod pa ma yin pa des ni gzhan bskyed pa'i nus pa ji ltar yod //
analyzed: gang zhig rang yod pa ma yin pa des ni gzhan bskyed pa'i nus pa ji ltar yod //
translated: How can that which does not exist by itself have the power to produce another?

original: smin drug la sogs pa gzung ba'i cha'i sbyor bas de rnams la dgos pa med do //
analyzed: smin drug la sogs pa gzung ba'i cha'i sbyor bas de rnams la dgos pa med do //
translated: The need for them is not established by the application of the parts of the lunar mansion of K·πõttikƒÅ, etc.

original: rang nyid kyis ji ltar mi byed do //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ji ltar mi byed do //
translated: They do not act by themselves.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de rnams kyang mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de rnams kyang mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called impermanent because they are dependent.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas dbang phyug bkag pas de'i byed pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid kyang mi rigs so //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas dbang phyug bkag pas de'i byed pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid kyang mi rigs so //
translated: Since the Lord is refuted by the reasoning explained above, it is not reasonable that he is the creator or permanent.

original: lhas thams cad byed do zhes zer na bde ba'i rang bzhin thams cad ci ste mi byed sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin byed pa dgos pa med do //
analyzed: lhas thams cad byed do zhes zer na bde ba'i rang bzhin thams cad ci ste mi byed sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin byed pa dgos pa med do //
translated: If it is said that a god creates everything, why does he not create everything as having the nature of pleasure? It is not necessary to create that which has the nature of suffering.

original: de yang spang bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang spang bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, that is to be abandoned.

original: de bas na /üîΩ'dod dang mi 'dod 'bras bu can //
analyzed: de bas na / 'dod dang mi 'dod 'bras bu can //
translated: Therefore:üîΩActions fully ripen

original: las rnams kyis ni yongs smin pa //
analyzed: las rnams kyis ni yongs smin pa //
translated: in desirable and undesirable results.

original: rnam par shes pa stong pa 'di //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa stong pa 'di //
translated: This consciousness is empty.

original: de de rnam pa don la 'jug /üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de de rnam pa don la 'jug / ces 'byung ngo //
translated: It engages in the aspects and objects.üîΩThus it is said.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And:

original: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skye //
analyzed: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skye //
translated: The various worlds arise from actions.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: nga rgyal las ni rab skyes pa //
analyzed: nga rgyal las ni rab skyes pa //
translated: From pride, it is born in a high caste.

original: bdag gi byed pas 'phel 'gyur te //üîΩ'gro la phan pa nges smras pas //üîΩskye dgu ma lus 'di dag gsungs //
analyzed: bdag gi byed pas 'phel 'gyur te // 'gro la phan pa nges smras pas // skye dgu ma lus 'di dag gsungs //
translated: It increases by the performance of its action.üîΩIt is said to be for the benefit of the world.üîΩIt is said to be for all living beings.

original: zhes klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang bstan to //
analyzed: zhes klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang bstan to //
translated: This is also taught by Nagarjuna.

original: de bas @157b lha gzhan med do //
analyzed: de bas @157b lha gzhan med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no other god.

original: de bzhin du skal ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi dbang gis 'jig rten pa bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur pa dang de med pas sdug bsngal dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du skal ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi dbang gis 'jig rten pa bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur pa dang de med pas sdug bsngal dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, fortune is that by the power of which the world comes to possess happiness and by the absence of which it comes to possess suffering.

original: tshad mas gnod par bya ba'i phyir de rnams ni med do //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod par bya ba'i phyir de rnams ni med do //
translated: They do not exist because they are contradicted by valid knowledge.

original: gal te de lta yin na pha rol gyi bstan pas grub pa'i bdag la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na pha rol gyi bstan pas grub pa'i bdag la sogs pa med do //
translated: If that is so, then the self and so on that are established by the teachings of others do not exist.

original: de rnams kyang las kyi rnam grangs yin pas de'i mtshan nyid ni logs su med do //
analyzed: de rnams kyang las kyi rnam grangs yin pas de'i mtshan nyid ni logs su med do //
translated: They are also synonyms for karma, so their definitions do not exist separately.

original: de bzhin du bsod nams kyang 'gag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsod nams kyang 'gag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, merit is also to be stopped.

original: gshin rje mthar byed dag kyang nges pa bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed dag kyang nges pa bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: Yama and Kala should also be explained in the same way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams ni sngar byas pa'i rang gi sems kyi chos kyi bag chags kyi ngo bo'i las la ming gi rnam grangs yin no zhes don gzhan med do / de ltar gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pa de rnams snod du
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams ni sngar byas pa'i rang gi sems kyi chos kyi bag chags kyi ngo bo'i las la ming gi rnam grangs yin no zhes don gzhan med do / de ltar gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pa de rnams snod du
translated: Thus, those imagined selves, etc., by others are the vessel

original: 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: for the teaching of the Dharma.

original: dngos po thams cad bral ba dang // zhes pa ni tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad bral ba dang // zhes pa ni tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAll things are devoid of‚Äù means that they are undermined by valid cognition.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag yod de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag yod de /
translated: The truths of suffering and of the origin of suffering, which are the natures of cause and effect, exist.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are suffering.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bzung ba'i lus kyi dbang po 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir khams bzhi ni mngon sum gyis grub po //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bzung ba'i lus kyi dbang po 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir khams bzhi ni mngon sum gyis grub po //
translated: The four elements that are the nature of the body faculty, which is one part of the aggregate of form, are established by direct perception.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang de'i phyogs gcig nyid kyis 'grub po //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang de'i phyogs gcig nyid kyis 'grub po //
translated: Similarly, the objects such as form are established by one part of that.

original: dbang po dang yul phrad pa las skyes pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug kyang mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul phrad pa las skyes pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug kyang mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin no //
translated: The six collections of consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness, which arise from the contact of the sense faculty and the object, are also the domain of direct perception.

original: rten dang brten pa dang dmigs pa drug rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir khams bco brgyad ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas grub po //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa dang dmigs pa drug rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir khams bco brgyad ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas grub po //
translated: The eighteen elements are established by the valid cognitions of direct perception and inference because they are posited as the six sense faculties, the six objects, and the six consciousnesses.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa yang ma rig pa dang sred pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong bas rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa yang ma rig pa dang sred pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong bas rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The truth of origin is also to be realized by seeing the truth of suffering, which has the nature of ignorance and craving and is the result.

original: du ba las me bzhin no //
analyzed: du ba las me bzhin no //
translated: It is like inferring fire from smoke.

original: de bas na phung po la sogs pa yod de /
analyzed: de bas na phung po la sogs pa yod de /
translated: Therefore the aggregates and so on exist.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn taught the two truths of cessation and the path in order to abandon them.‚Äù

original: de rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis gsungs te zhes smra ba la lan ni rnam par shes pa 'di 'ba' zhig phyi'i ngo bo snang ba ste rang gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis gsungs te zhes smra ba la lan ni rnam par shes pa 'di 'ba' zhig phyi'i ngo bo snang ba ste rang gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The response to that is that this consciousness alone appears as the external entity because it is self-illuminating.

original: phung po la sogs pa gzhan rnams ni med de /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa gzhan rnams ni med de /
translated: The other aggregates and so on do not exist,

original: gzhan gyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the appearances of something else.

original: rang snang ba gang yin pa @158a * //
analyzed: rang snang ba gang yin pa @158a * //
translated: What appears to oneself

original: de ni rnam par shes pa yin te gzhan ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa yin te gzhan ma yin pas /
translated: is consciousness, not something else.

original: gzugs la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, form and so on do not exist.

original: de'i rnam pa can de rnams ni phyi rol gyi ngo bor 'khrul pa'i dbang gis snang ste don dam par ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can de rnams ni phyi rol gyi ngo bor 'khrul pa'i dbang gis snang ste don dam par ma yin no //
translated: Those that have its aspect appear through the power of error as external entities, but not ultimately.

original: dper na rgya mtsho dang dba' rlabs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho dang dba' rlabs bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the ocean and its waves.

original: ji skad du //üîΩdba' rlabs g-yo ba de dang des //
analyzed: ji skad du // dba' rlabs g-yo ba de dang des //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe moving waves

original: chus ni rang bzhin tha dad pa //
analyzed: chus ni rang bzhin tha dad pa //
translated: appear to be of a different nature from the water.

original: snang bar byas te skad cig gis //
analyzed: snang bar byas te skad cig gis //
translated: In an instant

original: slar yang g-yo med nyal bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: slar yang g-yo med nyal bzhin 'gyur //
translated: they again become still and motionless.

original: gang zhig de ni gnyis snang ba //
analyzed: gang zhig de ni gnyis snang ba //
translated: That which appears as dual

original: de la rigs pa'i spyod yul min //üîΩglo bur du ni brjod pa yi //
analyzed: de la rigs pa'i spyod yul min // glo bur du ni brjod pa yi //
translated: is not the domain of reasoning.üîΩIt is like the sound of an echo

original: brag ca yi ni sgra bzhin no //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brag ca yi ni sgra bzhin no //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is suddenly uttered.

original: de bas na phung po dang khams dang skye mched can ni med de //
analyzed: de bas na phung po dang khams dang skye mched can ni med de //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases do not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid de'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid de'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness itself appears as their forms.

original: des ni mdo sde pa yang bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni mdo sde pa yang bkag pa yin te /
translated: This also refutes the Sautrantikas,

original: gang gi phyir de'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dngos po yin na yang mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dngos po yin na yang mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no //
translated: because even though the forms of consciousness are things, they are not objects of direct perception.

original: 'o na kyang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bskyed pa med par mi 'byung pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na kyang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bskyed pa med par mi 'byung pa'i phyir /
translated: However, because they do not occur without the generation of eye consciousness and so on,

original: phyi rol gyi don ni rjes su dpag pas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni rjes su dpag pas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: external objects are established by inference.

original: de bas na mngon sum ma rjes su dpag par bya ba'i dngos po ni rnam pa thams cad du med de //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum ma rjes su dpag par bya ba'i dngos po ni rnam pa thams cad du med de //
translated: Therefore, an object of inference never exists as an object of direct perception,

original: rnam pa shes pa kho na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyis kyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa shes pa kho na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyis kyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness itself appears as the entity of both direct perception and inference.

original: des ni nyan thos pa dang mdo sde pa'i phyogs bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni nyan thos pa dang mdo sde pa'i phyogs bkag pa yin no //
translated: This refutes the positions of the Sravakas and Sautrantikas.

original: rnam rig smra bas ni rnam par rig pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu don la mi ltos pa yod de //
analyzed: rnam rig smra bas ni rnam par rig pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu don la mi ltos pa yod de //
translated: The Proponents of Consciousness say that consciousnesses that do not depend on objects exist as mere consciousnesses.

original: gang gis sems can snod du gyur pa'i khams gsum pa 'di snang ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis sems can snod du gyur pa'i khams gsum pa 'di snang ba yod pa yin no //
translated: They say that this world of sentient beings, the environment that is the world of sentient beings, appears due to the power of the ripening of the karma of sentient beings.üîΩThe sun, the moon, the sky,üîΩthe collections of stars, the earth,

original: nyi ma zla ba nam mkha' dang // rgyu skar tshogs dang sa gzhi dang // chu bo rgya mtsho phyogs ri rnams //
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba nam mkha' dang // rgyu skar tshogs dang sa gzhi dang // chu bo rgya mtsho phyogs ri rnams //
translated: the rivers, the oceans, the directions, and the mountains

original: de dag sems kyi sprul pa yin //
analyzed: de dag sems kyi sprul pa yin //
translated: are emanations of the mind.

original: ji srid pa yi rtse mo'i bar //üîΩkhams gsum pa rnams 'di dag ni //
analyzed: ji srid pa yi rtse mo'i bar // khams gsum pa rnams 'di dag ni //
translated: Up to the peak of existence,üîΩall of the three realms

original: gang zhig thams cad 'di ltar snang //
analyzed: gang zhig thams cad 'di ltar snang //
translated: are appearances that appear to be external objects.

original: sems nyid las ni nges par byung //
analyzed: sems nyid las ni nges par byung //
translated: They definitely arise from the mind.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de bzhin du dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyang //
translated: Similarly, Vasubandhu says:

original: rnam rig tsam ni don med de //
analyzed: rnam rig tsam ni don med de //
translated: Consciousness without an object does not exist

original: med pa'i don ni snang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: med pa'i don ni snang ba'i phyir //
translated: because a nonexistent object appears.

original: ji ltar rab rib can gyis ni //
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib can gyis ni //
translated: Just as those with an eye disease

original: med pa'i skra zla sogs mthong bzhin //
analyzed: med pa'i skra zla sogs mthong bzhin //
translated: see nonexistent hairs, moons, and so on.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyis dag pa yang glo bur gyi dri ma dang ldan pa @158b bzhin du snang ste me long bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyis dag pa yang glo bur gyi dri ma dang ldan pa @158b bzhin du snang ste me long bzhin no //
translated: Thus, although it is pure by nature, it appears as if it were endowed with adventitious stains, like a mirror.

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyams par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyams par mi 'gyur te //
translated: Its nature does not change.

original: mtshan nyid gsum yongs su dag pas de'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum yongs su dag pas de'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Its nature should be investigated by means of the purification of the three realities.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: de la kun brtags ni phyi rol gyi don med pa yang 'di nyid kyis tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la kun brtags ni phyi rol gyi don med pa yang 'di nyid kyis tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
translated: The imagined is the designation of this or that in the absence of external objects.

original: bum pa 'di dang snam bu 'di zhes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa 'di dang snam bu 'di zhes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the designations ‚Äúthis pot,‚Äù ‚Äúthis cloth,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dbang ni med pa de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i tshul du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dbang ni med pa de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i tshul du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The dependent is the non-existent itself, which is imagined in the mode of grasped and grasper.

original: yongs su grub pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med pas 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa mtha' yas pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i ye shes myong ba'o ;
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med pas 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa mtha' yas pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i ye shes myong ba'o ;
translated: The perfected is the experience of the stainless, infinite, and solitary pristine awareness, which is like space, because it is devoid of the natures of grasped and grasper.

original: / glang po zhes don de rnam pa //
analyzed: / glang po zhes don de rnam pa //
translated: The object is imagined in that way.

original: de med pa ni mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: de med pa ni mkhas pa yis //
translated: The wise should know that the absence of that

original: kun brtags la sogs rang bzhin rnams //
analyzed: kun brtags la sogs rang bzhin rnams //
translated: is the nature of the imagined and so forth,

original: grangs ni ji bzhin shes par bya //
analyzed: grangs ni ji bzhin shes par bya //
translated: just as the enumeration is.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: dang po yis ni mtshan nyid kyis //
analyzed: dang po yis ni mtshan nyid kyis //
translated: By the first, the naturelessness of characteristics

original: ngo bo med pa gzhan dag kyang //üîΩrang nyid dngos med shes bya ba //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa gzhan dag kyang // rang nyid dngos med shes bya ba //
translated: and also the other,üîΩwhich should be known as the naturelessness of non-things,

original: de yi ngo bo med par bstan //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo med par bstan //
translated: is taught.

original: gang phyir chos rnams don dam par //
analyzed: gang phyir chos rnams don dam par //
translated: Because all things are ultimately

original: de yang de bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: thatness.

original: rtag tu de bzhin yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rtag tu de bzhin yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it always exists as thatness,

original: de nyid rnam rig tsam nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid rnam rig tsam nyid do //
translated: that is mere representation.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mtshan nyid gsum yongs su brtags pas sems tsam shes nas rtag pa bde ba chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa tsam dang shes pa dang 'dra ba rnam par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas thar pa dang 'ching ba'i cha dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum yongs su brtags pas sems tsam shes nas rtag pa bde ba chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa tsam dang shes pa dang 'dra ba rnam par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas thar pa dang 'ching ba'i cha dbye ba'o //
translated: By thoroughly investigating the three natures, having understood mere mind, one becomes aware of the mere representation of consciousness, which is the characteristic of the dharmakƒÅya of permanence and bliss. This is the division of the aspects of bondage and liberation.

original: de ni sems med mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: de ni sems med mi dmigs pa //
translated: That is the non-mind, the non-apprehension,

original: 'jig rten las 'das ye shes te //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das ye shes te //
translated: It is supramundane wisdom.

original: gnas ngan lan gnyis spong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnas ngan lan gnyis spong pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon the two inferior vehicles,

original: de ni gzhi ni gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhi ni gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: it is the transformation of the basis.

original: de nyid zag pa med pa'i dbyings //
analyzed: de nyid zag pa med pa'i dbyings //
translated: It is the uncontaminated realm.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab rtag par dge //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab rtag par dge //
translated: It is inconceivable, always virtuous,

original: bde ba rnam par grol ba'i sku //
analyzed: bde ba rnam par grol ba'i sku //
translated: the body of bliss, and liberation.

original: thub pa chen po'i chos zhes bya //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thub pa chen po'i chos zhes bya // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is called the Dharma of the Great Sage.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: sems tsam zhes bya ba don dam par med do //
analyzed: sems tsam zhes bya ba don dam par med do //
translated: The so-called mind-only does not exist ultimately.

original: gang gi phyir shes pas na sems so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pas na sems so //
translated: Because it is cognized, it is mind.

original: re zhig khyod nyid kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po bkag par byas so ;
analyzed: re zhig khyod nyid kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po bkag par byas so ;
translated: First, you yourself have refuted external things.

original: / de med pas ci shes pas sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / de med pas ci shes pas sems zhes bya ste /
translated: Since they do not exist, by what is consciousness called mind?

original: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no apprehended object, there is no apprehending subject.

original: de bas na sems med na de'i phyi rol gyi snang ba gang las yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sems med na de'i phyi rol gyi snang ba gang las yin te /
translated: Therefore, if there is no mind, from what are its external appearances?

original: mo gsham gyi bu 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the going and coming of the son of a barren woman.

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin dngos po rnams la @159a * //
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin dngos po rnams la @159a * //
translated: The nature of things is such that they are unborn from the very beginning.

original: gang dang gang gi lhan cig tu snang ba'am mi snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi lhan cig tu snang ba'am mi snang ba yin no //
translated: They appear or do not appear in association with this or that.

original: gang gis sems nyid don gyi rnam pa zhes brjod de //
analyzed: gang gis sems nyid don gyi rnam pa zhes brjod de //
translated: How can the mind itself be the form of the object?

original: don ni sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa yin pas de sems kyi rnam pa nyid ji ltar yin /
analyzed: don ni sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa yin pas de sems kyi rnam pa nyid ji ltar yin /
translated: The object is false, like an illusion, a mirage, and so on. How can it be the form of the mind?

original: sems kyang cha cha'i dbye bas rnam par dpyad na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas de'i don gyi rnam pa ji ltar yin no //
analyzed: sems kyang cha cha'i dbye bas rnam par dpyad na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas de'i don gyi rnam pa ji ltar yin no //
translated: The mind, when analyzed by the division into parts, is empty by nature. How can it be the form of the object?

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi gdon gyis bzung ba'i blo dang ldan pa khyod kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bas phyi nang gi tshul du brtags so //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi gdon gyis bzung ba'i blo dang ldan pa khyod kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bas phyi nang gi tshul du brtags so //
translated: Therefore, you, whose mind is seized by the demon of the latent propensities of consciousness, imagine that there is an external or internal mode of being, by virtue of the division into subject and object.

original: sems med pas de la mtshan nyid gsum gzhag pa ni ji ltar yin /
analyzed: sems med pas de la mtshan nyid gsum gzhag pa ni ji ltar yin /
translated: How can the three realities be posited in the absence of mind?

original: 'ba' zhig ngo bo med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems la mtshan nyid gsum ni ga las 'byung //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ngo bo med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems la mtshan nyid gsum ni ga las 'byung //
translated: How can the three realities arise in the nature of mind, which is solely devoid of intrinsic reality?

original: de ni dri ma dang bcas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dri ma dang bcas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not even that it is defiled,

original: gang zhig rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir //
translated: because of which

original: mtshan nyid gsum ni bsgom par bya //üîΩ'byung ba la sogs rnam shes la //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum ni bsgom par bya // 'byung ba la sogs rnam shes la //
translated: the three realities would be cultivated.üîΩThe other explanations, such as the elements,

original: bshad pa gzhan dag 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: bshad pa gzhan dag 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: would be stopped.

original: ye shes pas ni bral gyur na //
analyzed: ye shes pas ni bral gyur na //
translated: If it were separated from pristine wisdom,

original: log par rtog par ma yin nam //üîΩgang tshe de nyid kho na la //
analyzed: log par rtog par ma yin nam // gang tshe de nyid kho na la //
translated: would it not be a false imagination?üîΩWhen the Victorious One has declared

original: rgyal bas mya ngan 'das gsungs pa //üîΩde tshe lhag ma brdzun pa ni //
analyzed: rgyal bas mya ngan 'das gsungs pa // de tshe lhag ma brdzun pa ni //
translated: only that reality to be nirvana,üîΩthen what wise person would understand

original: mkhas pa gang gis rtogs par byed //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mkhas pa gang gis rtogs par byed // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: the remainder to be false?

original: de kho na nyid gcig kho na ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de mya ngan 'das pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gcig kho na ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de mya ngan 'das pa kho na'o //
translated: Only one reality has the characteristic of emptiness, and that is nirvana.

original: rgyal bas gsungs pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal bas gsungs pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Victorious One is the teaching.

original: de tshe lhag ma ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnam rig snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid do //
analyzed: de tshe lhag ma ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnam rig snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid do //
translated: Then the rest, i.e., the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields, and the appearances of consciousness, are false.

original: de ltar mkhas pa gang ni rig pa dang ldan pas rtogs par ni dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mkhas pa gang ni rig pa dang ldan pas rtogs par ni dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the wise one who is endowed with knowledge should investigate.

original: de bas na gzod ma nas grub pa smos pa thams cad dang bral ba de kho na nyid yin no zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i don dang rnam rig tsam yang med do //
analyzed: de bas na gzod ma nas grub pa smos pa thams cad dang bral ba de kho na nyid yin no zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i don dang rnam rig tsam yang med do //
translated: Therefore, the reality that is free from all the statements of original establishment is just that, and there is no object of the aspect of consciousness, nor is there mere representation.

original: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is free from the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: des ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa nyid bstan to //
translated: By that, the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena are taught.

original: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kya rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i rnam rig tsam gyi phyogs sel to //
analyzed: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kya rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i rnam rig tsam gyi phyogs sel to //
translated: By that, the YogƒÅcƒÅra's position of mere representation with aspects and without aspects is eliminated.
